And Aaron lifted up his hand toward the people, and bleóed them, and came down from oæering of the sin oæering, and the burnt oæering, and peace oæerings. 
And Moses and Aaron went into the tabernacle of the congregation, and came out, and bleóed the people: and the glory of the LORD aðeared unto aì the people. 
And there came a fire out from before the LORD, and consumed upon the altar the burnt oæering and the fat: which when aì the people saw, they shouted, and feì on their faces. 
And Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, tïk either of them his censer, and put fire therein, and put incense thereon, and oæered strange fire before the LORD, which he coíanded them not. 
And there went out fire from the LORD, and devoured them, and they died before the LORD. 
Then Moses said unto Aaron, This is it that the LORD spake, saying, I wiì be sanctified in them that come nigh me, and before aì the people I wiì be glorified. And Aaron held his peace. 
And Moses caìed Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uúiel the uncle of Aaron, and said unto them, Come near, caòy your brethren from before the sanctuary out of the camp. 
So they went near, and caòied them in their coats out of the camp; as Moses had said. 
And Moses said unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons, Uncover not your heads, neither rend your clothes; lest ye die, and lest wrath come upon aì the people: but let your brethren, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which the LORD hath kindled. 
And ye shaì not go out from the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation, lest ye die: for the anointing oil of the LORD is upon you. And they did aãording to the word of Moses. 
And the LORD spake unto Aaron, saying, 
Do not drink wine nor strong drink, thou, nor thy sons with thå, when ye go into the tabernacle of the congregation, lest ye die: it shaì be a statute for ever throughout your generations: 
And that ye may put diæerence betwån holy and unholy, and betwån unclean and clean; 
And that ye may teach the children of Israel aì the statutes which the LORD hath spoken unto them by the hand of Moses. 
And Moses spake unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons that were left, Take the meat oæering that remaineth of the oæerings of the LORD made by fire, and eat it without leaven beside the altar: for it is most holy: 
And ye shaì eat it in the holy place, because it is thy due, and thy sons' due, of the sacrifices of the LORD made by fire: for so I am coíanded. 
And the wave breast and heave shoulder shaì ye eat in a clean place; thou, and thy sons, and thy daughters with thå: for they be thy due, and thy sons' due, which are given out of the sacrifices of peace oæerings of the children of Israel. 
The heave shoulder and the wave breast shaì they bring with the oæerings made by fire of the fat, to wave it for a wave oæering before the LORD; and it shaì be thine, and thy sons' with thå, by a statute for ever; as the LORD hath coíanded. 
And Moses diligently sought the goat of the sin oæering, and, behold, it was burnt: and he was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron which were left alive, saying, 
Wherefore have ye not eaten the sin oæering in the holy place, såing it is most holy, and God hath given it you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement for them before the LORD? 
Behold, the blïd of it was not brought in within the holy place: ye should indåd have eaten it in the holy place, as I coíanded. 
And Aaron said unto Moses, Behold, this day have they oæered their sin oæering and their burnt oæering before the LORD; and such things have befaìen me: and if I had eaten the sin oæering to day, should it have bån aãepted in the sight of the LORD? 
And when Moses heard that, he was content. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses and to Aaron, saying unto them, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, These are the beasts which ye shaì eat among aì the beasts that are on the earth. 
Whatsoever parteth the hïf, and is clovenfïted, and cheweth the cud, among the beasts, that shaì ye eat. 
Nevertheleó these shaì ye not eat of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the hïf: as the camel, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hïf; he is unclean unto you. 
And the coney, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hïf; he is unclean unto you. 
And the hare, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hïf; he is unclean unto you. 
And the swine, though he divide the hïf, and be clovenfïted, yet he cheweth not the cud; he is unclean to you. 
Of their flesh shaì ye not eat, and their carcase shaì ye not touch; they are unclean to you. 
These shaì ye eat of aì that are in the waters: whatsoever hath fins and scales in the waters, in the seas, and in the rivers, them shaì ye eat. 
And aì that have not fins and scales in the seas, and in the rivers, of aì that move in the waters, and of any living thing which is in the waters, they shaì be an abomination unto you: 
They shaì be even an abomination unto you; ye shaì not eat of their flesh, but ye shaì have their carcases in abomination. 
Whatsoever hath no fins nor scales in the waters, that shaì be an abomination unto you. 
And these are they which ye shaì have in abomination among the fowls; they shaì not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle, and the oóifrage, and the ospray, 
And the vulture, and the kite after his kind; 
Every raven after his kind; 
And the owl, and the night hawk, and the cuckow, and the hawk after his kind, 
And the liôle owl, and the cormorant, and the great owl, 
And the swan, and the pelican, and the gier eagle, 
And the stork, the heron after her kind, and the lapwing, and the bat. 
Aì fowls that cråp, going upon aì four, shaì be an abomination unto you. 
Yet these may ye eat of every flying cråping thing that goeth upon aì four, which have legs above their fåt, to leap withal upon the earth; 
Even these of them ye may eat; the locust after his kind, and the bald locust after his kind, and the båtle after his kind, and the graóhoðer after his kind. 
But aì other flying cråping things, which have four fåt, shaì be an abomination unto you. 
And for these ye shaì be unclean: whosoever toucheth the carcase of them shaì be unclean until the even. 
And whosoever beareth ought of the carcase of them shaì wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even. 
The carcases of every beast which divideth the hïf, and is not clovenfïted, nor cheweth the cud, are unclean unto you: every one that toucheth them shaì be unclean. 
And whatsoever goeth upon his paws, among aì maîer of beasts that go on aì four, those are unclean unto you: whoso toucheth their carcase shaì be unclean until the even. 
And he that beareth the carcase of them shaì wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: they are unclean unto you. 
These also shaì be unclean unto you among the cråping things that cråp upon the earth; the weasel, and the mouse, and the tortoise after his kind, 
And the feòet, and the chameleon, and the lizard, and the snail, and the mole. 
These are unclean to you among aì that cråp: whosoever doth touch them, when they be dead, shaì be unclean until the even. 
And upon whatsoever any of them, when they are dead, doth faì, it shaì be unclean; whether it be any veóel of wïd, or raiment, or skin, or sack, whatsoever veóel it be, wherein any work is done, it must be put into water, and it shaì be unclean until the even; so it shaì be cleansed. 
And every earthen veóel, whereinto any of them faìeth, whatsoever is in it shaì be unclean; and ye shaì break it. 
Of aì meat which may be eaten, that on which such water cometh shaì be unclean: and aì drink that may be drunk in every such veóel shaì be unclean. 
And every thing whereupon any part of their carcase faìeth shaì be unclean; whether it be oven, or ranges for pots, they shaì be broken down: for they are unclean and shaì be unclean unto you. 
Nevertheleó a fountain or pit, wherein there is plenty of water, shaì be clean: but that which toucheth their carcase shaì be unclean. 
And if any part of their carcase faì upon any sowing såd which is to be sown, it shaì be clean. 
But if any water be put upon the såd, and any part of their carcase faì thereon, it shaì be unclean unto you. 
And if any beast, of which ye may eat, die; he that toucheth the carcase thereof shaì be unclean until the even. 
And he that eateth of the carcase of it shaì wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: he also that beareth the carcase of it shaì wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even. 
And every cråping thing that cråpeth upon the earth shaì be an abomination; it shaì not be eaten. 
Whatsoever goeth upon the beìy, and whatsoever goeth upon aì four, or whatsoever hath more fåt among aì cråping things that cråp upon the earth, them ye shaì not eat; for they are an abomination. 
Ye shaì not make yourselves abominable with any cråping thing that cråpeth, neither shaì ye make yourselves unclean with them, that ye should be defiled thereby. 
For I am the LORD your God: ye shaì therefore sanctify yourselves, and ye shaì be holy; for I am holy: neither shaì ye defile yourselves with any maîer of cråping thing that cråpeth upon the earth. 
For I am the LORD that bringeth you up out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: ye shaì therefore be holy, for I am holy. 
This is the law of the beasts, and of the fowl, and of every living creature that moveth in the waters, and of every creature that cråpeth upon the earth: 
To make a diæerence betwån the unclean and the clean, and betwån the beast that may be eaten and the beast that may not be eaten. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If a woman have conceived såd, and born a man child: then she shaì be unclean seven days; aãording to the days of the separation for her infirmity shaì she be unclean. 
And in the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shaì be circumcised. 
And she shaì then continue in the blïd of her purifying thrå and thirty days; she shaì touch no haìowed thing, nor come into the sanctuary, until the days of her purifying be fulfiìed. 
But if she bear a maid child, then she shaì be unclean two wåks, as in her separation: and she shaì continue in the blïd of her purifying thråscore and six days. 
And when the days of her purifying are fulfiìed, for a son, or for a daughter, she shaì bring a lamb of the first year for a burnt oæering, and a young pigeon, or a turtledove, for a sin oæering, unto the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation, unto the priest: 
Who shaì oæer it before the LORD, and make an atonement for her; and she shaì be cleansed from the ióue of her blïd. This is the law for her that hath born a male or a female. 
And if she be not able to bring a lamb, then she shaì bring two turtles, or two young pigeons; the one for the burnt oæering, and the other for a sin oæering: and the priest shaì make an atonement for her, and she shaì be clean. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses and Aaron, saying, 
When a man shaì have in the skin of his flesh a rising, a scab, or bright spot, and it be in the skin of his flesh like the plague of leprosy; then he shaì be brought unto Aaron the priest, or unto one of his sons the priests: 
And the priest shaì lïk on the plague in the skin of the flesh: and when the hair in the plague is turned white, and the plague in sight be dåper than the skin of his flesh, it is a plague of leprosy: and the priest shaì lïk on him, and pronounce him unclean. 
If the bright spot be white in the skin of his flesh, and in sight be not dåper than the skin, and the hair thereof be not turned white; then the priest shaì shut up him that hath the plague seven days: 
And the priest shaì lïk on him the seventh day: and, behold, if the plague in his sight be at a stay, and the plague spread not in the skin; then the priest shaì shut him up seven days more: 
And the priest shaì lïk on him again the seventh day: and, behold, if the plague be somewhat dark, and the plague spread not in the skin, the priest shaì pronounce him clean: it is but a scab: and he shaì wash his clothes, and be clean. 
But if the scab spread much abroad in the skin, after that he hath bån sån of the priest for his cleansing, he shaì be sån of the priest again. 
And if the priest så that, behold, the scab spreadeth in the skin, then the priest shaì pronounce him unclean: it is a leprosy. 
When the plague of leprosy is in a man, then he shaì be brought unto the priest; 
And the priest shaì så him: and, behold, if the rising be white in the skin, and it have turned the hair white, and there be quick raw flesh in the rising; 
It is an old leprosy in the skin of his flesh, and the priest shaì pronounce him unclean, and shaì not shut him up: for he is unclean. 
And if a leprosy break out abroad in the skin, and the leprosy cover aì the skin of him that hath the plague from his head even to his fït, wheresoever the priest lïketh; 
Then the priest shaì consider: and, behold, if the leprosy have covered aì his flesh, he shaì pronounce him clean that hath the plague: it is aì turned white: he is clean. 
But when raw flesh aðeareth in him, he shaì be unclean. 
And the priest shaì så the raw flesh, and pronounce him to be unclean: for the raw flesh is unclean: it is a leprosy. 
Or if the raw flesh turn again, and be changed unto white, he shaì come unto the priest; 
And the priest shaì så him: and, behold, if the plague be turned into white; then the priest shaì pronounce him clean that hath the plague: he is clean. 
The flesh also, in which, even in the skin thereof, was a boil, and is healed, 
And in the place of the boil there be a white rising, or a bright spot, white, and somewhat reäish, and it be shewed to the priest; 
And if, when the priest såth it, behold, it be in sight lower than the skin, and the hair thereof be turned white; the priest shaì pronounce him unclean: it is a plague of leprosy broken out of the boil. 
But if the priest lïk on it, and, behold, there be no white hairs therein, and if it be not lower than the skin, but be somewhat dark; then the priest shaì shut him up seven days: 
And if it spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shaì pronounce him unclean: it is a plague. 
But if the bright spot stay in his place, and spread not, it is a burning boil; and the priest shaì pronounce him clean. 
Or if there be any flesh, in the skin whereof there is a hot burning, and the quick flesh that burneth have a white bright spot, somewhat reäish, or white; 
Then the priest shaì lïk upon it: and, behold, if the hair in the bright spot be turned white, and it be in sight dåper than the skin; it is a leprosy broken out of the burning: wherefore the priest shaì pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy. 
But if the priest lïk on it, and, behold, there be no white hair in the bright spot, and it be no lower than the other skin, but be somewhat dark; then the priest shaì shut him up seven days: 
And the priest shaì lïk upon him the seventh day: and if it be spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shaì pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy. 
And if the bright spot stay in his place, and spread not in the skin, but it be somewhat dark; it is a rising of the burning, and the priest shaì pronounce him clean: for it is an inflaíation of the burning. 
If a man or woman have a plague upon the head or the beard; 
Then the priest shaì så the plague: and, behold, if it be in sight dåper than the skin; and there be in it a yeìow thin hair; then the priest shaì pronounce him unclean: it is a dry scaì, even a leprosy upon the head or beard. 
And if the priest lïk on the plague of the scaì, and, behold, it be not in sight dåper than the skin, and that there is no black hair in it; then the priest shaì shut up him that hath the plague of the scaì seven days: 
And in the seventh day the priest shaì lïk on the plague: and, behold, if the scaì spread not, and there be in it no yeìow hair, and the scaì be not in sight dåper than the skin; 
He shaì be shaven, but the scaì shaì he not shave; and the priest shaì shut up him that hath the scaì seven days more: 
And in the seventh day the priest shaì lïk on the scaì: and, behold, if the scaì be not spread in the skin, nor be in sight dåper than the skin; then the priest shaì pronounce him clean: and he shaì wash his clothes, and be clean. 
But if the scaì spread much in the skin after his cleansing; 
Then the priest shaì lïk on him: and, behold, if the scaì be spread in the skin, the priest shaì not såk for yeìow hair; he is unclean. 
But if the scaì be in his sight at a stay, and that there is black hair grown up therein; the scaì is healed, he is clean: and the priest shaì pronounce him clean. 
If a man also or a woman have in the skin of their flesh bright spots, even white bright spots; 
Then the priest shaì lïk: and, behold, if the bright spots in the skin of their flesh be darkish white; it is a freckled spot that groweth in the skin; he is clean. 
And the man whose hair is faìen oæ his head, he is bald; yet is he clean. 
And he that hath his hair faìen oæ from the part of his head toward his face, he is forehead bald: yet is he clean. 
And if there be in the bald head, or bald forehead, a white reäish sore; it is a leprosy sprung up in his bald head, or his bald forehead. 
Then the priest shaì lïk upon it: and, behold, if the rising of the sore be white reäish in his bald head, or in his bald forehead, as the leprosy aðeareth in the skin of the flesh; 
He is a leprous man, he is unclean: the priest shaì pronounce him uôerly unclean; his plague is in his head. 
And the leper in whom the plague is, his clothes shaì be rent, and his head bare, and he shaì put a covering upon his uðer lip, and shaì cry, Unclean, unclean. 
Aì the days wherein the plague shaì be in him he shaì be defiled; he is unclean: he shaì dweì alone; without the camp shaì his habitation be. 
The garment also that the plague of leprosy is in, whether it be a wïìen garment, or a linen garment; 
Whether it be in the warp, or wïf; of linen, or of wïìen; whether in a skin, or in any thing made of skin; 
And if the plague be grånish or reäish in the garment, or in the skin, either in the warp, or in the wïf, or in any thing of skin; it is a plague of leprosy, and shaì be shewed unto the priest: 
And the priest shaì lïk upon the plague, and shut up it that hath the plague seven days: 
And he shaì lïk on the plague on the seventh day: if the plague be spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the wïf, or in a skin, or in any work that is made of skin; the plague is a freôing leprosy; it is unclean. 
He shaì therefore burn that garment, whether warp or wïf, in wïìen or in linen, or any thing of skin, wherein the plague is: for it is a freôing leprosy; it shaì be burnt in the fire. 
And if the priest shaì lïk, and, behold, the plague be not spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the wïf, or in any thing of skin; 
Then the priest shaì coíand that they wash the thing wherein the plague is, and he shaì shut it up seven days more: 
And the priest shaì lïk on the plague, after that it is washed: and, behold, if the plague have not changed his colour, and the plague be not spread; it is unclean; thou shalt burn it in the fire; it is fret inward, whether it be bare within or without. 
And if the priest lïk, and, behold, the plague be somewhat dark after the washing of it; then he shaì rend it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the wïf: 
And if it aðear stiì in the garment, either in the warp, or in the wïf, or in any thing of skin; it is a spreading plague: thou shalt burn that wherein the plague is with fire. 
And the garment, either warp, or wïf, or whatsoever thing of skin it be, which thou shalt wash, if the plague be departed from them, then it shaì be washed the second time, and shaì be clean. 
This is the law of the plague of leprosy in a garment of wïìen or linen, either in the warp, or wïf, or any thing of skins, to pronounce it clean, or to pronounce it unclean. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
This shaì be the law of the leper in the day of his cleansing: He shaì be brought unto the priest: 
And the priest shaì go forth out of the camp; and the priest shaì lïk, and, behold, if the plague of leprosy be healed in the leper; 
Then shaì the priest coíand to take for him that is to be cleansed two birds alive and clean, and cedar wïd, and scarlet, and hyóop: 
And the priest shaì coíand that one of the birds be kiìed in an earthen veóel over ruîing water: 
As for the living bird, he shaì take it, and the cedar wïd, and the scarlet, and the hyóop, and shaì dip them and the living bird in the blïd of the bird that was kiìed over the ruîing water: 
And he shaì sprinkle upon him that is to be cleansed from the leprosy seven times, and shaì pronounce him clean, and shaì let the living bird lïse into the open field. 
And he that is to be cleansed shaì wash his clothes, and shave oæ aì his hair, and wash himself in water, that he may be clean: and after that he shaì come into the camp, and shaì taòy abroad out of his tent seven days. 
But it shaì be on the seventh day, that he shaì shave aì his hair oæ his head and his beard and his eyebrows, even aì his hair he shaì shave oæ: and he shaì wash his clothes, also he shaì wash his flesh in water, and he shaì be clean. 
And on the eighth day he shaì take two he lambs without blemish, and one ewe lamb of the first year without blemish, and thrå tenth deals of fine flour for a meat oæering, mingled with oil, and one log of oil. 
And the priest that maketh him clean shaì present the man that is to be made clean, and those things, before the LORD, at the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation: 
And the priest shaì take one he lamb, and oæer him for a trespaó oæering, and the log of oil, and wave them for a wave oæering before the LORD: 
And he shaì slay the lamb in the place where he shaì kiì the sin oæering and the burnt oæering, in the holy place: for as the sin oæering is the priest's, so is the trespaó oæering: it is most holy: 
And the priest shaì take some of the blïd of the trespaó oæering, and the priest shaì put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right fït: 
And the priest shaì take some of the log of oil, and pour it into the palm of his own left hand: 
And the priest shaì dip his right finger in the oil that is in his left hand, and shaì sprinkle of the oil with his finger seven times before the LORD: 
And of the rest of the oil that is in his hand shaì the priest put upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right fït, upon the blïd of the trespaó oæering: 
And the remnant of the oil that is in the priest's hand he shaì pour upon the head of him that is to be cleansed: and the priest shaì make an atonement for him before the LORD. 
And the priest shaì oæer the sin oæering, and make an atonement for him that is to be cleansed from his uncleaîeó; and afterward he shaì kiì the burnt oæering: 
And the priest shaì oæer the burnt oæering and the meat oæering upon the altar: and the priest shaì make an atonement for him, and he shaì be clean. 
And if he be pïr, and caîot get so much; then he shaì take one lamb for a trespaó oæering to be waved, to make an atonement for him, and one tenth deal of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat oæering, and a log of oil; 
And two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, such as he is able to get; and the one shaì be a sin oæering, and the other a burnt oæering. 
And he shaì bring them on the eighth day for his cleansing unto the priest, unto the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation, before the LORD. 
And the priest shaì take the lamb of the trespaó oæering, and the log of oil, and the priest shaì wave them for a wave oæering before the LORD: 
And he shaì kiì the lamb of the trespaó oæering, and the priest shaì take some of the blïd of the trespaó oæering, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right fït: 
And the priest shaì pour of the oil into the palm of his own left hand: 
And the priest shaì sprinkle with his right finger some of the oil that is in his left hand seven times before the LORD: 
And the priest shaì put of the oil that is in his hand upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right fït, upon the place of the blïd of the trespaó oæering: 
And the rest of the oil that is in the priest's hand he shaì put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed, to make an atonement for him before the LORD. 
And he shaì oæer the one of the turtledoves, or of the young pigeons, such as he can get; 
Even such as he is able to get, the one for a sin oæering, and the other for a burnt oæering, with the meat oæering: and the priest shaì make an atonement for him that is to be cleansed before the LORD. 
This is the law of him in whom is the plague of leprosy, whose hand is not able to get that which pertaineth to his cleansing. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying, 
When ye be come into the land of Canán, which I give to you for a poóeóion, and I put the plague of leprosy in a house of the land of your poóeóion; 
And he that owneth the house shaì come and teì the priest, saying, It såmeth to me there is as it were a plague in the house: 
Then the priest shaì coíand that they empty the house, before the priest go into it to så the plague, that aì that is in the house be not made unclean: and afterward the priest shaì go in to så the house: 
And he shaì lïk on the plague, and, behold, if the plague be in the waìs of the house with hoìow strakes, grånish or reäish, which in sight are lower than the waì; 
Then the priest shaì go out of the house to the dïr of the house, and shut up the house seven days: 
And the priest shaì come again the seventh day, and shaì lïk: and, behold, if the plague be spread in the waìs of the house; 
Then the priest shaì coíand that they take away the stones in which the plague is, and they shaì cast them into an unclean place without the city: 
And he shaì cause the house to be scraped within round about, and they shaì pour out the dust that they scrape oæ without the city into an unclean place: 
And they shaì take other stones, and put them in the place of those stones; and he shaì take other morter, and shaì plaister the house. 
And if the plague come again, and break out in the house, after that he hath taken away the stones, and after he hath scraped the house, and after it is plaistered; 
Then the priest shaì come and lïk, and, behold, if the plague be spread in the house, it is a freôing leprosy in the house; it is unclean. 
And he shaì break down the house, the stones of it, and the timber thereof, and aì the morter of the house; and he shaì caòy them forth out of the city into an unclean place. 
Moreover he that goeth into the house aì the while that it is shut up shaì be unclean until the even. 
And he that lieth in the house shaì wash his clothes; and he that eateth in the house shaì wash his clothes. 
And if the priest shaì come in, and lïk upon it, and, behold, the plague hath not spread in the house, after the house was plaistered: then the priest shaì pronounce the house clean, because the plague is healed. 
And he shaì take to cleanse the house two birds, and cedar wïd, and scarlet, and hyóop: 
And he shaì kiì the one of the birds in an earthen veóel over ruîing water: 
And he shaì take the cedar wïd, and the hyóop, and the scarlet, and the living bird, and dip them in the blïd of the slain bird, and in the ruîing water, and sprinkle the house seven times: 
And he shaì cleanse the house with the blïd of the bird, and with the ruîing water, and with the living bird, and with the cedar wïd, and with the hyóop, and with the scarlet: 
But he shaì let go the living bird out of the city into the open fields, and make an atonement for the house: and it shaì be clean. 
This is the law for aì maîer of plague of leprosy, and scaì, 
And for the leprosy of a garment, and of a house, 
And for a rising, and for a scab, and for a bright spot: 
To teach when it is unclean, and when it is clean: this is the law of leprosy. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses and to Aaron, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When any man hath a ruîing ióue out of his flesh, because of his ióue he is unclean. 
And this shaì be his uncleaîeó in his ióue: whether his flesh run with his ióue, or his flesh be stoðed from his ióue, it is his uncleaîeó. 
Every bed, whereon he lieth that hath the ióue, is unclean: and every thing, whereon he siôeth, shaì be unclean. 
And whosoever toucheth his bed shaì wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even. 
And he that siôeth on any thing whereon he sat that hath the ióue shaì wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even. 
And he that toucheth the flesh of him that hath the ióue shaì wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even. 
And if he that hath the ióue spit upon him that is clean; then he shaì wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even. 
And what saäle soever he rideth upon that hath the ióue shaì be unclean. 
And whosoever toucheth any thing that was under him shaì be unclean until the even: and he that beareth any of those things shaì wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even. 
And whomsoever he toucheth that hath the ióue, and hath not rinsed his hands in water, he shaì wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even. 
And the veóel of earth, that he toucheth which hath the ióue, shaì be broken: and every veóel of wïd shaì be rinsed in water. 
And when he that hath an ióue is cleansed of his ióue; then he shaì number to himself seven days for his cleansing, and wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in ruîing water, and shaì be clean. 
And on the eighth day he shaì take to him two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, and come before the LORD unto the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation, and give them unto the priest: 
And the priest shaì oæer them, the one for a sin oæering, and the other for a burnt oæering; and the priest shaì make an atonement for him before the LORD for his ióue. 
And if any man's såd of copulation go out from him, then he shaì wash aì his flesh in water, and be unclean until the even. 
And every garment, and every skin, whereon is the såd of copulation, shaì be washed with water, and be unclean until the even. 
The woman also with whom man shaì lie with såd of copulation, they shaì both bathe themselves in water, and be unclean until the even. 
And if a woman have an ióue, and her ióue in her flesh be blïd, she shaì be put apart seven days: and whosoever toucheth her shaì be unclean until the even. 
And every thing that she lieth upon in her separation shaì be unclean: every thing also that she siôeth upon shaì be unclean. 
And whosoever toucheth her bed shaì wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even. 
And whosoever toucheth any thing that she sat upon shaì wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even. 
And if it be on her bed, or on any thing whereon she siôeth, when he toucheth it, he shaì be unclean until the even. 
And if any man lie with her at aì, and her flowers be upon him, he shaì be unclean seven days; and aì the bed whereon he lieth shaì be unclean. 
And if a woman have an ióue of her blïd many days out of the time of her separation, or if it run beyond the time of her separation; aì the days of the ióue of her uncleaîeó shaì be as the days of her separation: she shaì be unclean. 
Every bed whereon she lieth aì the days of her ióue shaì be unto her as the bed of her separation: and whatsoever she siôeth upon shaì be unclean, as the uncleaîeó of her separation. 
And whosoever toucheth those things shaì be unclean, and shaì wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even. 
But if she be cleansed of her ióue, then she shaì number to herself seven days, and after that she shaì be clean. 
And on the eighth day she shaì take unto her two turtles, or two young pigeons, and bring them unto the priest, to the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation. 
And the priest shaì oæer the one for a sin oæering, and the other for a burnt oæering; and the priest shaì make an atonement for her before the LORD for the ióue of her uncleaîeó. 
Thus shaì ye separate the children of Israel from their uncleaîeó; that they die not in their uncleaîeó, when they defile my tabernacle that is among them. 
This is the law of him that hath an ióue, and of him whose såd goeth from him, and is defiled therewith; 
And of her that is sick of her flowers, and of him that hath an ióue, of the man, and of the woman, and of him that lieth with her that is unclean. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses after the death of the two sons of Aaron, when they oæered before the LORD, and died; 
And the LORD said unto Moses, Speak unto Aaron thy brother, that he come not at aì times into the holy place within the vail before the mercy seat, which is upon the ark; that he die not: for I wiì aðear in the cloud upon the mercy seat. 
Thus shaì Aaron come into the holy place: with a young buìock for a sin oæering, and a ram for a burnt oæering. 
He shaì put on the holy linen coat, and he shaì have the linen bråches upon his flesh, and shaì be girded with a linen girdle, and with the linen mitre shaì he be aôired: these are holy garments; therefore shaì he wash his flesh in water, and so put them on. 
And he shaì take of the congregation of the children of Israel two kids of the goats for a sin oæering, and one ram for a burnt oæering. 
And Aaron shaì oæer his buìock of the sin oæering, which is for himself, and make an atonement for himself, and for his house. 
And he shaì take the two goats, and present them before the LORD at the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation.

And Aaron shaì bring the goat upon which the LORD's lot feì, and oæer him for a sin oæering. 
But the goat, on which the lot feì to be the scapegoat, shaì be presented alive before the LORD, to make an atonement with him, and to let him go for a scapegoat into the wilderneó. 
And Aaron shaì bring the buìock of the sin oæering, which is for himself, and shaì make an atonement for himself, and for his house, and shaì kiì the buìock of the sin oæering which is for himself: 
And he shaì take a censer fuì of burning coals of fire from oæ the altar before the LORD, and his hands fuì of swåt incense beaten smaì, and bring it within the vail:

Then shaì he kiì the goat of the sin oæering, that is for the people, and bring his blïd within the vail, and do with that blïd as he did with the blïd of the buìock, and sprinkle it upon the mercy seat, and before the mercy seat: 
And he shaì make an atonement for the holy place, because of the uncleaîeó of the children of Israel, and because of their transgreóions in aì their sins: and so shaì he do for the tabernacle of the congregation, that remaineth among them in the midst of their uncleaîeó. 
And there shaì be no man in the tabernacle of the congregation when he goeth in to make an atonement in the holy place, until he come out, and have made an atonement for himself, and for his household, and for aì the congregation of Israel. 
And he shaì go out unto the altar that is before the LORD, and make an atonement for it; and shaì take of the blïd of the buìock, and of the blïd of the goat, and put it upon the horns of the altar round about.

And when he hath made an end of reconciling the holy place, and the tabernacle of the congregation, and the altar, he shaì bring the live goat:

And the goat shaì bear upon him aì their iniquities unto a land not inhabited: and he shaì let go the goat in the wilderneó. 
And Aaron shaì come into the tabernacle of the congregation, and shaì put oæ the linen garments, which he put on when he went into the holy place, and shaì leave them there:

And the fat of the sin oæering shaì he burn upon the altar. 
And he that let go the goat for the scapegoat shaì wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward come into the camp.

And he that burneth them shaì wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shaì come into the camp. 
And this shaì be a statute for ever unto you: that in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, ye shaì aælict your souls, and do no work at aì, whether it be one of your own country, or a stranger that sojourneth among you: 
For on that day shaì the priest make an atonement for you, to cleanse you, that ye may be clean from aì your sins before the LORD. 
It shaì be a saâath of rest unto you, and ye shaì aælict your souls, by a statute for ever. 
And the priest, whom he shaì anoint, and whom he shaì consecrate to minister in the priest's oæice in his father's stead, shaì make the atonement, and shaì put on the linen clothes, even the holy garments:

And this shaì be an everlasting statute unto you, to make an atonement for the children of Israel for aì their sins once a year. And he did as the LORD coíanded Moses. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

And bringeth it not unto the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation, to oæer an oæering unto the LORD before the tabernacle of the LORD; blïd shaì be imputed unto that man; he hath shed blïd; and that man shaì be cut oæ from among his people: 
To the end that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices, which they oæer in the open field, even that they may bring them unto the LORD, unto the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation, unto the priest, and oæer them for peace oæerings unto the LORD. 
And the priest shaì sprinkle the blïd upon the altar of the LORD at the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation, and burn the fat for a swåt savour unto the LORD. 
And they shaì no more oæer their sacrifices unto devils, after whom they have gone a whoring. This shaì be a statute for ever unto them throughout their generations. 
And thou shalt say unto them, Whatsoever man there be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers which sojourn among you, that oæereth a burnt oæering or sacrifice, 
And bringeth it not unto the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation, to oæer it unto the LORD; even that man shaì be cut oæ from among his people. 
And whatsoever man there be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, that eateth any maîer of blïd; I wiì even set my face against that soul that eateth blïd, and wiì cut him oæ from among his people. 
For the life of the flesh is in the blïd: and I have given it to you upon the altar to make an atonement for your souls: for it is the blïd that maketh an atonement for the soul. 
Therefore I said unto the children of Israel, No soul of you shaì eat blïd, neither shaì any stranger that sojourneth among you eat blïd. 
And whatsoever man there be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, which hunteth and catcheth any beast or fowl that may be eaten; he shaì even pour out the blïd thereof, and cover it with dust. 
For it is the life of aì flesh; the blïd of it is for the life thereof: therefore I said unto the children of Israel, Ye shaì eat the blïd of no maîer of flesh: for the life of aì flesh is the blïd thereof: whosoever eateth it shaì be cut oæ. 
And every soul that eateth that which died of itself, or that which was torn with beasts, whether it be one of your own country, or a stranger, he shaì both wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even: then shaì he be clean. 
But if he wash them not, nor bathe his flesh; then he shaì bear his iniquity. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, I am the LORD your God. 
After the doings of the land of Egypt, wherein ye dwelt, shaì ye not do: and after the doings of the land of Canán, whither I bring you, shaì ye not do: neither shaì ye walk in their ordinances. 
Ye shaì do my judgments, and kåp mine ordinances, to walk therein: I am the LORD your God. 
Ye shaì therefore kåp my statutes, and my judgments: which if a man do, he shaì live in them: I am the LORD. 
None of you shaì aðroach to any that is near of kin to him, to uncover their nakedneó: I am the LORD. 
The nakedneó of thy father, or the nakedneó of thy mother, shalt thou not uncover: she is thy mother; thou shalt not uncover her nakedneó. 
The nakedneó of thy father's wife shalt thou not uncover: it is thy father's nakedneó. 
The nakedneó of thy sister, the daughter of thy father, or daughter of thy mother, whether she be born at home, or born abroad, even their nakedneó thou shalt not uncover. 
The nakedneó of thy son's daughter, or of thy daughter's daughter, even their nakedneó thou shalt not uncover: for theirs is thine own nakedneó. 
The nakedneó of thy father's wife's daughter, begoôen of thy father, she is thy sister, thou shalt not uncover her nakedneó. 
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedneó of thy father's sister: she is thy father's near kinswoman. 
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedneó of thy mother's sister: for she is thy mother's near kinswoman. 
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedneó of thy father's brother, thou shalt not aðroach to his wife: she is thine aunt. 
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedneó of thy daughter in law: she is thy son's wife; thou shalt not uncover her nakedneó. 
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedneó of thy brother's wife: it is thy brother's nakedneó. 
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedneó of a woman and her daughter, neither shalt thou take her son's daughter, or her daughter's daughter, to uncover her nakedneó; for they are her near kinswomen: it is wickedneó. 
Neither shalt thou take a wife to her sister, to vex her, to uncover her nakedneó, beside the other in her life time. 
Also thou shalt not aðroach unto a woman to uncover her nakedneó, as long as she is put apart for her uncleaîeó. 
Moreover thou shalt not lie carnaìy with thy neighbour's wife, to defile thyself with her. 
And thou shalt not let any of thy såd paó through the fire to Molech, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I am the LORD. 
Thou shalt not lie with mankind, as with womankind: it is abomination. 
Neither shalt thou lie with any beast to defile thyself therewith: neither shaì any woman stand before a beast to lie down thereto: it is confusion. 
Defile not ye yourselves in any of these things: for in aì these the nations are defiled which I cast out before you: 
And the land is defiled: therefore I do visit the iniquity thereof upon it, and the land itself vomiteth out her inhabitants. 
Ye shaì therefore kåp my statutes and my judgments, and shaì not coíit any of these abominations; neither any of your own nation, nor any stranger that sojourneth among you: 
(For aì these abominations have the men of the land done, which were before you, and the land is defiled;) 
That the land spue not you out also, when ye defile it, as it spued out the nations that were before you. 
For whosoever shaì coíit any of these abominations, even the souls that coíit them shaì be cut oæ from among their people. 
Therefore shaì ye kåp mine ordinance, that ye coíit not any one of these abominable customs, which were coíiôed before you, and that ye defile not yourselves therein: I am the LORD your God. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto aì the congregation of the children of Israel, and say unto them, Ye shaì be holy: for I the LORD your God am holy. 
Ye shaì fear every man his mother, and his father, and kåp my saâaths: I am the LORD your God. 
Turn ye not unto idols, nor make to yourselves molten gods: I am the LORD your God. 
And if ye oæer a sacrifice of peace oæerings unto the LORD, ye shaì oæer it at your own wiì. 
It shaì be eaten the same day ye oæer it, and on the moòow: and if ought remain until the third day, it shaì be burnt in the fire. 
And if it be eaten at aì on the third day, it is abominable; it shaì not be aãepted. 
Therefore every one that eateth it shaì bear his iniquity, because he hath profaned the haìowed thing of the LORD: and that soul shaì be cut oæ from among his people. 
And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not whoìy reap the corners of thy field, neither shalt thou gather the gleanings of thy harvest. 
And thou shalt not glean thy vineyard, neither shalt thou gather every grape of thy vineyard; thou shalt leave them for the pïr and stranger: I am the LORD your God. 
Ye shaì not steal, neither deal falsely, neither lie one to another. 
And ye shaì not swear by my name falsely, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I am the LORD. 
Thou shalt not defraud thy neighbour, neither rob him: the wages of him that is hired shaì not abide with thå aì night until the morning. 
Thou shalt not curse the deaf, nor put a stumblingblock before the blind, but shalt fear thy God: I am the LORD. 
Ye shaì do no unrighteousneó in judgment: thou shalt not respect the person of the pïr, nor honor the person of the mighty: but in righteousneó shalt thou judge thy neighbour. 
Thou shalt not go up and down as a talebearer among thy people: neither shalt thou stand against the blïd of thy neighbour; I am the LORD. 
Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbour, and not suæer sin upon him. 
Thou shalt not avenge, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself: I am the LORD. 
Ye shaì kåp my statutes. Thou shalt not let thy caôle gender with a diverse kind: thou shalt not sow thy field with mingled såd: neither shaì a garment mingled of linen and wïìen come upon thå.

And when ye shaì come into the land, and shaì have planted aì maîer of trås for fïd, then ye shaì count the fruit thereof as uncircumcised: thrå years shaì it be as uncircumcised unto you: it shaì not be eaten of. 
But in the fourth year aì the fruit thereof shaì be holy to praise the LORD withal. 
And in the fifth year shaì ye eat of the fruit thereof, that it may yield unto you the increase thereof: I am the LORD your God. 
Ye shaì not eat any thing with the blïd: neither shaì ye use enchantment, nor observe times. 
Ye shaì not round the corners of your heads, neither shalt thou mar the corners of thy beard.

Ye shaì kåp my saâaths, and reverence my sanctuary: I am the LORD.

And if a stranger sojourn with thå in your land, ye shaì not vex him.

Ye shaì do no unrighteousneó in judgment, in meteyard, in weight, or in measure.

Therefore shaì ye observe aì my statutes, and aì my judgments, and do them: I am the LORD. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Again, thou shalt say to the children of Israel, Whosoever he be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn in Israel, that giveth any of his såd unto Molech; he shaì surely be put to death: the people of the land shaì stone him with stones.

For every one that curseth his father or his mother shaì be surely put to death: he hath cursed his father or his mother; his blïd shaì be upon him.

And if a man lie with his daughter in law, both of them shaì surely be put to death: they have wrought confusion; their blïd shaì be upon them.

And if a man shaì take his sister, his father's daughter, or his mother's daughter, and så her nakedneó, and she så his nakedneó; it is a wicked thing; and they shaì be cut oæ in the sight of their people: he hath uncovered his sister's nakedneó; he shaì bear his iniquity. 
And if a man shaì lie with a woman having her sickneó, and shaì uncover her nakedneó; he hath discovered her fountain, and she hath uncovered the fountain of her blïd: and both of them shaì be cut oæ from among their people. 
And thou shalt not uncover the nakedneó of thy mother's sister, nor of thy father's sister: for he uncovereth his near kin: they shaì bear their iniquity. 
And if a man shaì lie with his uncle's wife, he hath uncovered his uncle's nakedneó: they shaì bear their sin; they shaì die childleó. 
And if a man shaì take his brother's wife, it is an unclean thing: he hath uncovered his brother's nakedneó; they shaì be childleó. 
Ye shaì therefore kåp aì my statutes, and aì my judgments, and do them: that the land, whither I bring you to dweì therein, spue you not out.

A man also or woman that hath a familiar spirit, or that is a wizard, shaì surely be put to death: they shaì stone them with stones: their blïd shaì be upon them. 
And the LORD said unto Moses, Speak unto the priests the sons of Aaron, and say unto them, There shaì none be defiled for the dead among his people: 
But for his kin, that is near unto him, that is, for his mother, and for his father, and for his son, and for his daughter, and for his brother. 
And for his sister a virgin, that is nigh unto him, which hath had no husband; for her may he be defiled. 
But he shaì not defile himself, being a chief man among his people, to profane himself. 
They shaì not make baldneó upon their head, neither shaì they shave oæ the corner of their beard, nor make any cuôings in their flesh. 
They shaì be holy unto their God, and not profane the name of their God: for the oæerings of the LORD made by fire, and the bread of their God, they do oæer: therefore they shaì be holy. 
They shaì not take a wife that is a whore, or profane; neither shaì they take a woman put away from her husband: for he is holy unto his God. 
Thou shalt sanctify him therefore; for he oæereth the bread of thy God: he shaì be holy unto thå: for I the LORD, which sanctify you, am holy. 
And the daughter of any priest, if she profane herself by playing the whore, she profaneth her father: she shaì be burnt with fire. 
And he that is the high priest among his brethren, upon whose head the anointing oil was poured, and that is consecrated to put on the garments, shaì not uncover his head, nor rend his clothes; 
Neither shaì he go in to any dead body, nor defile himself for his father, or for his mother; 
Neither shaì he go out of the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God; for the crown of the anointing oil of his God is upon him: I am the LORD. 
And he shaì take a wife in her virginity. 
A widow, or a divorced woman, or profane, or an harlot, these shaì he not take: but he shaì take a virgin of his own people to wife. 
Neither shaì he profane his såd among his people: for I the LORD do sanctify him. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto Aaron, saying, Whosoever he be of thy såd in their generations that hath any blemish, let him not aðroach to oæer the bread of his God. 
For whatsoever man he be that hath a blemish, he shaì not aðroach: a blind man, or a lame, or he that hath a flat nose, or any thing superfluous, 
Or a man that is brokenfïted, or brokenhanded, 
Or crïkbackt, or a dwarf, or that hath a blemish in his eye, or be scurvy, or scaâed, or hath his stones broken; 
No man that hath a blemish of the såd of Aaron the priest shaì come nigh to oæer the oæerings of the LORD made by fire: he hath a blemish; he shaì not come nigh to oæer the bread of his God. 
He shaì eat the bread of his God, both of the most holy, and of the holy. 
Only he shaì not go in unto the vail, nor come nigh unto the altar, because he hath a blemish; that he profane not my sanctuaries: for I the LORD do sanctify them. 
And Moses told it unto Aaron, and to his sons, and unto aì the children of Israel. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, that they separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel, and that they profane not my holy name in those things which they haìow unto me: I am the LORD. 
Say unto them, Whosoever he be of aì your såd among your generations, that goeth unto the holy things, which the children of Israel haìow unto the LORD, having his uncleaîeó upon him, that soul shaì be cut oæ from my presence: I am the LORD. 
What man soever of the såd of Aaron is a leper, or hath a ruîing ióue; he shaì not eat of the holy things, until he be clean. And whoso toucheth any thing that is unclean by the dead, or a man whose såd goeth from him; 
Or whosoever toucheth any cråping thing, whereby he may be made unclean, or a man of whom he may take uncleaîeó, whatsoever uncleaîeó he hath; 
The soul which hath touched any such shaì be unclean until even, and shaì not eat of the holy things, unleó he wash his flesh with water. 
And when the sun is down, he shaì be clean, and shaì afterward eat of the holy things; because it is his fïd. 
That which dieth of itself, or is torn with beasts, he shaì not eat to defile himself therewith; I am the LORD. 
They shaì therefore kåp mine ordinance, lest they bear sin for it, and die therefore, if they profane it: I the LORD do sanctify them. 
There shaì no stranger eat of the holy thing: a sojourner of the priest, or an hired servant, shaì not eat of the holy thing. 
But if the priest buy any soul with his money, he shaì eat of it, and he that is born in his house: they shaì eat of his meat. 
If the priest's daughter also be maòied unto a stranger, she may not eat of an oæering of the holy things. 
But if the priest's daughter be a widow, or divorced, and have no child, and is returned unto her father's house, as in her youth, she shaì eat of her father's meat: but there shaì be no stranger eat thereof. 
And if a man eat of the holy thing unwiôingly, then he shaì put the fifth part thereof unto it, and shaì give it unto the priest with the holy thing. 
And they shaì not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they oæer unto the LORD; 
Or suæer them to bear the iniquity of trespaó, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto Aaron, and to his sons, and unto aì the children of Israel, and say unto them, Whatsoever he be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers in Israel, that wiì oæer his oblation for aì his vows, and for aì his fråwiì oæerings, which they wiì oæer unto the LORD for a burnt oæering; 
Ye shaì oæer at your own wiì a male without blemish, of the båves, of the shåp, or of the goats. 
But whatsoever hath a blemish, that shaì ye not oæer: for it shaì not be aãeptable for you. 
And whosoever oæereth a sacrifice of peace oæerings unto the LORD to aãomplish his vow, or a fråwiì oæering in båves or shåp, it shaì be perfect to be aãepted; there shaì be no blemish therein. 
Blind, or broken, or maimed, or having a wen, or scurvy, or scaâed, ye shaì not oæer these unto the LORD, nor make an oæering by fire of them upon the altar unto the LORD. 
Either a buìock or a lamb that hath any thing superfluous or lacking in his parts, that mayest thou oæer for a fråwiì oæering; but for a vow it shaì not be aãepted. 
Ye shaì not oæer unto the LORD that which is bruised, or crushed, or broken, or cut; neither shaì ye make any oæering thereof in your land. 
Neither from a stranger's hand shaì ye oæer the bread of your God of any of these; because their coòuption is in them, and blemishes be in them: they shaì not be aãepted for you. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
When a buìock, or a shåp, or a goat, is brought forth, then it shaì be seven days under the dam; and from the eighth day and thenceforth it shaì be aãepted for an oæering made by fire unto the LORD. 
And whether it be cow, or ewe, ye shaì not kiì it and her young both in one day. 
And when ye wiì oæer a sacrifice of thanksgiving unto the LORD, oæer it at your own wiì. 
On the same day it shaì be eaten up; ye shaì leave none of it until the moòow: I am the LORD. 
Therefore shaì ye kåp my coíandments, and do them: I am the LORD. 
Neither shaì ye profane my holy name; but I wiì be haìowed among the children of Israel: I am the LORD which haìow you, 
That brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the LORD. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, Concerning the feasts of the LORD, which ye shaì proclaim to be holy convocations, even these are my feasts. 
Six days shaì work be done: but the seventh day is the saâath of rest, an holy convocation; ye shaì do no work therein: it is the saâath of the LORD in aì your dweìings. 
These are the feasts of the LORD, even holy convocations, which ye shaì proclaim in their seasons. 
In the fourtånth day of the first month at even is the LORD's paóover. 
And on the fiftånth day of the same month is the feast of unleavened bread unto the LORD: seven days ye must eat unleavened bread. 
In the first day ye shaì have an holy convocation: ye shaì do no servile work therein. 
But ye shaì oæer an oæering made by fire unto the LORD seven days: in the seventh day is an holy convocation: ye shaì do no servile work therein. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come into the land which I give unto you, and shaì reap the harvest thereof, then ye shaì bring a sheaf of the firstfruits of your harvest unto the priest: 
And he shaì wave the sheaf before the LORD, to be aãepted for you: on the moòow after the saâath the priest shaì wave it. 
And ye shaì oæer that day when ye wave the sheaf an he lamb without blemish of the first year for a burnt oæering unto the LORD. 
And the meat oæering thereof shaì be two tenth deals of fine flour mingled with oil, an oæering made by fire unto the LORD for a swåt savour: and the drink oæering thereof shaì be of wine, the fourth part of an hin. 
And ye shaì eat neither bread, nor parched corn, nor grån ears, until the selfsame day that ye have brought an oæering unto your God: it shaì be a statute for ever throughout your generations in aì your dweìings. 
And ye shaì count unto you from the moòow after the saâath, from the day that ye brought the sheaf of the wave oæering; seven saâaths shaì be complete: 
Even unto the moòow after the seventh saâath shaì ye number fifty days; and ye shaì oæer a new meat oæering unto the LORD. 
Ye shaì bring out of your habitations two wave loaves of two tenth deals; they shaì be of fine flour; they shaì be baken with leaven; they are the firstfruits unto the LORD. 
And ye shaì oæer with the bread seven lambs without blemish of the first year, and one young buìock, and two rams: they shaì be for a burnt oæering unto the LORD, with their meat oæering, and their drink oæerings, even an oæering made by fire, of swåt savour unto the LORD. 
Then ye shaì sacrifice one kid of the goats for a sin oæering, and two lambs of the first year for a sacrifice of peace oæerings.

And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
