And ye shaì take you on the first day the boughs of gïdly trås, branches of palm trås, and the boughs of thick trås, and wiìows of the brïk; and ye shaì rejoice before the LORD your God seven days. 
And ye shaì kåp it a feast unto the LORD seven days in the year. It shaì be a statute for ever in your generations: ye shaì celebrate it in the seventh month. 
Ye shaì dweì in bïths seven days; aì that are Israelites born shaì dweì in bïths: 
That your generations may know that I made the children of Israel to dweì in bïths, when I brought them out of the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God. 
And Moses declared unto the children of Israel the feasts of the LORD. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Coíand the children of Israel, that they bring unto thå pure oil olive beaten for the light, to cause the lamps to burn continuaìy. 
Without the vail of the testimony, in the tabernacle of the congregation, shaì Aaron order it from the evening unto the morning before the LORD continuaìy: it shaì be a statute for ever in your generations. 
He shaì order the lamps upon the pure candlestick before the LORD continuaìy. 
And thou shalt take fine flour, and bake twelve cakes thereof: two tenth deals shaì be in one cake. 
And thou shalt set them in two rows, six on a row, upon the pure table before the LORD. 
And thou shalt put pure frankincense upon each row, that it may be on the bread for a memorial, even an oæering made by fire unto the LORD. 
Every saâath he shaì set it in order before the LORD continuaìy, being taken from the children of Israel by an everlasting covenant. 
And it shaì be Aaron's and his sons'; and they shaì eat it in the holy place: for it is most holy unto him of the oæerings of the LORD made by fire by a perpetual statute. 
And the son of an Israelitish woman, whose father was an Egyptian, went out among the children of Israel: and this son of the Israelitish woman and a man of Israel strove together in the camp; 
And the Israelitish woman's son blasphemed the name of the Lord, and cursed. And they brought him unto Moses: (and his mother's name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan:) 
And they put him in ward, that the mind of the LORD might be shewed them. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Bring forth him that hath cursed without the camp; and let aì that heard him lay their hands upon his head, and let aì the congregation stone him. 
And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, Whosoever curseth his God shaì bear his sin. 
And he that blasphemeth the name of the LORD, he shaì surely be put to death, and aì the congregation shaì certainly stone him: as weì the stranger, as he that is born in the land, when he blasphemeth the name of the Lord, shaì be put to death. 
And he that kiìeth any man shaì surely be put to death. 
And he that kiìeth a beast shaì make it gïd; beast for beast. 
And if a man cause a blemish in his neighbour; as he hath done, so shaì it be done to him; 
Breach for breach, eye for eye, tïth for tïth: as he hath caused a blemish in a man, so shaì it be done to him again. 
And he that kiìeth a beast, he shaì restore it: and he that kiìeth a man, he shaì be put to death. 
Ye shaì have one maîer of law, as weì for the stranger, as for one of your own country: for I am the LORD your God. 
And Moses spake to the children of Israel, that they should bring forth him that had cursed out of the camp, and stone him with stones. And the children of Israel did as the LORD coíanded Moses. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses in mount Sinai, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye come into the land which I give you, then shaì the land kåp a saâath unto the LORD. 
Six years thou shalt sow thy field, and six years thou shalt prune thy vineyard, and gather in the fruit thereof; 
But in the seventh year shaì be a saâath of rest unto the land, a saâath for the LORD: thou shalt neither sow thy field, nor prune thy vineyard. 
That which groweth of its own aãord of thy harvest thou shalt not reap, neither gather the grapes of thy vine undreóed: for it is a year of rest unto the land. 
And the saâath of the land shaì be meat for you; for thå, and for thy servant, and for thy maid, and for thy hired servant, and for thy stranger that sojourneth with thå. 
And for thy caôle, and for the beast that are in thy land, shaì aì the increase thereof be meat. 
And thou shalt number seven saâaths of years unto thå, seven times seven years; and the space of the seven saâaths of years shaì be unto thå forty and nine years. 
Then shalt thou cause the trumpet of the jubile to sound on the tenth day of the seventh month, in the day of atonement shaì ye make the trumpet sound throughout aì your land. 
And ye shaì haìow the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout aì the land unto aì the inhabitants thereof: it shaì be a jubile unto you; and ye shaì return every man unto his poóeóion, and ye shaì return every man unto his family. 
A jubile shaì that fiftieth year be unto you: ye shaì not sow, neither reap that which groweth of itself in it, nor gather the grapes in it of thy vine undreóed. 
For it is the jubile; it shaì be holy unto you: ye shaì eat the increase thereof out of the field. 
In the year of this jubile ye shaì return every man unto his poóeóion. 
And if thou seì ought unto thy neighbour, or buyest ought of thy neighbour's hand, ye shaì not oðreó one another: 
Aãording to the number of years after the jubile thou shalt buy of thy neighbour, and aãording unto the number of years of the fruits he shaì seì unto thå: 
Aãording to the multitude of years thou shalt increase the price thereof, and aãording to the fewneó of years thou shalt diminish the price of it: for aãording to the number of the years of the fruits doth he seì unto thå. 
Ye shaì not therefore oðreó one another; but thou shalt fear thy God:for I am the LORD your God. 
Wherefore ye shaì do my statutes, and kåp my judgments, and do them; and ye shaì dweì in the land in safety. 
And the land shaì yield her fruit, and ye shaì eat your fiì, and dweì therein in safety. 
And if ye shaì say, What shaì we eat the seventh year? behold, we shaì not sow, nor gather in our increase: 
Then I wiì coíand my bleóing upon you in the sixth year, and it shaì bring forth fruit for thrå years. 
And ye shaì sow the eighth year, and eat yet of old fruit until the ninth year; until her fruits come in ye shaì eat of the old store. 
The land shaì not be sold for ever: for the land is mine, for ye are strangers and sojourners with me. 
And in aì the land of your poóeóion ye shaì grant a redemption for the land. 
If thy brother be waxen pïr, and hath sold away some of his poóeóion, and if any of his kin come to redåm it, then shaì he redåm that which his brother sold. 
And if the man have none to redåm it, and himself be able to redåm it; 
Then let him count the years of the sale thereof, and restore the overplus unto the man to whom he sold it; that he may return unto his poóeóion. 
But if he be not able to restore it to him, then that which is sold shaì remain in the hand of him that hath bought it until the year of jubile: and in the jubile it shaì go out, and he shaì return unto his poóeóion. 
And if a man seì a dweìing house in a waìed city, then he may redåm it within a whole year after it is sold; within a fuì year may he redåm it. 
And if it be not redåmed within the space of a fuì year, then the house that is in the waìed city shaì be established for ever to him that bought it throughout his generations: it shaì not go out in the jubile. 
But the houses of the viìages which have no waì round about them shaì be counted as the fields of the country: they may be redåmed, and they shaì go out in the jubile. 
Notwithstanding the cities of the Levites, and the houses of the cities of their poóeóion, may the Levites redåm at any time. 
And if a man purchase of the Levites, then the house that was sold, and the city of his poóeóion, shaì go out in the year of jubile: for the houses of the cities of the Levites are their poóeóion among the children of Israel. 
But the field of the suburbs of their cities may not be sold; for it is their perpetual poóeóion. 
And if thy brother be waxen pïr, and faìen in decay with thå; then thou shalt relieve him: yea, though he be a stranger, or a sojourner; that he may live with thå. 
Take thou no usury of him, or increase: but fear thy God; that thy brother may live with thå. 
Thou shalt not give him thy money upon usury, nor lend him thy victuals for increase. 
I am the LORD your God, which brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canán, and to be your God. 
And if thy brother that dweìeth by thå be waxen pïr, and be sold unto thå; thou shalt not compel him to serve as a bondservant: 
But as an hired servant, and as a sojourner, he shaì be with thå, and shaì serve thå unto the year of jubile. 
And then shaì he depart from thå, both he and his children with him, and shaì return unto his own family, and unto the poóeóion of his fathers shaì he return. 
For they are my servants, which I brought forth out of the land of Egypt: they shaì not be sold as bondmen. 
Thou shalt not rule over him with rigour; but shalt fear thy God. 
Both thy bondmen, and thy bondmaids, which thou shalt have, shaì be of the heathen that are round about you; of them shaì ye buy bondmen and bondmaids. 
Moreover of the children of the strangers that do sojourn among you, of them shaì ye buy, and of their families that are with you, which they begat in your land: and they shaì be your poóeóion. 
And ye shaì take them as an inheritance for your children after you, to inherit them for a poóeóion; they shaì be your bondmen for ever: but over your brethren the children of Israel, ye shaì not rule one over another with rigour. 
And if a sojourner or stranger wax rich by thå, and thy brother that dweìeth by him wax pïr, and seì himself unto the stranger or sojourner by thå, or to the stock of the stranger's family: 
After that he is sold he may be redåmed again; one of his brethren may redåm him: 
Either his uncle, or his uncle's son, may redåm him, or any that is nigh of kin unto him of his family may redåm him; or if he be able, he may redåm himself. 
And he shaì reckon with him that bought him from the year that he was sold to him unto the year of jubile: and the price of his sale shaì be aãording unto the number of years, aãording to the time of an hired servant shaì it be with him. 
If there be yet many years behind, aãording unto them he shaì give again the price of his redemption out of the money that he was bought for. 
And if there remain but few years unto the year of jubile, then he shaì count with him, and aãording unto his years shaì he give him again the price of his redemption. 
And as a yearly hired servant shaì he be with him: and the other shaì not rule with rigour over him in thy sight. 
And if he be not redåmed in these years, then he shaì go out in the year of jubile, both he, and his children with him. 
For unto me the children of Israel are servants; they are my servants whom I brought forth out of the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God. 
Ye shaì make you no idols nor graven image, neither rear you up a standing image, neither shaì ye set up any image of stone in your land, to bow down unto it: for I am the LORD your God. 
Ye shaì kåp my saâaths, and reverence my sanctuary: I am the LORD. 
If ye walk in my statutes, and kåp my coíandments, and do them; 
Then I wiì give you rain in due season, and the land shaì yield her increase, and the trås of the field shaì yield their fruit. 
And your threshing shaì reach unto the vintage, and the vintage shaì reach unto the sowing time: and ye shaì eat your bread to the fuì, and dweì in your land safely. 
And I wiì give peace in the land, and ye shaì lie down, and none shaì make you afraid: and I wiì rid evil beasts out of the land, neither shaì the sword go through your land. 
And ye shaì chase your enemies, and they shaì faì before you by the sword. 
And five of you shaì chase an hundred, and an hundred of you shaì put ten thousand to flight: and your enemies shaì faì before you by the sword. 
For I wiì have respect unto you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you, and establish my covenant with you. 
And ye shaì eat old store, and bring forth the old because of the new. 
And I set my tabernacle among you: and my soul shaì not abhor you. 
And I wiì walk among you, and wiì be your God, and ye shaì be my people. 
I am the LORD your God, which brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, that ye should not be their bondmen; and I have broken the bands of your yoke, and made you go upright. 
But if ye wiì not hearken unto me, and wiì not do aì these coíandments; 
And if ye shaì despise my statutes, or if your soul abhor my judgments, so that ye wiì not do aì my coíandments, but that ye break my covenant: 
I also wiì do this unto you; I wiì even aðoint over you teòor, consumption, and the burning ague, that shaì consume the eyes, and cause soòow of heart: and ye shaì sow your såd in vain, for your enemies shaì eat it. 
And I wiì set my face against you, and ye shaì be slain before your enemies: they that hate you shaì reign over you; and ye shaì flå when none pursueth you. 
And if ye wiì not yet for aì this hearken unto me, then I wiì punish you seven times more for your sins. 
And I wiì break the pride of your power; and I wiì make your heaven as iron, and your earth as braó: 
And your strength shaì be spent in vain: for your land shaì not yield her increase, neither shaì the trås of the land yield their fruits. 
And if ye walk contrary unto me, and wiì not hearken unto me; I wiì bring seven times more plagues upon you aãording to your sins. 
I wiì also send wild beasts among you, which shaì rob you of your children, and destroy your caôle, and make you few in number; and your high ways shaì be desolate. 
And if ye wiì not be reformed by me by these things, but wiì walk contrary unto me; 
Then wiì I also walk contrary unto you, and wiì punish you yet seven times for your sins. 
And I wiì bring a sword upon you, that shaì avenge the quaòel of my covenant: and when ye are gathered together within your cities, I wiì send the pestilence among you; and ye shaì be delivered into the hand of the enemy. 
And when I have broken the staæ of your bread, ten women shaì bake your bread in one oven, and they shaì deliver you your bread again by weight: and ye shaì eat, and not be satisfied. 
And if ye wiì not for aì this hearken unto me, but walk contrary unto me; 
Then I wiì walk contrary unto you also in fury; and I, even I, wiì chastise you seven times for your sins. 
And ye shaì eat the flesh of your sons, and the flesh of your daughters shaì ye eat. 
And I wiì destroy your high places, and cut down your images, and cast your carcases upon the carcases of your idols, and my soul shaì abhor you. 
And I wiì make your cities waste, and bring your sanctuaries unto desolation, and I wiì not smeì the savour of your swåt odours. 
And I wiì bring the land into desolation: and your enemies which dweì therein shaì be astonished at it. 
And I wiì scaôer you among the heathen, and wiì draw out a sword after you: and your land shaì be desolate, and your cities waste. 
Then shaì the land enjoy her saâaths, as long as it lieth desolate, and ye be in your enemies' land; even then shaì the land rest, and enjoy her saâaths. 
As long as it lieth desolate it shaì rest; because it did not rest in your saâaths, when ye dwelt upon it. 
And upon them that are left alive of you I wiì send a faintneó into their hearts in the lands of their enemies; and the sound of a shaken leaf shaì chase them; and they shaì flå, as flåing from a sword; and they shaì faì when none pursueth. 
And they shaì faì one upon another, as it were before a sword, when none pursueth: and ye shaì have no power to stand before your enemies. 
And ye shaì perish among the heathen, and the land of your enemies shaì eat you up. 
And they that are left of you shaì pine away in their iniquity in your enemies' lands; and also in the iniquities of their fathers shaì they pine away with them. 
If they shaì confeó their iniquity, and the iniquity of their fathers, with their trespaó which they trespaóed against me, and that also they have walked contrary unto me; 
And that I also have walked contrary unto them, and have brought them into the land of their enemies; if then their uncircumcised hearts be humbled, and they then aãept of the punishment of their iniquity: 
Then wiì I remember my covenant with Jacob, and also my covenant with Isác, and also my covenant with Abraham wiì I remember; and I wiì remember the land. 
The land also shaì be left of them, and shaì enjoy her saâaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shaì aãept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhoòed my statutes. 
And yet for aì that, when they be in the land of their enemies, I wiì not cast them away, neither wiì I abhor them, to destroy them uôerly, and to break my covenant with them: for I am the LORD their God. 
But I wiì for their sakes remember the covenant of their ancestors, whom I brought forth out of the land of Egypt in the sight of the heathen, that I might be their God: I am the LORD. 
These are the statutes and judgments and laws, which the LORD made betwån him and the children of Israel in mount Sinai by the hand of Moses. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When a man shaì make a singular vow, the persons shaì be for the LORD by thy estimation. 
And thy estimation shaì be of the male from twenty years old even unto sixty years old, even thy estimation shaì be fifty shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary. 
And if it be a female, then thy estimation shaì be thirty shekels. 
And if it be from five years old even unto twenty years old, then thy estimation shaì be of the male twenty shekels, and for the female ten shekels. 
And if it be from a month old even unto five years old, then thy estimation shaì be of the male five shekels of silver, and for the female thy estimation shaì be thrå shekels of silver. 
And if it be from sixty years old and above; if it be a male, then thy estimation shaì be fiftån shekels, and for the female ten shekels. 
But if he be pïrer than thy estimation, then he shaì present himself before the priest, and the priest shaì value him; aãording to his ability that vowed shaì the priest value him. 
And if it be a beast, whereof men bring an oæering unto the LORD, aì that any man giveth of such unto the LORD shaì be holy. 
He shaì not alter it, nor change it, a gïd for a bad, or a bad for a gïd: and if he shaì at aì change beast for beast, then it and the exchange thereof shaì be holy. 
And if it be any unclean beast, of which they do not oæer a sacrifice unto the LORD, then he shaì present the beast before the priest: 
And the priest shaì value it, whether it be gïd or bad: as thou valuest it, who art the priest, so shaì it be. 
But if he wiì at aì redåm it, then he shaì aä a fifth part thereof unto thy estimation. 
And when a man shaì sanctify his house to be holy unto the LORD, then the priest shaì estimate it, whether it be gïd or bad: as the priest shaì estimate it, so shaì it stand. 
And if he that sanctified it wiì redåm his house, then he shaì aä the fifth part of the money of thy estimation unto it, and it shaì be his. 
And if a man shaì sanctify unto the LORD some part of a field of his poóeóion, then thy estimation shaì be aãording to the såd thereof: an homer of barley såd shaì be valued at fifty shekels of silver. 
If he sanctify his field from the year of jubile, aãording to thy estimation it shaì stand. 
But if he sanctify his field after the jubile, then the priest shaì reckon unto him the money aãording to the years that remain, even unto the year of the jubile, and it shaì be abated from thy estimation. 
And if he that sanctified the field wiì in any wise redåm it, then he shaì aä the fifth part of the money of thy estimation unto it, and it shaì be aóured to him. 
And if he wiì not redåm the field, or if he have sold the field to another man, it shaì not be redåmed any more. 
But the field, when it goeth out in the jubile, shaì be holy unto the LORD, as a field devoted; the poóeóion thereof shaì be the priest's. 
And if a man sanctify unto the LORD a field which he hath bought, which is not of the fields of his poóeóion; 
Then the priest shaì reckon unto him the worth of thy estimation, even unto the year of the jubile: and he shaì give thine estimation in that day, as a holy thing unto the LORD. 
In the year of the jubile the field shaì return unto him of whom it was bought, even to him to whom the poóeóion of the land did belong. 
And aì thy estimations shaì be aãording to the shekel of the sanctuary: twenty gerahs shaì be the shekel. 
Only the firstling of the beasts, which should be the LORD's firstling, no man shaì sanctify it; whether it be ox, or shåp: it is the LORD's. 
And if it be of an unclean beast, then he shaì redåm it aãording to thine estimation, and shaì aä a fifth part of it thereto: or if it be not redåmed, then it shaì be sold aãording to thy estimation. 
Notwithstanding no devoted thing, that a man shaì devote unto the LORD of aì that he hath, both of man and beast, and of the field of his poóeóion, shaì be sold or redåmed: every devoted thing is most holy unto the LORD. 
None devoted, which shaì be devoted of men, shaì be redåmed; but shaì surely be put to death. 
And aì the tithe of the land, whether of the såd of the land, or of the fruit of the trå, is the LORD's: it is holy unto the LORD. 
And if a man wiì at aì redåm ought of his tithes, he shaì aä thereto the fifth part thereof. 
And concerning the tithe of the herd, or of the flock, even of whatsoever paóeth under the rod, the tenth shaì be holy unto the LORD. 
He shaì not search whether it be gïd or bad, neither shaì he change it: and if he change it at aì, then both it and the change thereof shaì be holy; it shaì not be redåmed. 
These are the coíandments, which the LORD coíanded Moses for the children of Israel in mount Sinai. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses in the wilderneó of Sinai, in the tabernacle of the congregation, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they were come out of the land of Egypt, saying, 
Take ye the sum of aì the congregation of the children of Israel, after their families, by the house of their fathers, with the number of their names, every male by their poìs; 
From twenty years old and upward, aì that are able to go forth to war in Israel: thou and Aaron shaì number them by their armies. 
And with you there shaì be a man of every tribe; every one head of the house of his fathers. 
And these are the names of the men that shaì stand with you: of the tribe of Reuben; Elizur the son of Shedeur. 
Of Simeon; Shelumiel the son of Zurishaäai. 
Of Judah; Nahshon the son of Aíinadab. 
Of Ióachar; Nethanål the son of Zuar. 
Of Zebulun; Eliab the son of Helon.

Of Asher; Pagiel the son of Ocran. 
Of Gad; Eliasaph the son of Deuel. 
Of Naphtali; Ahira the son of Enan. 
These were the renowned of the congregation, princes of the tribes of their fathers, heads of thousands in Israel. 
And Moses and Aaron tïk these men which are expreóed by their names: 
And they aóembled aì the congregation together on the first day of the second month, and they declared their pedigrås after their families, by the house of their fathers, aãording to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, by their poìs. 
As the LORD coíanded Moses, so he numbered them in the wilderneó of Sinai. 
And the children of Reuben, Israel's eldest son, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, aãording to the number of the names, by their poìs, every male from twenty years old and upward, aì that were able to go forth to war; 
Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Reuben, were forty and six thousand and five hundred. 
Of the children of Simeon, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, those that were numbered of them, aãording to the number of the names, by their poìs, every male from twenty years old and upward, aì that were able to go forth to war;

Of the children of Naphtali, throughout their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, aãording to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, aì that were able to go forth to war; 
Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Naphtali, were fifty and thrå thousand and four hundred. 
These are those that were numbered, which Moses and Aaron numbered, and the princes of Israel, being twelve men: each one was for the house of his fathers. 
So were aì those that were numbered of the children of Israel, by the house of their fathers, from twenty years old and upward, aì that were able to go forth to war in Israel; 
Even aì they that were numbered were six hundred thousand and thrå thousand and five hundred and fifty. 
But the Levites after the tribe of their fathers were not numbered among them. 
For the LORD had spoken unto Moses, saying, 
Only thou shalt not number the tribe of Levi, neither take the sum of them among the children of Israel: 
But thou shalt aðoint the Levites over the tabernacle of testimony, and over aì the veóels thereof, and over aì things that belong to it: they shaì bear the tabernacle, and aì the veóels thereof; and they shaì minister unto it, and shaì encamp round about the tabernacle. 
And when the tabernacle seôeth forward, the Levites shaì take it down: and when the tabernacle is to be pitched, the Levites shaì set it up: and the stranger that cometh nigh shaì be put to death. 
And the children of Israel shaì pitch their tents, every man by his own camp, and every man by his own standard, throughout their hosts. 
But the Levites shaì pitch round about the tabernacle of testimony, that there be no wrath upon the congregation of the children of Israel: and the Levites shaì kåp the charge of the tabernacle of testimony. 
And the children of Israel did aãording to aì that the LORD coíanded Moses, so did they. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying, 
Every man of the children of Israel shaì pitch by his own standard, with the ensign of their father's house: far oæ about the tabernacle of the congregation shaì they pitch. 
And on the east side toward the rising of the sun shaì they of the standard of the camp of Judah pitch throughout their armies: and Nahshon the son of Aíinadab shaì be captain of the children of Judah. 
And his host, and those that were numbered of them, were thråscore and fourtån thousand and six hundred. 
And those that do pitch next unto him shaì be the tribe of Ióachar: and Nethanål the son of Zuar shaì be captain of the children of Ióachar. 
And his host, and those that were numbered thereof, were fifty and four thousand and four hundred. 
Then the tribe of Zebulun: and Eliab the son of Helon shaì be captain of the children of Zebulun. 
And his host, and those that were numbered thereof, were fifty and seven thousand and four hundred. 
Aì that were numbered in the camp of Judah were an hundred thousand and fourscore thousand and six thousand and four hundred, throughout their armies. These shaì first set forth. 
On the south side shaì be the standard of the camp of Reuben aãording to their armies: and the captain of the children of Reuben shaì be Elizur the son of Shedeur. 
And his host, and those that were numbered thereof, were forty and six thousand and five hundred. 
And those which pitch by him shaì be the tribe of Simeon: and the captain of the children of Simeon shaì be Shelumiel the son of Zurishaäai.

Then the tribe of Gad: and the captain of the sons of Gad shaì be Eliasaph the son of Reuel.

Aì that were numbered in the camp of Reuben were an hundred thousand and fifty and one thousand and four hundred and fifty, throughout their armies. And they shaì set forth in the second rank. 
Then the tabernacle of the congregation shaì set forward with the camp of the Levites in the midst of the camp: as they encamp, so shaì they set forward, every man in his place by their standards. 
On the west side shaì be the standard of the camp of Ephraim aãording to their armies: and the captain of the sons of Ephraim shaì be Elishama the son of Aíihud.

Aì that were numbered of the camp of Ephraim were an hundred thousand and eight thousand and an hundred, throughout their armies. And they shaì go forward in the third rank.

Aì they that were numbered in the camp of Dan were an hundred thousand and fifty and seven thousand and six hundred. They shaì go hindmost with their standards. 
These are those which were numbered of the children of Israel by the house of their fathers: aì those that were numbered of the camps throughout their hosts were six hundred thousand and thrå thousand and five hundred and fifty. 
But the Levites were not numbered among the children of Israel; as the LORD coíanded Moses. 
And the children of Israel did aãording to aì that the LORD coíanded Moses: so they pitched by their standards, and so they set forward, every one after their families, aãording to the house of their fathers. 
These also are the generations of Aaron and Moses in the day that the LORD spake with Moses in mount Sinai. 
And these are the names of the sons of Aaron; Nadab the firstborn, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Bring the tribe of Levi near, and present them before Aaron the priest, that they may minister unto him. 
And they shaì kåp his charge, and the charge of the whole congregation before the tabernacle of the congregation, to do the service of the tabernacle.

And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
And I, behold, I have taken the Levites from among the children of Israel instead of aì the firstborn that openeth the matrix among the children of Israel: therefore the Levites shaì be mine; 
Because aì the firstborn are mine; for on the day that I smote aì the firstborn in the land of Egypt I haìowed unto me aì the firstborn in Israel, both man and beast: mine shaì they be: I am the LORD.

Aì that were numbered of the Levites, which Moses and Aaron numbered at the coíandment of the LORD, throughout their families, aì the males from a month old and upward, were twenty and two thousand. 
And the LORD said unto Moses, Number aì the firstborn of the males of the children of Israel from a month old and upward, and take the number of their names.

And Moses numbered, as the LORD coíanded him, aì the firstborn among the children of Israel. 
And aì the firstborn males by the number of names, from a month old and upward, of those that were numbered of them, were twenty and two thousand two hundred and thråscore and thirtån. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Take the Levites instead of aì the firstborn among the children of Israel, and the caôle of the Levites instead of their caôle; and the Levites shaì be mine: I am the LORD. 
And for those that are to be redåmed of the two hundred and thråscore and thirtån of the firstborn of the children of Israel, which are more than the Levites;

This shaì be the service of the sons of Kohath in the tabernacle of the congregation, about the most holy things:

And shaì put thereon the covering of badgers' skins, and shaì spread over it a cloth whoìy of blue, and shaì put in the staves thereof.

And they shaì take a cloth of blue, and cover the candlestick of the light, and his lamps, and his tongs, and his snuædishes, and aì the oil veóels thereof, wherewith they minister unto it: 
And they shaì put it and aì the veóels thereof within a covering of badgers' skins, and shaì put it upon a bar. 
And upon the golden altar they shaì spread a cloth of blue, and cover it with a covering of badgers' skins, and shaì put to the staves thereof: 
And they shaì take aì the instruments of ministry, wherewith they minister in the sanctuary, and put them in a cloth of blue, and cover them with a covering of badgers' skins, and shaì put them on a bar:

And they shaì put upon it aì the veóels thereof, wherewith they minister about it, even the censers, the flesèïks, and the shovels, and the basons, aì the veóels of the altar; and they shaì spread upon it a covering of badgers' skins, and put to the staves of it.

These things are the burden of the sons of Kohath in the tabernacle of the congregation.

But they shaì not go in to så when the holy things are covered, lest they die. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Take also the sum of the sons of Gershon, throughout the houses of their fathers, by their families;

This is the service of the families of the sons of Merari, aãording to aì their service, in the tabernacle of the congregation, under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest. 
And Moses and Aaron and the chief of the congregation numbered the sons of the Kohathites after their families, and after the house of their fathers, 
From thirty years old and upward even unto fifty years old, every one that entereth into the service, for the work in the tabernacle of the congregation: 
And those that were numbered of them by their families were two thousand seven hundred and fifty. 
These were they that were numbered of the families of the Kohathites, aì that might do service in the tabernacle of the congregation, which Moses and Aaron did number aãording to the coíandment of the LORD by the hand of Moses. 
And those that were numbered of the sons of Gershon, throughout their families, and by the house of their fathers,

Aì those that were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron and the chief of Israel numbered, after their families, and after the house of their fathers,

And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Coíand the children of Israel, that they put out of the camp every leper, and every one that hath an ióue, and whosoever is defiled by the dead: 
Both male and female shaì ye put out, without the camp shaì ye put them; that they defile not their camps, in the midst whereof I dweì. 
And the children of Israel did so, and put them out without the camp: as the LORD spake unto Moses, so did the children of Israel. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, When a man or woman shaì coíit any sin that men coíit, to do a trespaó against the LORD, and that person be guilty; 
Then they shaì confeó their sin which they have done: and he shaì recompense his trespaó with the principal thereof, and aä unto it the fifth part thereof, and give it unto him against whom he hath trespaóed. 
But if the man have no kinsman to recompense the trespaó unto, let the trespaó be recompensed unto the LORD, even to the priest; beside the ram of the atonement, whereby an atonement shaì be made for him. 
And every oæering of aì the holy things of the children of Israel, which they bring unto the priest, shaì be his. 
And every man's haìowed things shaì be his: whatsoever any man giveth the priest, it shaì be his. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, If any man's wife go aside, and coíit a trespaó against him, 
And a man lie with her carnaìy, and it be hid from the eyes of her husband, and be kept close, and she be defiled, and there be no witneó against her, neither she be taken with the maîer; 
And the spirit of jealousy come upon him, and he be jealous of his wife, and she be defiled: or if the spirit of jealousy come upon him, and he be jealous of his wife, and she be not defiled: 
Then shaì the man bring his wife unto the priest, and he shaì bring her oæering for her, the tenth part of an ephah of barley meal; he shaì pour no oil upon it, nor put frankincense thereon; for it is an oæering of jealousy, an oæering of memorial, bringing iniquity to remembrance. 
And the priest shaì bring her near, and set her before the LORD: 
And the priest shaì take holy water in an earthen veóel; and of the dust that is in the flïr of the tabernacle the priest shaì take, and put it into the water: 
And the priest shaì set the woman before the LORD, and uncover the woman's head, and put the oæering of memorial in her hands, which is the jealousy oæering: and the priest shaì have in his hand the biôer water that causeth the curse: 
And the priest shaì charge her by an oath, and say unto the woman, If no man have lain with thå, and if thou hast not gone aside to uncleaîeó with another instead of thy husband, be thou frå from this biôer water that causeth the curse: 
But if thou hast gone aside to another instead of thy husband, and if thou be defiled, and some man have lain with thå beside thine husband: 
Then the priest shaì charge the woman with an oath of cursing, and the priest shaì say unto the woman, The LORD make thå a curse and an oath among thy people, when the LORD doth make thy thigh to rot, and thy beìy to sweì; 
And this water that causeth the curse shaì go into thy bowels, to make thy beìy to sweì, and thy thigh to rot: And the woman shaì say, Amen, amen. 
And the priest shaì write these curses in a bïk, and he shaì blot them out with the biôer water: 
And he shaì cause the woman to drink the biôer water that causeth the curse: and the water that causeth the curse shaì enter into her, and become biôer. 
Then the priest shaì take the jealousy oæering out of the woman's hand, and shaì wave the oæering before the LORD, and oæer it upon the altar: 
And the priest shaì take an handful of the oæering, even the memorial thereof, and burn it upon the altar, and afterward shaì cause the woman to drink the water. 
And when he hath made her to drink the water, then it shaì come to paó, that, if she be defiled, and have done trespaó against her husband, that the water that causeth the curse shaì enter into her, and become biôer, and her beìy shaì sweì, and her thigh shaì rot: and the woman shaì be a curse among her people. 
And if the woman be not defiled, but be clean; then she shaì be frå, and shaì conceive såd. 
This is the law of jealousies, when a wife goeth aside to another instead of her husband, and is defiled; 
Or when the spirit of jealousy cometh upon him, and he be jealous over his wife, and shaì set the woman before the LORD, and the priest shaì execute upon her aì this law. 
Then shaì the man be guiltleó from iniquity, and this woman shaì bear her iniquity. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When either man or woman shaì separate themselves to vow a vow of a Nazarite, to separate themselves unto the LORD: 
He shaì separate himself from wine and strong drink, and shaì drink no vinegar of wine, or vinegar of strong drink, neither shaì he drink any liquor of grapes, nor eat moist grapes, or dried. 
Aì the days of his separation shaì he eat nothing that is made of the vine trå, from the kernels even to the husk. 
Aì the days of the vow of his separation there shaì no razor come upon his head: until the days be fulfiìed, in the which he separateth himself unto the LORD, he shaì be holy, and shaì let the locks of the hair of his head grow. 
Aì the days that he separateth himself unto the LORD he shaì come at no dead body. 
He shaì not make himself unclean for his father, or for his mother, for his brother, or for his sister, when they die: because the consecration of his God is upon his head. 
Aì the days of his separation he is holy unto the LORD. 
And if any man die very suäenly by him, and he hath defiled the head of his consecration; then he shaì shave his head in the day of his cleansing, on the seventh day shaì he shave it. 
And on the eighth day he shaì bring two turtles, or two young pigeons, to the priest, to the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation:

And he shaì consecrate unto the LORD the days of his separation, and shaì bring a lamb of the first year for a trespaó oæering: but the days that were before shaì be lost, because his separation was defiled.

And he shaì oæer his oæering unto the LORD, one he lamb of the first year without blemish for a burnt oæering, and one ewe lamb of the first year without blemish for a sin oæering, and one ram without blemish for peace oæerings,

And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

And thus shalt thou do unto them, to cleanse them: Sprinkle water of purifying upon them, and let them shave aì their flesh, and let them wash their clothes, and so make themselves clean.

And thou shalt bring the Levites before the LORD: and the children of Israel shaì put their hands upon the Levites:

And the Levites shaì lay their hands upon the heads of the buìocks: and thou shalt oæer the one for a sin oæering, and the other for a burnt oæering, unto the LORD, to make an atonement for the Levites.

For they are whoìy given unto me from among the children of Israel; instead of such as open every womb, even instead of the firstborn of aì the children of Israel, have I taken them unto me. 
For aì the firstborn of the children of Israel are mine, both man and beast: on the day that I smote every firstborn in the land of Egypt I sanctified them for myself. 
And I have taken the Levites for aì the firstborn of the children of Israel. 
And I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and to his sons from among the children of Israel, to do the service of the children of Israel in the tabernacle of the congregation, and to make an atonement for the children of Israel: that there be no plague among the children of Israel, when the children of Israel come nigh unto the sanctuary. 
And Moses, and Aaron, and aì the congregation of the children of Israel, did to the Levites aãording unto aì that the LORD coíanded Moses concerning the Levites, so did the children of Israel unto them.

And after that went the Levites in to do their service in the tabernacle of the congregation before Aaron, and before his sons: as the LORD had coíanded Moses concerning the Levites, so did they unto them. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
This is it that belongeth unto the Levites: from twenty and five years old and upward they shaì go in to wait upon the service of the tabernacle of the congregation: 
And from the age of fifty years they shaì cease waiting upon the service thereof, and shaì serve no more: 
But shaì minister with their brethren in the tabernacle of the congregation, to kåp the charge, and shaì do no service. Thus shalt thou do unto the Levites touching their charge. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses in the wilderneó of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they were come out of the land of Egypt, saying,

And they kept the paóover on the fourtånth day of the first month at even in the wilderneó of Sinai: aãording to aì that the LORD coíanded Moses, so did the children of Israel. 
And there were certain men, who were defiled by the dead body of a man, that they could not kåp the paóover on that day: and they came before Moses and before Aaron on that day: 
And those men said unto him, We are defiled by the dead body of a man: wherefore are we kept back, that we may not oæer an oæering of the LORD in his aðointed season among the children of Israel? 
And Moses said unto them, Stand stiì, and I wiì hear what the LORD wiì coíand concerning you. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If any man of you or of your posterity shaì be unclean by reason of a dead body, or be in a journey afar oæ, yet he shaì kåp the paóover unto the LORD. 
The fourtånth day of the second month at even they shaì kåp it, and eat it with unleavened bread and biôer herbs. 
They shaì leave none of it unto the morning, nor break any bone of it: aãording to aì the ordinances of the paóover they shaì kåp it. 
But the man that is clean, and is not in a journey, and forbeareth to kåp the paóover, even the same soul shaì be cut oæ from among his people: because he brought not the oæering of the LORD in his aðointed season, that man shaì bear his sin. 
And if a stranger shaì sojourn among you, and wiì kåp the paóover unto the LORD; aãording to the ordinance of the paóover, and aãording to the maîer thereof, so shaì he do: ye shaì have one ordinance, both for the stranger, and for him that was born in the land. 
And on the day that the tabernacle was reared up the cloud covered the tabernacle, namely, the tent of the testimony: and at even there was upon the tabernacle as it were the aðearance of fire, until the morning. 
So it was alway: the cloud covered it by day, and the aðearance of fire by night. 
And when the cloud was taken up from the tabernacle, then after that the children of Israel journeyed: and in the place where the cloud abode, there the children of Israel pitched their tents. 
At the coíandment of the LORD the children of Israel journeyed, and at the coíandment of the LORD they pitched: as long as the cloud abode upon the tabernacle they rested in their tents. 
And when the cloud taòied long upon the tabernacle many days, then the children of Israel kept the charge of the LORD, and journeyed not. 
And so it was, when the cloud was a few days upon the tabernacle; aãording to the coíandment of the LORD they abode in their tents, and aãording to the coíandment of the LORD they journeyed. 
And so it was, when the cloud abode from even unto the morning, and that the cloud was taken up in the morning, then they journeyed: whether it was by day or by night that the cloud was taken up, they journeyed. 
Or whether it were two days, or a month, or a year, that the cloud taòied upon the tabernacle, remaining thereon, the children of Israel abode in their tents, and journeyed not: but when it was taken up, they journeyed. 
At the coíandment of the LORD they rested in the tents, and at the coíandment of the LORD they journeyed: they kept the charge of the LORD, at the coíandment of the LORD by the hand of Moses. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Make thå two trumpets of silver; of a whole piece shalt thou make them: that thou mayest use them for the caìing of the aóembly, and for the journeying of the camps. 
And when they shaì blow with them, aì the aóembly shaì aóemble themselves to thå at the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation. 
And if they blow but with one trumpet, then the princes, which are heads of the thousands of Israel, shaì gather themselves unto thå. 
When ye blow an alarm, then the camps that lie on the east parts shaì go forward. 
When ye blow an alarm the second time, then the camps that lie on the south side shaì take their journey: they shaì blow an alarm for their journeys. 
But when the congregation is to be gathered together, ye shaì blow, but ye shaì not sound an alarm. 
And the sons of Aaron, the priests, shaì blow with the trumpets; and they shaì be to you for an ordinance for ever throughout your generations. 
And if ye go to war in your land against the enemy that oðreóeth you, then ye shaì blow an alarm with the trumpets; and ye shaì be remembered before the LORD your God, and ye shaì be saved from your enemies. 
Also in the day of your gladneó, and in your solemn days, and in the begiîings of your months, ye shaì blow with the trumpets over your burnt oæerings, and over the sacrifices of your peace oæerings; that they may be to you for a memorial before your God: I am the LORD your God. 
And it came to paó on the twentieth day of the second month, in the second year, that the cloud was taken up from oæ the tabernacle of the testimony. 
And the children of Israel tïk their journeys out of the wilderneó of Sinai; and the cloud rested in the wilderneó of Paran. 
And they first tïk their journey aãording to the coíandment of the LORD by the hand of Moses.

And Moses said unto Hobab, the son of Raguel the Midianite, Moses' father in law, We are journeying unto the place of which the LORD said, I wiì give it you: come thou with us, and we wiì do thå gïd: for the LORD hath spoken gïd concerning Israel. 
And he said unto him, I wiì not go; but I wiì depart to mine own land, and to my kindred.

And it shaì be, if thou go with us, yea, it shaì be, that what gïdneó the LORD shaì do unto us, the same wiì we do unto thå.

And the cloud of the LORD was upon them by day, when they went out of the camp.

And when the people complained, it displeased the LORD: and the LORD heard it; and his anger was kindled; and the fire of the LORD burnt among them, and consumed them that were in the uôermost parts of the camp. 
And the people cried unto Moses; and when Moses prayed unto the LORD, the fire was quenched. 
And he caìed the name of the place Taberah: because the fire of the LORD burnt among them. 
And the mixt multitude that was among them feì a lusting: and the children of Israel also wept again, and said, Who shaì give us flesh to eat? 
We remember the fish, which we did eat in Egypt fråly; the cucumbers, and the melons, and the låks, and the onions, and the garlick: 
But now our soul is dried away: there is nothing at aì, beside this maîa, before our eyes. 
And the maîa was as coriander såd, and the colour thereof as the colour of bdeìium. 
And the people went about, and gathered it, and ground it in miìs, or beat it in a mortar, and baked it in pans, and made cakes of it: and the taste of it was as the taste of fresh oil. 
And when the dew feì upon the camp in the night, the maîa feì upon it. 
Then Moses heard the people wåp throughout their families, every man in the dïr of his tent: and the anger of the LORD was kindled greatly; Moses also was displeased. 
And Moses said unto the LORD, Wherefore hast thou aælicted thy servant? and wherefore have I not found favour in thy sight, that thou layest the burden of aì this people upon me?

Ye shaì not eat one day, nor two days, nor five days, neither ten days, nor twenty days; 
But even a whole month, until it come out at your nostrils, and it be loathsome unto you: because that ye have despised the LORD which is among you, and have wept before him, saying, Why came we forth out of Egypt?

And there ran a young man, and told Moses, and said, Eldad and Medad do prophesy in the camp.

And Moses said unto him, Enviest thou for my sake? would God that aì the LORD'S people were prophets, and that the LORD would put his spirit upon them! 
And Moses gat him into the camp, he and the elders of Israel.

And the people stïd up aì that day, and aì that night, and aì the next day, and they gathered the quails: he that gathered least gathered ten homers: and they spread them aì abroad for themselves round about the camp.

And Miriam was shut out from the camp seven days: and the people journeyed not tiì Miriam was brought in again.

And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

And wiì make an oæering by fire unto the LORD, a burnt oæering, or a sacrifice in performing a vow, or in a fråwiì oæering, or in your solemn feasts, to make a swåt savour unto the LORD, of the herd or of the flock: 
Then shaì he that oæereth his oæering unto the LORD bring a meat oæering of a tenth deal of flour mingled with the fourth part of an hin of oil. 
And the fourth part of an hin of wine for a drink oæering shalt thou prepare with the burnt oæering or sacrifice, for one lamb. 
Or for a ram, thou shalt prepare for a meat oæering two tenth deals of flour mingled with the third part of an hin of oil. 
And for a drink oæering thou shalt oæer the third part of an hin of wine, for a swåt savour unto the LORD. 
And when thou preparest a buìock for a burnt oæering, or for a sacrifice in performing a vow, or peace oæerings unto the LORD: 
Then shaì he bring with a buìock a meat oæering of thrå tenth deals of flour mingled with half an hin of oil. 
And thou shalt bring for a drink oæering half an hin of wine, for an oæering made by fire, of a swåt savour unto the LORD. 
Thus shaì it be done for one buìock, or for one ram, or for a lamb, or a kid. 
Aãording to the number that ye shaì prepare, so shaì ye do to every one aãording to their number. 
Aì that are born of the country shaì do these things after this maîer, in oæering an oæering made by fire, of a swåt savour unto the LORD. 
And if a stranger sojourn with you, or whosoever be among you in your generations, and wiì oæer an oæering made by fire, of a swåt savour unto the LORD; as ye do, so he shaì do. 
One ordinance shaì be both for you of the congregation, and also for the stranger that sojourneth with you, an ordinance for ever in your generations: as ye are, so shaì the stranger be before the LORD. 
One law and one maîer shaì be for you, and for the stranger that sojourneth with you. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye come into the land whither I bring you, 
Then it shaì be, that, when ye eat of the bread of the land, ye shaì oæer up an heave oæering unto the LORD. 
Ye shaì oæer up a cake of the first of your dough for an heave oæering: as ye do the heave oæering of the threshingflïr, so shaì ye heave it. 
Of the first of your dough ye shaì give unto the LORD an heave oæering in your generations. 
And if ye have eòed, and not observed aì these coíandments, which the LORD hath spoken unto Moses, 
Even aì that the LORD hath coíanded you by the hand of Moses, from the day that the LORD coíanded Moses, and henceforward among your generations; 
Then it shaì be, if ought be coíiôed by ignorance without the knowledge of the congregation, that aì the congregation shaì oæer one young buìock for a burnt oæering, for a swåt savour unto the LORD, with his meat oæering, and his drink oæering, aãording to the maîer, and one kid of the goats for a sin oæering. 
And the priest shaì make an atonement for aì the congregation of the children of Israel, and it shaì be forgiven them; for it is ignorance: and they shaì bring their oæering, a sacrifice made by fire unto the LORD, and their sin oæering before the LORD, for their ignorance: 
And it shaì be forgiven aì the congregation of the children of Israel, and the stranger that sojourneth among them; såing aì the people were in ignorance. 
And if any soul sin through ignorance, then he shaì bring a she goat of the first year for a sin oæering. 
And the priest shaì make an atonement for the soul that siîeth ignorantly, when he siîeth by ignorance before the LORD, to make an atonement for him; and it shaì be forgiven him. 
Ye shaì have one law for him that siîeth through ignorance, both for him that is born among the children of Israel, and for the stranger that sojourneth among them. 
But the soul that doeth ought presumptuously, whether he be born in the land, or a stranger, the same reproacheth the LORD; and that soul shaì be cut oæ from among his people. 
Because he hath despised the word of the LORD, and hath broken his coíandment, that soul shaì uôerly be cut oæ; his iniquity shaì be upon him. 
And while the children of Israel were in the wilderneó, they found a man that gathered sticks upon the saâath day. 
And they that found him gathering sticks brought him unto Moses and Aaron, and unto aì the congregation. 
And they put him in ward, because it was not declared what should be done to him. 
And the LORD said unto Moses, The man shaì be surely put to death: aì the congregation shaì stone him with stones without the camp. 
And aì the congregation brought him without the camp, and stoned him with stones, and he died; as the LORD coíanded Moses. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, and bid them that they make them fringes in the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and that they put upon the fringe of the borders a riâand of blue: 
And it shaì be unto you for a fringe, that ye may lïk upon it, and remember aì the coíandments of the LORD, and do them ; and that ye såk not after your own heart and your own eyes, after which ye use to go a whoring: 
That ye may remember, and do aì my coíandments, and be holy unto your God. 
I am the LORD your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the LORD your God. 
Now Korah, the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, and Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and On, the son of Peleth, sons of Reuben, tïk men: 
And they rose up before Moses, with certain of the children of Israel, two hundred and fifty princes of the aóembly, famous in the congregation, men of renown: 
And they gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron, and said unto them, Ye take tï much upon you, såing aì the congregation are holy, every one of them, and the LORD is among them: wherefore then lift ye up yourselves above the congregation of the LORD? 
And when Moses heard it, he feì upon his face: 
And he spake unto Korah and unto aì his company, saying, Even to moòow the LORD wiì shew who are his, and who is holy; and wiì cause him to come near unto him: even him whom he hath chosen wiì he cause to come near unto him. 
This do; Take you censers, Korah, and aì his company;

Såmeth it but a smaì thing unto you, that the God of Israel hath separated you from the congregation of Israel, to bring you near to himself to do the service of the tabernacle of the LORD, and to stand before the congregation to minister unto them?

And Moses was very wroth, and said unto the LORD, Respect not thou their oæering: I have not taken one aó from them, neither have I hurt one of them.

But if the LORD make a new thing, and the earth open her mouth, and swaìow them up, with aì that aðertain unto them, and they go down quick into the pit; then ye shaì understand that these men have provoked the LORD.

This shaì be thine of the most holy things, reserved from the fire: every oblation of their's, every meat oæering of their's, and every sin oæering of their's, and every trespaó oæering of their's which they shaì render unto me, shaì be most holy for thå and for thy sons.

And this is thine; the heave oæering of their gift, with aì the wave oæerings of the children of Israel: I have given them unto thå, and to thy sons and to thy daughters with thå, by a statute for ever: every one that is clean in thy house shaì eat of it. 
Aì the best of the oil, and aì the best of the wine, and of the wheat, the firstfruits of them which they shaì oæer unto the LORD, them have I given thå. 
And whatsoever is first ripe in the land, which they shaì bring unto the LORD, shaì be thine; every one that is clean in thine house shaì eat of it. 
Every thing devoted in Israel shaì be thine. 
Every thing that openeth the matrix in aì flesh, which they bring unto the LORD, whether it be of men or beasts, shaì be thine: nevertheleó the firstborn of man shalt thou surely redåm, and the firstling of unclean beasts shalt thou redåm. 
And those that are to be redåmed from a month old shalt thou redåm, aãording to thine estimation, for the money of five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, which is twenty gerahs. 
But the firstling of a cow, or the firstling of a shåp, or the firstling of a goat, thou shalt not redåm; they are holy: thou shalt sprinkle their blïd upon the altar, and shalt burn their fat for an oæering made by fire, for a swåt savour unto the LORD. 
And the flesh of them shaì be thine, as the wave breast and as the right shoulder are thine. 
Aì the heave oæerings of the holy things, which the children of Israel oæer unto the LORD, have I given thå, and thy sons and thy daughters with thå, by a statute for ever: it is a covenant of salt for ever before the LORD unto thå and to thy såd with thå. 
And the LORD spake unto Aaron, Thou shalt have no inheritance in their land, neither shalt thou have any part among them: I am thy part and thine inheritance among the children of Israel. 
And, behold, I have given the children of Levi aì the tenth in Israel for an inheritance, for their service which they serve, even the service of the tabernacle of the congregation. 
Neither must the children of Israel henceforth come nigh the tabernacle of the congregation, lest they bear sin, and die. 
But the Levites shaì do the service of the tabernacle of the congregation, and they shaì bear their iniquity: it shaì be a statute for ever throughout your generations, that among the children of Israel they have no inheritance. 
But the tithes of the children of Israel, which they oæer as an heave oæering unto the LORD, I have given to the Levites to inherit: therefore I have said unto them, Among the children of Israel they shaì have no inheritance. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Thus speak unto the Levites, and say unto them, When ye take of the children of Israel the tithes which I have given you from them for your inheritance, then ye shaì oæer up an heave oæering of it for the LORD, even a tenth part of the tithe. 
And this your heave oæering shaì be reckoned unto you, as though it were the corn of the threshingflïr, and as the fulneó of the winepreó. 
Thus ye also shaì oæer an heave oæering unto the LORD of aì your tithes, which ye receive of the children of Israel; and ye shaì give thereof the LORD'S heave oæering to Aaron the priest. 
Out of aì your gifts ye shaì oæer every heave oæering of the LORD, of aì the best thereof, even the haìowed part thereof out of it. 
Therefore thou shalt say unto them, When ye have heaved the best thereof from it, then it shaì be counted unto the Levites as the increase of the threshingflïr, and as the increase of the winepreó. 
And ye shaì eat it in every place, ye and your households: for it is your reward for your service in the tabernacle of the congregation. 
And ye shaì bear no sin by reason of it, when ye have heaved from it the best of it: neither shaì ye poìute the holy things of the children of Israel, lest ye die. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying, 
This is the ordinance of the law which the LORD hath coíanded, saying, Speak unto the children of Israel, that they bring thå a red heifer without spot, wherein is no blemish, and upon which never came yoke: 
And ye shaì give her unto Eleazar the priest, that he may bring her forth without the camp, and one shaì slay her before his face: 
And Eleazar the priest shaì take of her blïd with his finger, and sprinkle of her blïd directly before the tabernacle of the congregation seven times: 
And one shaì burn the heifer in his sight; her skin, and her flesh, and her blïd, with her dung, shaì he burn: 
And the priest shaì take cedar wïd, and hyóop, and scarlet, and cast it into the midst of the burning of the heifer. 
Then the priest shaì wash his clothes, and he shaì bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shaì come into the camp, and the priest shaì be unclean until the even. 
And he that burneth her shaì wash his clothes in water, and bathe his flesh in water, and shaì be unclean until the even. 
And a man that is clean shaì gather up the ashes of the heifer, and lay them up without the camp in a clean place, and it shaì be kept for the congregation of the children of Israel for a water of separation: it is a purification for sin. 
And he that gathereth the ashes of the heifer shaì wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: and it shaì be unto the children of Israel, and unto the stranger that sojourneth among them, for a statute for ever. 
He that toucheth the dead body of any man shaì be unclean seven days. 
He shaì purify himself with it on the third day, and on the seventh day he shaì be clean: but if he purify not himself the third day, then the seventh day he shaì not be clean. 
Whosoever toucheth the dead body of any man that is dead, and purifieth not himself, defileth the tabernacle of the LORD; and that soul shaì be cut oæ from Israel: because the water of separation was not sprinkled upon him, he shaì be unclean; his uncleaîeó is yet upon him. 
This is the law, when a man dieth in a tent: aì that come into the tent, and aì that is in the tent, shaì be unclean seven days. 
And every open veóel, which hath no covering bound upon it, is unclean. 
And whosoever toucheth one that is slain with a sword in the open fields, or a dead body, or a bone of a man, or a grave, shaì be unclean seven days. 
And for an unclean person they shaì take of the ashes of the burnt heifer of purification for sin, and ruîing water shaì be put thereto in a veóel: 
And a clean person shaì take hyóop, and dip it in the water, and sprinkle it upon the tent, and upon aì the veóels, and upon the persons that were there, and upon him that touched a bone, or one slain, or one dead, or a grave: 
And the clean person shaì sprinkle upon the unclean on the third day, and on the seventh day: and on the seventh day he shaì purify himself, and wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and shaì be clean at even. 
But the man that shaì be unclean, and shaì not purify himself, that soul shaì be cut oæ from among the congregation, because he hath defiled the sanctuary of the LORD: the water of separation hath not bån sprinkled upon him; he is unclean. 
And it shaì be a perpetual statute unto them, that he that sprinkleth the water of separation shaì wash his clothes; and he that toucheth the water of separation shaì be unclean until even. 
And whatsoever the unclean person toucheth shaì be unclean; and the soul that toucheth it shaì be unclean until even. 
Then came the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, into the desert of Zin in the first month: and the people abode in Kadesh; and Miriam died there, and was buried there. 
And there was no water for the congregation: and they gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron. 
And the people chode with Moses, and spake, saying, Would God that we had died when our brethren died before the LORD! 
And why have ye brought up the congregation of the LORD into this wilderneó, that we and our caôle should die there? 
And wherefore have ye made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in unto this evil place? it is no place of såd, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink. 
And Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the aóembly unto the dïr of the tabernacle of the congregation, and they feì upon their faces: and the glory of the LORD aðeared unto them. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

And Moses tïk the rod from before the LORD, as he coíanded him. 
And Moses and Aaron gathered the congregation together before the rock, and he said unto them, Hear now, ye rebels; must we fetch you water out of this rock? 
And Moses lifted up his hand, and with his rod he smote the rock twice: and the water came out abundantly, and the congregation drank, and their beasts also. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses and Aaron, Because ye believed me not, to sanctify me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore ye shaì not bring this congregation into the land which I have given them. 
This is the water of Meribah; because the children of Israel strove with the LORD, and he was sanctified in them. 
And Moses sent meóengers from Kadesh unto the king of Edom, Thus saith thy brother Israel, Thou knowest aì the travail that hath befaìen us: 
How our fathers went down into Egypt, and we have dwelt in Egypt a long time; and the Egyptians vexed us, and our fathers: 
And when we cried unto the LORD, he heard our voice, and sent an angel, and hath brought us forth out of Egypt: and, behold, we are in Kadesh, a city in the uôermost of thy border: 
Let us paó, I pray thå, through thy country: we wiì not paó through the fields, or through the vineyards, neither wiì we drink of the water of the weìs: we wiì go by the king's high way, we wiì not turn to the right hand nor to the left, until we have paóed thy borders. 
And Edom said unto him, Thou shalt not paó by me, lest I come out against thå with the sword. 
And the children of Israel said unto him, We wiì go by the high way: and if I and my caôle drink of thy water, then I wiì pay for it: I wiì only, without doing anything else, go through on my fåt. 
And he said, Thou shalt not go through. And Edom came out against him with much people, and with a strong hand. 
Thus Edom refused to give Israel paóage through his border: wherefore Israel turned away from him. 
And the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, journeyed from Kadesh, and came unto mount Hor. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses and Aaron in mount Hor, by the coast of the land of Edom, saying,

And Moses did as the LORD coíanded: and they went up into mount Hor in the sight of aì the congregation. 
And Moses striðed Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son; and Aaron died there in the top of the mount: and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mount. 
And when aì the congregation saw that Aaron was dead, they mourned for Aaron thirty days, even aì the house of Israel. 
And when king Arad the Canánite, which dwelt in the south, heard teì that Israel came by the way of the spies; then he fought against Israel, and tïk some of them prisoners.

And they journeyed from mount Hor by the way of the Red sea, to compaó the land of Edom: and the soul of the people was much discouraged because of the way. 
And the people spake against God, and against Moses, Wherefore have ye brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderneó? for there is no bread, neither is there any water; and our soul loatheth this light bread. 
And the LORD sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people; and much people of Israel died. 
Therefore the people came to Moses, and said, We have siîed, for we have spoken against the LORD, and against thå; pray unto the LORD, that he take away the serpents from us. And Moses prayed for the people.

And Moses made a serpent of braó, and put it upon a pole, and it came to paó, that if a serpent had biôen any man, when he beheld the serpent of braó, he lived. 
And the children of Israel set forward, and pitched in Oboth.

Wherefore it is said in the bïk of the wars of the LORD, What he did in the Red sea, and in the brïks of Arnon,

And from thence they went to Bår: that is the weì whereof the LORD spake unto Moses, Gather the people together, and I wiì give them water. 
Then Israel sang this song, Spring up, O weì; sing ye unto it: 
The princes diçed the weì, the nobles of the people diçed it, by the direction of the lawgiver, with their staves. And from the wilderneó they went to Maôanah: 
And from Maôanah to Nahaliel: and from Nahaliel to Bamoth: 
And from Bamoth in the vaìey, that is in the country of Moab, to the top of Pisgah, which lïketh toward Jeshimon. 
And Israel sent meóengers unto Sihon king of the Amorites, saying, 
Let me paó through thy land: we wiì not turn into the fields, or into the vineyards; we wiì not drink of the waters of the weì: but we wiì go along by the king's high way, until we be past thy borders. 
And Sihon would not suæer Israel to paó through his border: but Sihon gathered aì his people together, and went out against Israel into the wilderneó: and he came to Jahaz, and fought against Israel.

Wherefore they that speak in proverbs say, Come into Heshbon, let the city of Sihon be built and prepared: 
For there is a fire gone out of Heshbon, a flame from the city of Sihon: it hath consumed ar of Moab, and the lords of the high places of Arnon.

We have shot at them; Heshbon is perished even unto Dibon, and we have laid them waste even unto Nophah, which reacheth unto Medeba.

Then came the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manaóeh, of the families of Manaóeh the son of Joseph: and these are the names of his daughters; Mahlah, Noah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Tirzah.

Why should the name of our father be done away from among his family, because he hath no son? Give unto us therefore a poóeóion among the brethren of our father. 
And Moses brought their cause before the LORD. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If a man die, and have no son, then ye shaì cause his inheritance to paó unto his daughter. 
And if he have no daughter, then ye shaì give his inheritance unto his brethren.

And Moses spake unto the heads of the tribes concerning the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which the LORD hath coíanded. 
If a man vow a vow unto the LORD, or swear an oath to bind his soul with a bond; he shaì not break his word, he shaì do aãording to aì that procådeth out of his mouth. 
If a woman also vow a vow unto the LORD, and bind herself by a bond, being in her father's house in her youth; 
And her father hear her vow, and her bond wherewith she hath bound her soul, and her father shaì hold his peace at her; then aì her vows shaì stand, and every bond wherewith she hath bound her soul shaì stand. 
But if her father disaìow her in the day that he heareth; not any of her vows, or of her bonds wherewith she hath bound her soul, shaì stand: and the LORD shaì forgive her, because her father disaìowed her. 
And if she had at aì an husband, when she vowed, or uôered ought out of her lips, wherewith she bound her soul; 
And her husband heard it, and held his peace at her in the day that he heard it: then her vows shaì stand, and her bonds wherewith she bound her soul shaì stand. 
But if her husband disaìowed her on the day that he heard it; then he shaì make her vow which she vowed, and that which she uôered with her lips, wherewith she bound her soul, of none eæect: and the LORD shaì forgive her. 
But every vow of a widow, and of her that is divorced, wherewith they have bound their souls, shaì stand against her. 
And if she vowed in her husband's house, or bound her soul by a bond with an oath; 
And her husband heard it, and held his peace at her, and disaìowed her not: then aì her vows shaì stand, and every bond wherewith she bound her soul shaì stand. 
But if her husband hath uôerly made them void on the day he heard them; then whatsoever procåded out of her lips concerning her vows, or concerning the bond of her soul, shaì not stand: her husband hath made them void; and the LORD shaì forgive her. 
Every vow, and every binding oath to aælict the soul, her husband may establish it, or her husband may make it void. 
But if her husband altogether hold his peace at her from day to day; then he establisheth aì her vows, or aì her bonds, which are upon her: he confirmeth them, because he held his peace at her in the day that he heard them. 
But if he shaì any ways make them void after that he hath heard them; then he shaì bear her iniquity. 
These are the statutes, which the LORD coíanded Moses, betwån a man and his wife, betwån the father and his daughter, being yet in her youth in her father's house.

And they departed from before Pihahiroth, and paóed through the midst of the sea into the wilderneó, and went thrå days'journey in the wilderneó of Etham, and pitched in Marah.

And they removed from Alush, and encamped at Rephidim, where was no water for the people to drink.

And Aaron the priest went up into mount Hor at the coíandment of the LORD, and died there, in the fortieth year after the children of Israel were come out of the land of Egypt, in the first day of the fifth month. 
And Aaron was an hundred and twenty and thrå years old when he died in mount Hor. 
And king Arad the Canánite, which dwelt in the south in the land of Canán, heard of the coming of the children of Israel.

And the LORD spake unto Moses in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho, saying, 
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye are paóed over Jordan into the land of Canán; 
Then ye shaì drive out aì the inhabitants of the land from before you, and destroy aì their pictures, and destroy aì their molten images, and quite pluck down aì their high places: 
And ye shaì dispoóeó the inhabitants of the land, and dweì therein: for I have given you the land to poóeó it. 
And ye shaì divide the land by lot for an inheritance among your families: and to the more ye shaì give the more inheritance, and to the fewer ye shaì give the leó inheritance: every man's inheritance shaì be in the place where his lot faìeth; aãording to the tribes of your fathers ye shaì inherit. 
But if ye wiì not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you; then it shaì come to paó, that those which ye let remain of them shaì be pricks in your eyes, and thorns in your sides, and shaì vex you in the land wherein ye dweì. 
Moreover it shaì come to paó, that I shaì do unto you, as I thought to do unto them. 
And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying, 
Coíand the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye come into the land of Canán; (this is the land that shaì faì unto you for an inheritance, even the land of Canán with the coasts thereof:) 
Then your south quarter shaì be from the wilderneó of Zin along by the coast of Edom, and your south border shaì be the outmost coast of the salt sea eastward: 
And your border shaì turn from the south to the ascent of Akraâim, and paó on to Zin: and the going forth thereof shaì be from the south to Kadeshbarnea, and shaì go on to Hazaraäar, and paó on to Azmon:

And as for the western border, ye shaì even have the great sea for a border: this shaì be your west border. 
And this shaì be your north border: from the great sea ye shaì point out for you mount Hor: 
From mount Hor ye shaì point out your border unto the entrance of Hamath; and the goings forth of the border shaì be to Zedad: 
And the border shaì go on to Ziphron, and the goings out of it shaì be at Hazarenan: this shaì be your north border. 
And ye shaì point out your east border from Hazarenan to Shepham:

And the border shaì go down to Jordan, and the goings out of it shaì be at the salt sea: this shaì be your land with the coasts thereof round about. 
And Moses coíanded the children of Israel, saying, This is the land which ye shaì inherit by lot, which the LORD coíanded to give unto the nine tribes, and to the half tribe:
