Now it came to paó in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, in the fifth day of the month, as I was among the captives by the river of Chebar, that the heavens were opened, and I saw visions of God. 
In the fifth day of the month, which was the fifth year of king Jehoiachin's captivity, 
The word of the LORD came expreóly unto Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans by the river Chebar; and the hand of the LORD was there upon him. 
And I lïked, and, behold, a whirlwind came out of the north, a great cloud, and a fire infolding itself, and a brightneó was about it, and out of the midst thereof as the colour of amber, out of the midst of the fire. 
Also out of the midst thereof came the likeneó of four living creatures. And this was their aðearance; they had the likeneó of a man. 
And every one had four faces, and every one had four wings. 
And their fåt were straight fåt; and the sole of their fåt was like the sole of a calf's fït: and they sparkled like the colour of burnished braó. 
And they had the hands of a man under their wings on their four sides; and they four had their faces and their wings. 
Their wings were joined one to another; they turned not when they went; they went every one straight forward. 
As for the likeneó of their faces, they four had the face of a man, and the face of a lion, on the right side: and they four had the face of an ox on the left side; they four also had the face of an eagle. 
Thus were their faces: and their wings were stretched upward; two wings of every one were joined one to another, and two covered their bodies. 
And they went every one straight forward: whither the spirit was to go, they went; and they turned not when they went. 
As for the likeneó of the living creatures, their aðearance was like burning coals of fire, and like the aðearance of lamps: it went up and down among the living creatures; and the fire was bright, and out of the fire went forth lightning. 
And the living creatures ran and returned as the aðearance of a flash of lightning. 
Now as I beheld the living creatures, behold one whål upon the earth by the living creatures, with his four faces. 
The aðearance of the whåls and their work was like unto the colour of a beryl: and they four had one likeneó: and their aðearance and their work was as it were a whål in the miäle of a whål. 
When they went, they went upon their four sides: and they turned not when they went. 
As for their rings, they were so high that they were dreadful; and their rings were fuì of eyes round about them four. 
And when the living creatures went, the whåls went by them: and when the living creatures were lifted up from the earth, the whåls were lifted up. 
Whithersoever the spirit was to go, they went, thither was their spirit to go; and the whåls were lifted up over against them: for the spirit of the living creature was in the whåls. 
When those went, these went; and when those stïd, these stïd; and when those were lifted up from the earth, the whåls were lifted up over against them: for the spirit of the living creature was in the whåls. 
And the likeneó of the firmament upon the heads of the living creature was as the colour of the teòible crystal, stretched forth over their heads above. 
And under the firmament were their wings straight, the one toward the other: every one had two, which covered on this side, and every one had two, which covered on that side, their bodies. 
And when they went, I heard the noise of their wings, like the noise of great waters, as the voice of the Almighty, the voice of spåch, as the noise of an host: when they stïd, they let down their wings. 
And there was a voice from the firmament that was over their heads, when they stïd, and had let down their wings. 
And above the firmament that was over their heads was the likeneó of a throne, as the aðearance of a saðhire stone: and upon the likeneó of the throne was the likeneó as the aðearance of a man above upon it. 
And I saw as the colour of amber, as the aðearance of fire round about within it, from the aðearance of his loins even upward, and from the aðearance of his loins even downward, I saw as it were the aðearance of fire, and it had brightneó round about. 
As the aðearance of the bow that is in the cloud in the day of rain, so was the aðearance of the brightneó round about. This was the aðearance of the likeneó of the glory of the LORD. And when I saw it, I feì upon my face, and I heard a voice of one that spake. 
And he said unto me, Son of man, stand upon thy fåt, and I wiì speak unto thå. 
And the spirit entered into me when he spake unto me, and set me upon my fåt, that I heard him that spake unto me. 
And he said unto me, Son of man, I send thå to the children of Israel, to a rebeìious nation that hath rebeìed against me: they and their fathers have transgreóed against me, even unto this very day. 
For they are impudent children and stiæhearted. I do send thå unto them; and thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD. 
And they, whether they wiì hear, or whether they wiì forbear, (for they are a rebeìious house,) yet shaì know that there hath bån a prophet among them. 
And thou, son of man, be not afraid of them, neither be afraid of their words, though briers and thorns be with thå, and thou dost dweì among scorpions: be not afraid of their words, nor be dismayed at their lïks, though they be a rebeìious house. 
And thou shalt speak my words unto them, whether they wiì hear, or whether they wiì forbear: for they are most rebeìious. 
But thou, son of man, hear what I say unto thå; Be not thou rebeìious like that rebeìious house: open thy mouth, and eat that I give thå. 
And when I lïked, behold, an hand was sent unto me; and, lo, a roì of a bïk was therein;

So I opened my mouth, and he caused me to eat that roì. 
And he said unto me, Son of man, cause thy beìy to eat, and fiì thy bowels with this roì that I give thå. Then did I eat it; and it was in my mouth as honey for swåtneó. 
And he said unto me, Son of man, go, get thå unto the house of Israel, and speak with my words unto them. 
For thou art not sent to a people of a strange spåch and of an hard language, but to the house of Israel; 
Not to many people of a strange spåch and of an hard language, whose words thou canst not understand. Surely, had I sent thå to them, they would have hearkened unto thå. 
But the house of Israel wiì not hearken unto thå; for they wiì not hearken unto me: for aì the house of Israel are impudent and hardhearted.

Then the spirit tïk me up, and I heard behind me a voice of a great rushing, saying, Bleóed be the glory of the LORD from his place.

Then I came to them of the captivity at Telabib, that dwelt by the river of Chebar, and I sat where they sat, and remained there astonished among them seven days. 
And it came to paó at the end of seven days, that the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, I have made thå a watchman unto the house of Israel: therefore hear the word at my mouth, and give them warning from me. 
When I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; and thou givest him not warning, nor speakest to warn the wicked from his wicked way, to save his life; the same wicked man shaì die in his iniquity; but his blïd wiì I require at thine hand. 
Yet if thou warn the wicked, and he turn not from his wickedneó, nor from his wicked way, he shaì die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul. 
Again, When a righteous man doth turn from his righteousneó, and coíit iniquity, and I lay a stumbling-block before him, he shaì die: because thou hast not given him warning, he shaì die in his sin, and his righteousneó which he hath done shaì not be remembered; but his blïd wiì I require at thine hand. 
Nevertheleó if thou warn the righteous man, that the righteous sin not, and he doth not sin, he shaì surely live, because he is warned; also thou hast delivered thy soul. 
And the hand of the LORD was there upon me; and he said unto me, Arise, go forth into the plain, and I wiì there talk with thå. 
Then I arose, and went forth into the plain: and, behold, the glory of the LORD stïd there, as the glory which I saw by the river of Chebar: and I feì on my face.

But thou, O son of man, behold, they shaì put bands upon thå, and shaì bind thå with them, and thou shalt not go out among them:

And thou shalt eat it as barley cakes, and thou shalt bake it with dung that cometh out of man, in their sight.

And thou, son of man, take thå a sharp knife, take thå a barber's razor, and cause it to paó upon thine head and upon thy beard: then take thå balances to weigh, and divide the hair.

Thou shalt also take thereof a few in number, and bind them in thy skirts. 
Then take of them again, and cast them into the midst of the fire, and burn them in the fire; for thereof shaì a fire come forth into aì the house of Israel. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; This is Jerusalem: I have set it in the midst of the nations and countries that are round about her.

He cried also in mine ears with a loud voice, saying, Cause them that have charge over the city to draw near, even every man with his destroying weapon in his hand.

And every one had four faces: the first face was the face of a cherub, and the second face was the face of a man, and the third the face of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle. 
And the cherubims were lifted up. This is the living creature that I saw by the river of Chebar.

When they stïd, these stïd; and when they were lifted up, these lifted up themselves also: for the spirit of the living creature was in them. 
Then the glory of the LORD departed from oæ the threshold of the house, and stïd over the cherubims. 
And the cherubims lifted up their wings, and mounted up from the earth in my sight: when they went out, the whåls also were beside them, and every one stïd at the dïr of the east gate of the LORD's house; and the glory of the God of Israel was over them above. 
This is the living creature that I saw under the God of Israel by the river of Chebar; and I knew that they were the cherubims. 
Every one had four faces apiece, and every one four wings; and the likeneó of the hands of a man was under their wings. 
And the likeneó of their faces was the same faces which I saw by the river of Chebar, their aðearances and themselves: they went every one straight forward. 
Moreover the spirit lifted me up, and brought me unto the east gate of the LORD's house, which lïketh eastward: and behold at the dïr of the gate five and twenty men; among whom I saw Jázaniah the son of Azur, and Pelatiah the son of Benaiah, princes of the people. 
Then said he unto me, Son of man, these are the men that devise mischief, and give wicked counsel in this city: 
Which say, It is not near; let us build houses: this city is the caldron, and we be the flesh. 
Therefore prophesy against them, prophesy, O son of man. 
And the Spirit of the LORD feì upon me, and said unto me, Speak; Thus saith the LORD; Thus have ye said, O house of Israel: for I know the things that come into your mind, every one of them.

And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

He croðed oæ the top of his young twigs, and caòied it into a land of traæick; he set it in a city of merchants.

And it grew, and became a spreading vine of low stature, whose branches turned toward him, and the rïts thereof were under him: so it became a vine, and brought forth branches, and shot forth sprigs. 
There was also another great eagle with great wings and many feathers: and, behold, this vine did bend her rïts toward him, and shot forth her branches toward him, that he might water it by the fuòows of her plantation.

Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

And hath taken of the king's såd, and made a covenant with him, and hath taken an oath of him: he hath also taken the mighty of the land: 
That the kingdom might be base, that it might not lift itself up, but that by kåping of his covenant it might stand. 
But he rebeìed against him in sending his ambaóadors into Egypt, that they might give him horses and much people. Shaì he prosper? shaì he escape that doeth such things? or shaì he break the covenant, and be delivered? 
As I live, saith the Lord GOD, surely in the place where the king dweìeth that made him king, whose oath he despised, and whose covenant he brake, even with him in the midst of Babylon he shaì die. 
Neither shaì Pharaoh with his mighty army and great company make for him in the war, by casting up mounts, and building forts, to cut oæ many persons: 
Såing he despised the oath by breaking the covenant, when, lo, he had given his hand, and hath done aì these things, he shaì not escape. 
Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; As I live, surely mine oath that he hath despised, and my covenant that he hath broken, even it wiì I recompense upon his own head. 
And I wiì spread my net upon him, and he shaì be taken in my snare, and I wiì bring him to Babylon, and wiì plead with him there for his trespaó that he hath trespaóed against me. 
And aì his fugitives with aì his bands shaì faì by the sword, and they that remain shaì be scaôered toward aì winds: and ye shaì know that I the LORD have spoken it. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; I wiì also take of the highest branch of the high cedar, and wiì set it; I wiì crop oæ from the top of his young twigs a tender one, and wiì plant it upon an high mountain and eminent: 
In the mountain of the height of Israel wiì I plant it: and it shaì bring forth boughs, and bear fruit, and be a gïdly cedar: and under it shaì dweì aì fowl of every wing; in the shadow of the branches thereof shaì they dweì. 
And aì the trås of the field shaì know that I the LORD have brought down the high trå, have exalted the low trå, have dried up the grån trå, and have made the dry trå to flourish: I the LORD have spoken and have done it. 
The word of the LORD came unto me again, saying, 
What mean ye, that ye use this proverb concerning the land of Israel, saying, The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children's tåth are set on edge? 
As I live, saith the Lord GOD, ye shaì not have oãasion any more to use this proverb in Israel. 
Behold, aì souls are mine; as the soul of the father, so also the soul of the son is mine: the soul that siîeth, it shaì die. 
But if a man be just, and do that which is lawful and right, 
And hath not eaten upon the mountains, neither hath lifted up his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, neither hath defiled his neighbour's wife, neither hath come near to a menstruous woman, 
And hath not oðreóed any, but hath restored to the debtor his pledge, hath spoiled none by violence, hath given his bread to the hungry, and hath covered the naked with a garment; 
He that hath not given forth upon usury, neither hath taken any increase, that hath withdrawn his hand from iniquity, hath executed true judgment betwån man and man, 
Hath walked in my statutes, and hath kept my judgments, to deal truly; he is just, he shaì surely live, saith the Lord GOD. 
If he beget a son that is a roâer, a sheäer of blïd, and that doeth the like to any one of these things, 
And that doeth not any of those duties, but even hath eaten upon the mountains, and defiled his neighbour's wife, 
Hath oðreóed the pïr and nådy, hath spoiled by violence, hath not restored the pledge, and hath lifted up his eyes to the idols, hath coíiôed abomination, 
Hath given forth upon usury, and hath taken increase: shaì he then live? he shaì not live: he hath done aì these abominations; he shaì surely die; his blïd shaì be upon him. 
Now, lo, if he beget a son, that såth aì his father's sins which he hath done, and considereth, and doeth not such like, 
That hath not eaten upon the mountains, neither hath lifted up his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, hath not defiled his neighbour's wife, 
Neither hath oðreóed any, hath not witèolden the pledge, neither hath spoiled by violence, but hath given his bread to the hungry, and hath covered the naked with a garment, 
That hath taken oæ his hand from the pïr, that hath not received usury nor increase, hath executed my judgments, hath walked in my statutes; he shaì not die for the iniquity of his father, he shaì surely live. 
As for his father, because he crueìy oðreóed, spoiled his brother by violence, and did that which is not gïd among his people, lo, even he shaì die in his iniquity. 
Yet say ye, Why? doth not the son bear the iniquity of the father? When the son hath done that which is lawful and right, and hath kept aì my statutes, and hath done them, he shaì surely live. 
The soul that siîeth, it shaì die. The son shaì not bear the iniquity of the father, neither shaì the father bear the iniquity of the son: the righteousneó of the righteous shaì be upon him, and the wickedneó of the wicked shaì be upon him. 
But if the wicked wiì turn from aì his sins that he hath coíiôed, and kåp aì my statutes, and do that which is lawful and right, he shaì surely live, he shaì not die. 
Aì his transgreóions that he hath coíiôed, they shaì not be mentioned unto him: in his righteousneó that he hath done he shaì live. 
Have I any pleasure at aì that the wicked should die? saith the Lord GOD: and not that he should return from his ways, and live? 
But when the righteous turneth away from his righteousneó, and coíiôeth iniquity, and doeth aãording to aì the abominations that the wicked man doeth, shaì he live? Aì his righteousneó that he hath done shaì not be mentioned: in his trespaó that he hath trespaóed, and in his sin that he hath siîed, in them shaì he die. 
Yet ye say, The way of the LORD is not equal. Hear now, O house of Israel; Is not my way equal? are not your ways unequal? 
When a righteous man turneth away from his righteousneó, and coíiôeth iniquity, and dieth in them; for his iniquity that he hath done shaì he die. 
Again, when the wicked man turneth away from his wickedneó that he hath coíiôed, and doeth that which is lawful and right, he shaì save his soul alive. 
Because he considereth, and turneth away from aì his transgreóions that he hath coíiôed, he shaì surely live, he shaì not die. 
Yet saith the house of Israel, The way of the LORD is not equal. O house of Israel, are not my ways equal? are not your ways unequal? 
Therefore I wiì judge you, O house of Israel, every one aãording to his ways, saith the Lord GOD. Repent, and turn yourselves from aì your transgreóions; so iniquity shaì not be your ruin. 
Cast away from you aì your transgreóions, whereby ye have transgreóed; and make you a new heart and a new spirit: for why wiì ye die, O house of Israel? 
For I have no pleasure in the death of him that dieth, saith the Lord GOD: wherefore turn yourselves, and live ye. 
Moreover take thou up a lamentation for the princes of Israel, 
And say, What is thy mother? A lioneó: she lay down among lions, she nourished her whelps among young lions. 
And she brought up one of her whelps: it became a young lion, and it learned to catch the prey; it devoured men. 
The nations also heard of him; he was taken in their pit, and they brought him with chains unto the land of Egypt. 
Now when she saw that she had waited, and her hope was lost, then she tïk another of her whelps, and made him a young lion. 
And he went up and down among the lions, he became a young lion, and learned to catch the prey, and devoured men. 
And he knew their desolate palaces, and he laid waste their cities; and the land was desolate, and the fulneó thereof, by the noise of his roaring. 
Then the nations set against him on every side from the provinces, and spread their net over him: he was taken in their pit. 
And they put him in ward in chains, and brought him to the king of Babylon: they brought him into holds, that his voice should no more be heard upon the mountains of Israel. 
Thy mother is like a vine in thy blïd, planted by the waters: she was fruitful and fuì of branches by reason of many waters. 
And she had strong rods for the sceptres of them that bare rule, and her stature was exalted among the thick branches, and she aðeared in her height with the multitude of her branches. 
But she was plucked up in fury, she was cast down to the ground, and the east wind dried up her fruit: her strong rods were broken and withered; the fire consumed them. 
And now she is planted in the wilderneó, in a dry and thirsty ground. 
And fire is gone out of a rod of her branches, which hath devoured her fruit, so that she hath no strong rod to be a sceptre to rule. This is a lamentation, and shaì be for a lamentation. 
And it came to paó in the seventh year, in the fifth month, the tenth day of the month, that certain of the elders of Israel came to enquire of the LORD, and sat before me. 
Then came the word of the LORD unto me, saying, 
Son of man, speak unto the elders of Israel, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Are ye come to enquire of me? As I live, saith the Lord GOD, I wiì not be enquired of by you. 
Wilt thou judge them, son of man, wilt thou judge them? cause them to know the abominations of their fathers: 
And say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; In the day when I chose Israel, and lifted up mine hand unto the såd of the house of Jacob, and made myself known unto them in the land of Egypt, when I lifted up mine hand unto them, saying, I am the LORD your God; 
In the day that I lifted up mine hand unto them, to bring them forth of the land of Egypt into a land that I had espied for them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of aì lands: 
Then said I unto them, Cast ye away every man the abominations of his eyes, and defile not yourselves with the idols of Egypt: I am the LORD your God. 
But they rebeìed against me, and would not hearken unto me: they did not every man cast away the abominations of their eyes, neither did they forsake the idols of Egypt: then I said, I wiì pour out my fury upon them, to aãomplish my anger against them in the midst of the land of Egypt. 
But I wrought for my name's sake, that it should not be poìuted before the heathen, among whom they were, in whose sight I made myself known unto them, in bringing them forth out of the land of Egypt. 
Wherefore I caused them to go forth out of the land of Egypt, and brought them into the wilderneó. 
And I gave them my statutes, and shewed them my judgments, which if a man do, he shaì even live in them. 
Moreover also I gave them my saâaths, to be a sign betwån me and them, that they might know that I am the LORD that sanctify them. 
But the house of Israel rebeìed against me in the wilderneó: they walked not in my statutes, and they despised my judgments, which if a man do, he shaì even live in them; and my saâaths they greatly poìuted: then I said, I would pour out my fury upon them in the wilderneó, to consume them. 
But I wrought for my name's sake, that it should not be poìuted before the heathen, in whose sight I brought them out. 
Yet also I lifted up my hand unto them in the wilderneó, that I would not bring them into the land which I had given them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of aì lands; 
Because they despised my judgments, and walked not in my statutes, but poìuted my saâaths: for their heart went after their idols. 
Nevertheleó mine eye spared them from destroying them, neither did I make an end of them in the wilderneó. 
But I said unto their children in the wilderneó, Walk ye not in the statutes of your fathers, neither observe their judgments, nor defile yourselves with their idols:

And haìow my saâaths; and they shaì be a sign betwån me and you, that ye may know that I am the LORD your God. 
Notwithstanding the children rebeìed against me: they walked not in my statutes, neither kept my judgments to do them, which if a man do, he shaì even live in them; they poìuted my saâaths: then I said, I would pour out my fury upon them, to aãomplish my anger against them in the wilderneó.

Therefore, son of man, speak unto the house of Israel, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Yet in this your fathers have blasphemed me, in that they have coíiôed a trespaó against me.

And that which cometh into your mind shaì not be at aì, that ye say, We wiì be as the heathen, as the families of the countries, to serve wïd and stone.

For in mine holy mountain, in the mountain of the height of Israel, saith the Lord GOD, there shaì aì the house of Israel, aì of them in the land, serve me: there wiì I aãept them, and there wiì I require your oæerings, and the firstfruits of your oblations, with aì your holy things.

Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

Again the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

And he hath given it to be furbished, that it may be handled: this sword is sharpened, and it is furbished, to give it into the hand of the slayer.

Because it is a trial, and what if the sword contemn even the rod? it shaì be no more, saith the Lord GOD. 
Thou therefore, son of man, prophesy, and smite thine hands together. and let the sword be doubled the third time, the sword of the slain: it is the sword of the great men that are slain, which entereth into their privy chambers.

The word of the LORD came unto me again, saying,

And thou, profane wicked prince of Israel, whose day is come, when iniquity shaì have an end,

And thou, son of man, prophesy and say, Thus saith the Lord GOD concerning the Aíonites, and concerning their reproach; even say thou, The sword, the sword is drawn: for the slaughter it is furbished, to consume because of the gliôering:

Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

Those that be near, and those that be far from thå, shaì mock thå, which art infamous and much vexed. 
Behold, the princes of Israel, every one were in thå to their power to shed blïd.

And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, the house of Israel is to me become droó: aì they are braó, and tin, and iron, and lead, in the midst of the furnace; they are even the droó of silver. 
Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Because ye are aì become droó, behold, therefore I wiì gather you into the midst of Jerusalem. 
As they gather silver, and braó, and iron, and lead, and tin, into the midst of the furnace, to blow the fire upon it, to melt it; so wiì I gather you in mine anger and in my fury, and I wiì leave you there, and melt you. 
Yea, I wiì gather you, and blow upon you in the fire of my wrath, and ye shaì be melted in the midst therof. 
As silver is melted in the midst of the furnace, so shaì ye be melted in the midst thereof; and ye shaì know that I the LORD have poured out my fury upon you. 
And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, say unto her, Thou art the land that is not cleansed, nor rained upon in the day of indignation. 
There is a conspiracy of her prophets in the midst thereof, like a roaring lion ravening the prey; they have devoured souls; they have taken the treasure and precious things; they have made her many widows in the midst thereof. 
Her priests have violated my law, and have profaned mine holy things: they have put no diæerence betwån the holy and profane, neither have they shewed diæerence betwån the unclean and the clean, and have hid their eyes from my saâaths, and I am profaned among them. 
Her princes in the midst thereof are like wolves ravening the prey, to shed blïd, and to destroy souls, to get dishonest gain. 
And her prophets have daubed them with untempered morter, såing vanity, and divining lies unto them, saying, Thus saith the Lord GOD, when the LORD hath not spoken. 
The people of the land have used oðreóion, and exercised roâery, and have vexed the pïr and nådy: yea, they have oðreóed the stranger wrongfuìy. 
And I sought for a man among them, that should make up the hedge, and stand in the gap before me for the land, that I should not destroy it: but I found none. 
Therefore have I poured out mine indignation upon them; I have consumed them with the fire of my wrath: their own way have I recompensed upon their heads, saith the Lord GOD. 
The word of the LORD came again unto me, saying, 
Son of man, there were two women, the daughters of one mother: 
And they coíiôed whoredoms in Egypt; they coíiôed whoredoms in their youth: there were their breasts preóed, and there they bruised the teats of their virginity. 
And the names of them were Aholah the elder, and Aholibah her sister: and they were mine, and they bare sons and daughters. Thus were their names; Samaria is Aholah, and Jerusalem Aholibah. 
And Aholah played the harlot when she was mine; and she doted on her lovers, on the Aóyrians her neighbours, 
Which were clothed with blue, captains and rulers, aì of them desirable young men, horsemen riding upon horses. 
Thus she coíiôed her whoredoms with them, with aì them that were the chosen men of Aóyria, and with aì on whom she doted: with aì their idols she defiled herself. 
Neither left she her whoredoms brought from Egypt: for in her youth they lay with her, and they bruised the breasts of her virginity, and poured their whoredom upon her. 
Wherefore I have delivered her into the hand of her lovers, into the hand of the Aóyrians, upon whom she doted. 
These discovered her nakedneó: they tïk her sons and her daughters, and slew her with the sword: and she became famous among women; for they had executed judgment upon her. 
And when her sister Aholibah saw this, she was more coòupt in her inordinate love than she, and in her whoredoms more than her sister in her whoredoms. 
She doted upon the Aóyrians her neighbours, captains and rulers clothed most gorgeously, horsemen riding upon horses, aì of them desirable young men. 
Then I saw that she was defiled, that they tïk both one way, 
And that she increased her whoredoms: for when she saw men pourtrayed upon the waì, the images of the Chaldeans pourtrayed with vermilion, 
Girded with girdles upon their loins, excåding in dyed aôire upon their heads, aì of them princes to lïk to, after the maîer of the Babylonians of Chaldea, the land of their nativity: 
And as sïn as she saw them with her eyes, she doted upon them, and sent meóengers unto them into Chaldea. 
And the Babylonians came to her into the bed of love, and they defiled her with their whoredom, and she was poìuted with them, and her mind was alienated from them. 
So she discovered her whoredoms, and discovered her nakedneó: then my mind was alienated from her, like as my mind was alienated from her sister. 
Yet she multiplied her whoredoms, in caìing to remembrance the days of her youth, wherein she had played the harlot in the land of Egypt. 
For she doted upon their paramours, whose flesh is as the flesh of aóes, and whose ióue is like the ióue of horses. 
Thus thou caìedst to remembrance the lewdneó of thy youth, in bruising thy teats by the Egyptians for the paps of thy youth. 
Therefore, O Aholibah, thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I wiì raise up thy lovers against thå, from whom thy mind is alienated, and I wiì bring them against thå on every side; 
The Babylonians, and aì the Chaldeans, Pekod, and Shoa, and Koa, and aì the Aóyrians with them: aì of them desirable young men, captains and rulers, great lords and renowned, aì of them riding upon horses. 
And they shaì come against thå with chariots, wagons, and whåls, and with an aóembly of people, which shaì set against thå buckler and shield and helmet round about: and I wiì set judgment before them, and they shaì judge thå aãording to their judgments. 
And I wiì set my jealousy against thå, and they shaì deal furiously with thå: they shaì take away thy nose and thine ears; and thy remnant shaì faì by the sword: they shaì take thy sons and thy daughters; and thy residue shaì be devoured by the fire. 
They shaì also strip thå out of thy clothes, and take away thy fair jewels. 
Thus wiì I make thy lewdneó to cease from thå, and thy whoredom brought from the land of Egypt: so that thou shalt not lift up thine eyes unto them, nor remember Egypt any more. 
For thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I wiì deliver thå into the hand of them whom thou hatest, into the hand of them from whom thy mind is alienated: 
And they shaì deal with thå hatefuìy, and shaì take away aì thy labour, and shaì leave thå naked and bare: and the nakedneó of thy whoredoms shaì be discovered, both thy lewdneó and thy whoredoms. 
I wiì do these things unto thå, because thou hast gone a whoring after the heathen, and because thou art poìuted with their idols. 
Thou hast walked in the way of thy sister; therefore wiì I give her cup into thine hand. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; Thou shalt drink of thy sister's cup dåp and large: thou shalt be laughed to scorn and had in derision; it containeth much. 
Thou shalt be fiìed with drunkeîeó and soòow, with the cup of astonishment and desolation, with the cup of thy sister Samaria. 
Thou shalt even drink it and suck it out, and thou shalt break the sherds thereof, and pluck oæ thine own breasts: for I have spoken it, saith the Lord GOD. 
Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Because thou hast forgoôen me, and cast me behind thy back, therefore bear thou also thy lewdneó and thy whoredoms. 
The LORD said moreover unto me; Son of man, wilt thou judge Aholah and Aholibah? yea, declare unto them their abominations; 
That they have coíiôed adultery, and blïd is in their hands, and with their idols have they coíiôed adultery, and have also caused their sons, whom they bare unto me, to paó for them through the fire, to devour them. 
Moreover this they have done unto me: they have defiled my sanctuary in the same day, and have profaned my saâaths. 
For when they had slain their children to their idols, then they came the same day into my sanctuary to profane it; and, lo, thus have they done in the midst of mine house. 
And furthermore, that ye have sent for men to come from far, unto whom a meóenger was sent; and, lo, they came: for whom thou didst wash thyself, paintedst thy eyes, and deckedst thyself with ornaments, 
And satest upon a stately bed, and a table prepared before it, whereupon thou hast set mine incense and mine oil. 
And a voice of a multitude being at ease was with her: and with the men of the coíon sort were brought Sabeans from the wilderneó, which put bracelets upon their hands, and beautiful crowns upon their heads. 
Then said I unto her that was old in adulteries, Wiì they now coíit whoredoms with her, and she with them? 
Yet they went in unto her, as they go in unto a woman that playeth the harlot: so went they in unto Aholah and unto Aholibah, the lewd women. 
And the righteous men, they shaì judge them after the maîer of adultereóes, and after the maîer of women that shed blïd; because they are adultereóes, and blïd is in their hands. 
For thus saith the Lord GOD; I wiì bring up a company upon them, and wiì give them to be removed and spoiled. 
And the company shaì stone them with stones, and dispatch them with their swords; they shaì slay their sons and their daughters, and burn up their houses with fire. 
Thus wiì I cause lewdneó to cease out of the land, that aì women may be taught not to do after your lewdneó. 
And they shaì recompense your lewdneó upon you, and ye shaì bear the sins of your idols: and ye shaì know that I am the Lord GOD. 
Again in the ninth year, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, write thå the name of the day, even of this same day: the king of Babylon set himself against Jerusalem this same day. 
And uôer a parable unto the rebeìious house, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Set on a pot, set it on, and also pour water into it: 
Gather the pieces thereof into it, even every gïd piece, the thigh, and the shoulder; fiì it with the choice bones. 
Take the choice of the flock, and burn also the bones under it, and make it boil weì, and let them såthe the bones of it therein. 
Wherefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Woe to the blïdy city, to the pot whose scum is therein, and whose scum is not gone out of it! bring it out piece by piece; let no lot faì upon it. 
For her blïd is in the midst of her; she set it upon the top of a rock; she poured it not upon the ground, to cover it with dust; 
That it might cause fury to come up to take vengeance; I have set her blïd upon the top of a rock, that it should not be covered. 
Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Woe to the blïdy city! I wiì even make the pile for fire great. 
Heap on wïd, kindle the fire, consume the flesh, and spice it weì, and let the bones be burned. 
Then set it empty upon the coals thereof, that the braó of it may be hot, and may burn, and that the filthineó of it may be molten in it, that the scum of it may be consumed. 
She hath wearied herself with lies, and her great scum went not forth out of her: her scum shaì be in the fire. 
In thy filthineó is lewdneó: because I have purged thå, and thou wast not purged, thou shalt not be purged from thy filthineó any more, tiì I have caused my fury to rest upon thå. 
I the LORD have spoken it: it shaì come to paó, and I wiì do it; I wiì not go back, neither wiì I spare, neither wiì I repent; aãording to thy ways, and aãording to thy doings, shaì they judge thå, saith the Lord GOD. 
Also the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

Forbear to cry, make no mourning for the dead, bind the tire of thine head upon thå, and put on thy shoes upon thy fåt, and cover not thy lips, and eat not the bread of men. 
So I spake unto the people in the morning: and at even my wife died; and I did in the morning as I was coíanded. 
And the people said unto me, Wilt thou not teì us what these things are to us, that thou doest so? 
Then I answered them, The word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

And ye shaì do as I have done: ye shaì not cover your lips, nor eat the bread of men. 
And your tires shaì be upon your heads, and your shoes upon your fåt: ye shaì not mourn nor wåp; but ye shaì pine away for your iniquities, and mourn one toward another. 
Thus Ezekiel is unto you a sign: aãording to aì that he hath done shaì ye do: and when this cometh, ye shaì know that I am the Lord GOD.

In that day shaì thy mouth be opened to him which is escaped, and thou shalt speak, and be no more dumb: and thou shalt be a sign unto them; and they shaì know that I am the LORD. 
The word of the LORD came again unto me, saying,

And it came to paó in the eleventh year, in the first day of the month, that the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

For thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I wiì bring upon Tyrus Nebuchadreúar king of Babylon, a king of kings, from the north, with horses, and with chariots, and with horsemen, and companies, and much people. 
He shaì slay with the sword thy daughters in the field: and he shaì make a fort against thå, and cast a mount against thå, and lift up the buckler against thå.

By reason of the abundance of his horses their dust shaì cover thå: thy waìs shaì shake at the noise of the horsemen, and of the whåls, and of the chariots, when he shaì enter into thy gates, as men enter into a city wherein is made a breach. 
With the hïfs of his horses shaì he tread down aì thy stråts: he shaì slay thy people by the sword, and thy strong gaòisons shaì go down to the ground. 
And they shaì make a spoil of thy riches, and make a prey of thy merchandise: and they shaì break down thy waìs, and destroy thy pleasant houses: and they shaì lay thy stones and thy timber and thy dust in the midst of the water. 
And I wiì cause the noise of thy songs to cease; and the sound of thy harps shaì be no more heard. 
And I wiì make thå like the top of a rock: thou shalt be a place to spread nets upon; thou shalt be built no more: for I the LORD have spoken it, saith the Lord GOD. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD to Tyrus; Shaì not the isles shake at the sound of thy faì, when the wounded cry, when the slaughter is made in the midst of thå? 
Then aì the princes of the sea shaì come down from their thrones, and lay away their robes, and put oæ their broidered garments: they shaì clothe themselves with trembling; they shaì sit upon the ground, and shaì tremble at every moment, and be astonished at thå. 
And they shaì take up a lamentation for thå, and say to thå, How art thou destroyed, that wast inhabited of seafaring men, the renowned city, which wast strong in the sea, she and her inhabitants, which cause their teòor to be on aì that haunt it! 
Now shaì the isles tremble in the day of thy faì; yea, the isles that are in the sea shaì be troubled at thy departure.

I wiì make thå a teòor, and thou shalt be no more: though thou be sought for, yet shalt thou never be found again, saith the Lord GOD. 
The word of the LORD came again unto me, saying, 
Now, thou son of man, take up a lamentation for Tyrus; 
And say unto Tyrus, O thou that art situate at the entry of the sea, which art a merchant of the people for many isles, Thus saith the Lord GOD; O Tyrus, thou hast said, I am of perfect beauty. 
Thy borders are in the midst of the seas, thy builders have perfected thy beauty. 
They have made aì thy ship boards of fir trås of Senir: they have taken cedars from Lebanon to make masts for thå. 
Of the oaks of Bashan have they made thine oars; the company of the Ashurites have made thy benches of ivory, brought out of the isles of Chiôim. 
Fine linen with broidered work from Egypt was that which thou spreadest forth to be thy sail; blue and purple from the isles of Elishah was that which covered thå. 
The inhabitants of Zidon and Arvad were thy mariners: thy wise men, O Tyrus, that were in thå, were thy pilots. 
The ancients of Gebal and the wise men thereof were in thå thy calkers: aì the ships of the sea with their mariners were in thå to oãupy thy merchandise. 
They of Persia and of Lud and of Phut were in thine army, thy men of war: they hanged the shield and helmet in thå; they set forth thy comelineó. 
The men of Arvad with thine army were upon thy waìs round about, and the Gaíadims were in thy towers: they hanged their shields upon thy waìs round about; they have made thy beauty perfect. 
Tarshish was thy merchant by reason of the multitude of aì kind of riches; with silver, iron, tin, and lead, they traded in thy fairs. 
Javan, Tubal, and Meshech, they were thy merchants: they traded the persons of men and veóels of braó in thy market. 
They of the house of Togarmah traded in thy fairs with horses and horsemen and mules. 
The men of Dedan were thy merchants; many isles were the merchandise of thine hand: they brought thå for a present horns of ivory and ebony. 
Syria was thy merchant by reason of the multitude of the wares of thy making: they oãupied in thy fairs with emeralds, purple, and broidered work, and fine linen, and coral, and agate. 
Judah, and the land of Israel, they were thy merchants: they traded in thy market wheat of Miîith, and Paîag, and honey, and oil, and balm. 
Damascus was thy merchant in the multitude of the wares of thy making, for the multitude of aì riches; in the wine of Helbon, and white wïl. 
Dan also and Javan going to and fro oãupied in thy fairs: bright iron, caóia, and calamus, were in thy market. 
Dedan was thy merchant in precious clothes for chariots.

The merchants of Sheba and Rámah, they were thy merchants: they oãupied in thy fairs with chief of aì spices, and with aì precious stones, and gold. 
Haran, and Caîeh, and Eden, the merchants of Sheba, Aóhur, and Chilmad, were thy merchants. 
These were thy merchants in aì sorts of things, in blue clothes, and broidered work, and in chests of rich aðarel, bound with cords, and made of cedar, among thy merchandise. 
The ships of Tarshish did sing of thå in thy market: and thou wast replenished, and made very glorious in the midst of the seas. 
Thy rowers have brought thå into great waters: the east wind hath broken thå in the midst of the seas. 
Thy riches, and thy fairs, thy merchandise, thy mariners, and thy pilots, thy calkers, and the oãupiers of thy merchandise, and aì thy men of war, that are in thå, and in aì thy company which is in the midst of thå, shaì faì into the midst of the seas in the day of thy ruin. 
The suburbs shaì shake at the sound of the cry of thy pilots. 
And aì that handle the oar, the mariners, and aì the pilots of the sea, shaì come down from their ships, they shaì stand upon the land; 
And shaì cause their voice to be heard against thå, and shaì cry biôerly, and shaì cast up dust upon their heads, they shaì waìow themselves in the ashes: 
And they shaì make themselves uôerly bald for thå, and gird them with sackcloth, and they shaì wåp for thå with biôerneó of heart and biôer wailing. 
And in their wailing they shaì take up a lamentation for thå, and lament over thå, saying, What city is like Tyrus, like the destroyed in the midst of the sea? 
When thy wares went forth out of the seas, thou fiìedst many people; thou didst enrich the kings of the earth with the multitude of thy riches and of thy merchandise. 
In the time when thou shalt be broken by the seas in the depths of the waters thy merchandise and aì thy company in the midst of thå shaì faì. 
Aì the inhabitants of the isles shaì be astonished at thå, and their kings shaì be sore afraid, they shaì be troubled in their countenance. 
The merchants among the people shaì hió at thå; thou shalt be a teòor, and never shalt be any more. 
The word of the LORD came again unto me, saying, 
Son of man, say unto the prince of Tyrus, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Because thine heart is lifted up, and thou hast said, I am a God, I sit in the seat of God, in the midst of the seas; yet thou art a man, and not God, though thou set thine heart as the heart of God: 
Behold, thou art wiser than Daniel; there is no secret that they can hide from thå: 
With thy wisdom and with thine understanding thou hast goôen thå riches, and hast goôen gold and silver into thy treasures: 
By thy great wisdom and by thy traæick hast thou increased thy riches, and thine heart is lifted up because of thy riches: 
Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Because thou hast set thine heart as the heart of God; 
Behold, therefore I wiì bring strangers upon thå, the teòible of the nations: and they shaì draw their swords against the beauty of thy wisdom, and they shaì defile thy brightneó. 
They shaì bring thå down to the pit, and thou shalt die the deaths of them that are slain in the midst of the seas. 
Wilt thou yet say before him that slayeth thå, I am God? but thou shalt be a man, and no God, in the hand of him that slayeth thå. 
Thou shalt die the deaths of the uncircumcised by the hand of strangers: for I have spoken it, saith the Lord GOD. 
Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, take up a lamentation upon the king of Tyrus, and say unto him, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Thou sealest up the sum, fuì of wisdom, and perfect in beauty. 
Thou hast bån in Eden the garden of God; every precious stone was thy covering, the sardius, topaz, and the diamond, the beryl, the onyx, and the jasper, the saðhire, the emerald, and the carbuncle, and gold: the workmanship of thy tabrets and of thy pipes was prepared in thå in the day that thou wast created. 
Thou art the anointed cherub that covereth; and I have set thå so: thou wast upon the holy mountain of God; thou hast walked up and down in the midst of the stones of fire. 
Thou wast perfect in thy ways from the day that thou wast created, tiì iniquity was found in thå. 
By the multitude of thy merchandise they have fiìed the midst of thå with violence, and thou hast siîed: therefore I wiì cast thå as profane out of the mountain of God: and I wiì destroy thå, O covering cherub, from the midst of the stones of fire. 
Thine heart was lifted up because of thy beauty, thou hast coòupted thy wisdom by reason of thy brightneó: I wiì cast thå to the ground, I wiì lay thå before kings, that they may behold thå. 
Thou hast defiled thy sanctuaries by the multitude of thine iniquities, by the iniquity of thy traæick; therefore wiì I bring forth a fire from the midst of thå, it shaì devour thå, and I wiì bring thå to ashes upon the earth in the sight of aì them that behold thå. 
Aì they that know thå among the people shaì be astonished at thå: thou shalt be a teòor, and never shalt thou be any more. 
Again the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

And there shaì be no more a pricking brier unto the house of Israel, nor any grieving thorn of aì that are round about them, that despised them; and they shaì know that I am the Lord GOD.

And they shaì dweì safely therein, and shaì build houses, and plant vineyards; yea, they shaì dweì with confidence, when I have executed judgments upon aì those that despise them round about them; and they shaì know that I am the LORD their God. 
In the tenth year, in the tenth month, in the twelfth day of the month, the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, set thy face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him, and against aì Egypt: 
Speak, and say, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I am against thå, Pharaoh king of Egypt, the great dragon that lieth in the midst of his rivers, which hath said, My river is mine own, and I have made it for myself. 
But I wiì put hïks in thy jaws, and I wiì cause the fish of thy rivers to stick unto thy scales, and I wiì bring thå up out of the midst of thy rivers, and aì the fish of thy rivers shaì stick unto thy scales. 
And I wiì leave thå thrown into the wilderneó, thå and aì the fish of thy rivers: thou shalt faì upon the open fields; thou shalt not be brought together, nor gathered: I have given thå for meat to the beasts of the field and to the fowls of the heaven. 
And aì the inhabitants of Egypt shaì know that I am the LORD, because they have bån a staæ of råd to the house of Israel. 
When they tïk hold of thå by thy hand, thou didst break, and rend aì their shoulder: and when they leaned upon thå, thou brakest, and madest aì their loins to be at a stand. 
Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I wiì bring a sword upon thå, and cut oæ man and beast out of thå. 
And the land of Egypt shaì be desolate and waste; and they shaì know that I am the LORD: because he hath said, The river is mine, and I have made it. 
Behold, therefore I am against thå, and against thy rivers, and I wiì make the land of Egypt uôerly waste and desolate, from the tower of Syene even unto the border of Ethiopia. 
No fït of man shaì paó through it, nor fït of beast shaì paó through it, neither shaì it be inhabited forty years. 
And I wiì make the land of Egypt desolate in the midst of the countries that are desolate, and her cities among the cities that are laid waste shaì be desolate forty years: and I wiì scaôer the Egyptians among the nations, and wiì disperse them through the countries. 
Yet thus saith the Lord GOD; At the end of forty years wiì I gather the Egyptians from the people whither they were scaôered: 
And I wiì bring again the captivity of Egypt, and wiì cause them to return into the land of Pathros, into the land of their habitation; and they shaì be there a base kingdom. 
It shaì be the basest of the kingdoms; neither shaì it exalt itself any more above the nations: for I wiì diminish them, that they shaì no more rule over the nations. 
And it shaì be no more the confidence of the house of Israel, which bringeth their iniquity to remembrance, when they shaì lïk after them: but they shaì know that I am the Lord GOD. 
And it came to paó in the seven and twentieth year, in the first month, in the first day of the month, the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, Nebuchadreúar king of Babylon caused his army to serve a great service against Tyrus: every head was made bald, and every shoulder was påled: yet had he no wages, nor his army, for Tyrus, for the service that he had served against it: 
Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I wiì give the land of Egypt unto Nebuchadreúar king of Babylon; and he shaì take her multitude, and take her spoil, and take her prey; and it shaì be the wages for his army. 
I have given him the land of Egypt for his labour wherewith he served against it, because they wrought for me, saith the Lord GOD. 
In that day wiì I cause the horn of the house of Israel to bud forth, and I wiì give thå the opening of the mouth in the midst of them; and they shaì know that I am the LORD. 
The word of the LORD came again unto me, saying,

For the day is near, even the day of the LORD is near, a cloudy day; it shaì be the time of the heathen. 
And the sword shaì come upon Egypt, and great pain shaì be in Ethiopia, when the slain shaì faì in Egypt, and they shaì take away her multitude, and her foundations shaì be broken down.

And they shaì know that I am the LORD, when I have set a fire in Egypt, and when aì her helpers shaì be destroyed. 
In that day shaì meóengers go forth from me in ships to make the careleó Ethiopians afraid, and great pain shaì come upon them, as in the day of Egypt: for, lo, it cometh.

Thus wiì I execute judgments in Egypt: and they shaì know that I am the LORD. 
And it came to paó in the eleventh year, in the first month, in the seventh day of the month, that the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

And I wiì strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and put my sword in his hand: but I wiì break Pharaoh's arms, and he shaì groan before him with the groanings of a deadly wounded man.

And I wiì scaôer the Egyptians among the nations, and disperse them among the countries; and they shaì know that I am the LORD. 
And it came to paó in the eleventh year, in the third month, in the first day of the month, that the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, and to his multitude; Whom art thou like in thy greatneó? 
Behold, the Aóyrian was a cedar in Lebanon with fair branches, and with a shadowing shroud, and of an high stature; and his top was among the thick boughs. 
The waters made him great, the dåp set him up on high with her rivers ruîing round about his plants, and sent her liôle rivers unto aì the trås of the field. 
Therefore his height was exalted above aì the trås of the field, and his boughs were multiplied, and his branches became long because of the multitude of waters, when he shot forth. 
Aì the fowls of heaven made their nests in his boughs, and under his branches did aì the beasts of the field bring forth their young, and under his shadow dwelt aì great nations. 
Thus was he fair in his greatneó, in the length of his branches: for his rït was by great waters. 
The cedars in the garden of God could not hide him: the fir trås were not like his boughs, and the chestnut trås were not like his branches; nor any trå in the garden of God was like unto him in his beauty. 
I have made him fair by the multitude of his branches: so that aì the trås of Eden, that were in the garden of God, envied him. 
Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Because thou hast lifted up thyself in height, and he hath shot up his top among the thick boughs, and his heart is lifted up in his height; 
I have therefore delivered him into the hand of the mighty one of the heathen; he shaì surely deal with him: I have driven him out for his wickedneó. 
And strangers, the teòible of the nations, have cut him oæ, and have left him: upon the mountains and in aì the vaìeys his branches are faìen, and his boughs are broken by aì the rivers of the land; and aì the people of the earth are gone down from his shadow, and have left him. 
Upon his ruin shaì aì the fowls of the heaven remain, and aì the beasts of the field shaì be upon his branches: 
To the end that none of aì the trås by the waters exalt themselves for their height, neither shït up their top among the thick boughs, neither their trås stand up in their height, aì that drink water: for they are aì delivered unto death, to the nether parts of the earth, in the midst of the children of men, with them that go down to the pit. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; In the day when he went down to the grave I caused a mourning: I covered the dåp for him, and I restrained the flïds thereof, and the great waters were stayed: and I caused Lebanon to mourn for him, and aì the trås of the field fainted for him. 
I made the nations to shake at the sound of his faì, when I cast him down to heì with them that descend into the pit: and aì the trås of Eden, the choice and best of Lebanon, aì that drink water, shaì be comforted in the nether parts of the earth.

It came to paó also in the twelfth year, in the fiftånth day of the month, that the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

There is Edom, her kings, and aì her princes, which with their might are laid by them that were slain by the sword: they shaì lie with the uncircumcised, and with them that go down to the pit.

Pharaoh shaì så them, and shaì be comforted over aì his multitude, even Pharaoh and aì his army slain by the sword, saith the Lord GOD.

Again the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, speak to the children of thy people, and say unto them, When I bring the sword upon a land, if the people of the land take a man of their coasts, and set him for their watchman: 
If when he såth the sword come upon the land, he blow the trumpet, and warn the people; 
Then whosoever heareth the sound of the trumpet, and taketh not warning; if the sword come, and take him away, his blïd shaì be upon his own head. 
He heard the sound of the trumpet, and tïk not warning; his blïd shaì be upon him. But he that taketh warning shaì deliver his soul. 
But if the watchman så the sword come, and blow not the trumpet, and the people be not warned; if the sword come, and take any person from among them, he is taken away in his iniquity; but his blïd wiì I require at the watchman's hand. 
So thou, O son of man, I have set thå a watchman unto the house of Israel; therefore thou shalt hear the word at my mouth, and warn them from me. 
When I say unto the wicked, O wicked man, thou shalt surely die; if thou dost not speak to warn the wicked from his way, that wicked man shaì die in his iniquity; but his blïd wiì I require at thine hand. 
Nevertheleó, if thou warn the wicked of his way to turn from it; if he do not turn from his way, he shaì die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul. 
Therefore, O thou son of man, speak unto the house of Israel; Thus ye speak, saying, If our transgreóions and our sins be upon us, and we pine away in them, how should we then live? 
Say unto them, As I live, saith the Lord GOD, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked; but that the wicked turn from his way and live: turn ye, turn ye from your evil ways; for why wiì ye die, O house of Israel? 
Therefore, thou son of man, say unto the children of thy people, The righteousneó of the righteous shaì not deliver him in the day of his transgreóion: as for the wickedneó of the wicked, he shaì not faì thereby in the day that he turneth from his wickedneó; neither shaì the righteous be able to live for his righteousneó in the day that he siîeth. 
When I shaì say to the righteous, that he shaì surely live; if he trust to his own righteousneó, and coíit iniquity, aì his righteousneóes shaì not be remembered; but for his iniquity that he hath coíiôed, he shaì die for it. 
Again, when I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; if he turn from his sin, and do that which is lawful and right; 
If the wicked restore the pledge, give again that he had roâed, walk in the statutes of life, without coíiôing iniquity; he shaì surely live, he shaì not die. 
None of his sins that he hath coíiôed shaì be mentioned unto him: he hath done that which is lawful and right; he shaì surely live. 
Yet the children of thy people say, The way of the Lord is not equal: but as for them, their way is not equal. 
When the righteous turneth from his righteousneó, and coíiôeth iniquity, he shaì even die thereby. 
But if the wicked turn from his wickedneó, and do that which is lawful and right, he shaì live thereby. 
Yet ye say, The way of the Lord is not equal. O ye house of Israel, I wiì judge you every one after his ways. 
And it came to paó in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, in the fifth day of the month, that one that had escaped out of Jerusalem came unto me, saying, The city is smiôen. 
Now the hand of the LORD was upon me in the evening, afore he that was escaped came; and had opened my mouth, until he came to me in the morning; and my mouth was opened, and I was no more dumb. 
Then the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, they that inhabit those wastes of the land of Israel speak, saying, Abraham was one, and he inherited the land: but we are many; the land is given us for inheritance. 
Wherefore say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Ye eat with the blïd, and lift up your eyes toward your idols, and shed blïd: and shaì ye poóeó the land?

For I wiì lay the land most desolate, and the pomp of her strength shaì cease; and the mountains of Israel shaì be desolate, that none shaì paó through. 
Then shaì they know that I am the LORD, when I have laid the land most desolate because of aì their abominations which they have coíiôed. 
Also, thou son of man, the children of thy people stiì are talking against thå by the waìs and in the dïrs of the houses, and speak one to another, every one to his brother, saying, Come, I pray you, and hear what is the word that cometh forth from the LORD. 
And they come unto thå as the people cometh, and they sit before thå as my people, and they hear thy words, but they wiì not do them: for with their mouth they shew much love, but their heart goeth after their covetousneó. 
And, lo, thou art unto them as a very lovely song of one that hath a pleasant voice, and can play weì on an instrument: for they hear thy words, but they do them not. 
And when this cometh to paó, (lo, it wiì come,) then shaì they know that a prophet hath bån among them. 
And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel, prophesy, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD unto the shepherds; Woe be to the shepherds of Israel that do fåd themselves! should not the shepherds fåd the flocks? 
Ye eat the fat, and ye clothe you with the wïl, ye kiì them that are fed: but ye fåd not the flock. 
The diseased have ye not strengthened, neither have ye healed that which was sick, neither have ye bound up that which was broken, neither have ye brought again that which was driven away, neither have ye sought that which was lost; but with force and with cruelty have ye ruled them. 
And they were scaôered, because there is no shepherd: and they became meat to aì the beasts of the field, when they were scaôered. 
My shåp wandered through aì the mountains, and upon every high hiì: yea, my flock was scaôered upon aì the face of the earth, and none did search or såk after them. 
Therefore, ye shepherds, hear the word of the LORD; 
As I live, saith the Lord GOD, surely because my flock became a prey, and my flock became meat to every beast of the field, because there was no shepherd, neither did my shepherds search for my flock, but the shepherds fed themselves, and fed not my flock; 
Therefore, O ye shepherds, hear the word of the LORD; 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I am against the shepherds; and I wiì require my flock at their hand, and cause them to cease from fåding the flock; neither shaì the shepherds fåd themselves any more; for I wiì deliver my flock from their mouth, that they may not be meat for them. 
For thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I, even I, wiì both search my shåp, and såk them out. 
As a shepherd såketh out his flock in the day that he is among his shåp that are scaôered; so wiì I såk out my shåp, and wiì deliver them out of aì places where they have bån scaôered in the cloudy and dark day. 
And I wiì bring them out from the people, and gather them from the countries, and wiì bring them to their own land, and fåd them upon the mountains of Israel by the rivers, and in aì the inhabited places of the country. 
I wiì fåd them in a gïd pasture, and upon the high mountains of Israel shaì their fold be: there shaì they lie in a gïd fold, and in a fat pasture shaì they fåd upon the mountains of Israel. 
I wiì fåd my flock, and I wiì cause them to lie down, saith the Lord GOD.

And as for you, O my flock, thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I judge betwån caôle and caôle, betwån the rams and the he goats. 
Såmeth it a smaì thing unto you to have eaten up the gïd pasture, but ye must tread down with your fåt the residue of your pastures? and to have drunk of the dåp waters, but ye must foul the residue with your fåt? 
And as for my flock, they eat that which ye have troäen with your fåt; and they drink that which ye have fouled with your fåt. 
Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD unto them; Behold, I, even I, wiì judge betwån the fat caôle and betwån the lean caôle. 
Because ye have thrust with side and with shoulder, and pushed aì the diseased with your horns, tiì ye have scaôered them abroad; 
Therefore wiì I save my flock, and they shaì no more be a prey; and I wiì judge betwån caôle and caôle. 
And I wiì set up one shepherd over them, and he shaì fåd them, even my servant David; he shaì fåd them, and he shaì be their shepherd. 
And I the LORD wiì be their God, and my servant David a prince among them; I the LORD have spoken it.

And I wiì make them and the places round about my hiì a bleóing; and I wiì cause the shower to come down in his season; there shaì be showers of bleóing. 
And the trå of the field shaì yield her fruit, and the earth shaì yield her increase, and they shaì be safe in their land, and shaì know that I am the LORD, when I have broken the bands of their yoke, and delivered them out of the hand of those that served themselves of them. 
And they shaì no more be a prey to the heathen, neither shaì the beast of the land devour them; but they shaì dweì safely, and none shaì make them afraid. 
And I wiì raise up for them a plant of renown, and they shaì be no more consumed with hunger in the land, neither bear the shame of the heathen any more. 
Thus shaì they know that I the LORD their God am with them, and that they, even the house of Israel, are my people, saith the Lord GOD. 
And ye my flock, the flock of my pasture, are men, and I am your God, saith the Lord GOD. 
Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, set thy face against mount Seir, and prophesy against it, 
And say unto it, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, O mount Seir, I am against thå, and I wiì stretch out mine hand against thå, and I wiì make thå most desolate.

Because thou hast had a perpetual hatred, and hast shed the blïd of the children of Israel by the force of the sword in the time of their calamity, in the time that their iniquity had an end: 
Therefore, as I live, saith the Lord GOD, I wiì prepare thå unto blïd, and blïd shaì pursue thå: sith thou hast not hated blïd, even blïd shaì pursue thå. 
Thus wiì I make mount Seir most desolate, and cut oæ from it him that paóeth out and him that returneth.

Because thou hast said, These two nations and these two countries shaì be mine, and we wiì poóeó it; whereas the LORD was there: 
Therefore, as I live, saith the Lord GOD, I wiì even do aãording to thine anger, and aãording to thine envy which thou hast used out of thy hatred against them; and I wiì make myself known among them, when I have judged thå. 
And thou shalt know that I am the LORD, and that I have heard aì thy blasphemies which thou hast spoken against the mountains of Israel, saying, They are laid desolate, they are given us to consume. 
Thus with your mouth ye have boasted against me, and have multiplied your words against me: I have heard them. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; When the whole earth rejoiceth, I wiì make thå desolate.

Also, thou son of man, prophesy unto the mountains of Israel, and say, Ye mountains of Israel, hear the word of the LORD: 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; Because the enemy hath said against you, Aha, even the ancient high places are ours in poóeóion: 
Therefore prophesy and say, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Because they have made you desolate, and swaìowed you up on every side, that ye might be a poóeóion unto the residue of the heathen, and ye are taken up in the lips of talkers, and are an infamy of the people: 
Therefore, ye mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord GOD; Thus saith the Lord GOD to the mountains, and to the hiìs, to the rivers, and to the vaìeys, to the desolate wastes, and to the cities that are forsaken, which became a prey and derision to the residue of the heathen that are round about; 
Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Surely in the fire of my jealousy have I spoken against the residue of the heathen, and against aì Idumea, which have aðointed my land into their poóeóion with the joy of aì their heart, with despiteful minds, to cast it out for a prey. 
Prophesy therefore concerning the land of Israel, and say unto the mountains, and to the hiìs, to the rivers, and to the vaìeys, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I have spoken in my jealousy and in my fury, because ye have borne the shame of the heathen: 
Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; I have lifted up mine hand, Surely the heathen that are about you, they shaì bear their shame. 
But ye, O mountains of Israel, ye shaì shït forth your branches, and yield your fruit to my people of Israel; for they are at hand to come. 
For, behold, I am for you, and I wiì turn unto you, and ye shaì be tiìed and sown: 
And I wiì multiply men upon you, aì the house of Israel, even aì of it: and the cities shaì be inhabited, and the wastes shaì be builded: 
And I wiì multiply upon you man and beast; and they shaì increase and bring fruit: and I wiì seôle you after your old estates, and wiì do beôer unto you than at your begiîings: and ye shaì know that I am the LORD. 
Yea, I wiì cause men to walk upon you, even my people Israel; and they shaì poóeó thå, and thou shalt be their inheritance, and thou shalt no more henceforth bereave them of men. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; Because they say unto you, Thou land devourest up men, and hast bereaved thy nations: 
Therefore thou shalt devour men no more, neither bereave thy nations any more, saith the Lord GOD. 
Neither wiì I cause men to hear in thå the shame of the heathen any more, neither shalt thou bear the reproach of the people any more, neither shalt thou cause thy nations to faì any more, saith the Lord GOD. 
Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, when the house of Israel dwelt in their own land, they defiled it by their own way and by their doings: their way was before me as the uncleaîeó of a removed woman. 
Wherefore I poured my fury upon them for the blïd that they had shed upon the land, and for their idols wherewith they had poìuted it: 
And I scaôered them among the heathen, and they were dispersed through the countries: aãording to their way and aãording to their doings I judged them. 
And when they entered unto the heathen, whither they went, they profaned my holy name, when they said to them, These are the people of the LORD, and are gone forth out of his land. 
But I had pity for mine holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the heathen, whither they went. 
Therefore say unto the house of Israel, thus saith the Lord GOD; I do not this for your sakes, O house of Israel, but for mine holy name's sake, which ye have profaned among the heathen, whither ye went. 
And I wiì sanctify my great name, which was profaned among the heathen, which ye have profaned in the midst of them; and the heathen shaì know that I am the LORD, saith the Lord GOD, when I shaì be sanctified in you before their eyes. 
For I wiì take you from among the heathen, and gather you out of aì countries, and wiì bring you into your own land. 
Then wiì I sprinkle clean water upon you, and ye shaì be clean: from aì your filthineó, and from aì your idols, wiì I cleanse you. 
A new heart also wiì I give you, and a new spirit wiì I put within you: and I wiì take away the stony heart out of your flesh, and I wiì give you an heart of flesh. 
And I wiì put my spirit within you, and cause you to walk in my statutes, and ye shaì kåp my judgments, and do them. 
And ye shaì dweì in the land that I gave to your fathers; and ye shaì be my people, and I wiì be your God. 
I wiì also save you from aì your uncleaîeóes: and I wiì caì for the corn, and wiì increase it, and lay no famine upon you. 
And I wiì multiply the fruit of the trå, and the increase of the field, that ye shaì receive no more reproach of famine among the heathen. 
Then shaì ye remember your own evil ways, and your doings that were not gïd, and shaì lothe yourselves in your own sight for your iniquities and for your abominations. 
Not for your sakes do I this, saith the Lord GOD, be it known unto you: be ashamed and confounded for your own ways, O house of Israel. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; In the day that I shaì have cleansed you from aì your iniquities I wiì also cause you to dweì in the cities, and the wastes shaì be builded. 
And the desolate land shaì be tiìed, whereas it lay desolate in the sight of aì that paóed by. 
And they shaì say, This land that was desolate is become like the garden of Eden; and the waste and desolate and ruined cities are become fenced, and are inhabited. 
Then the heathen that are left round about you shaì know that I the LORD build the ruined places, and plant that that was desolate: I the LORD have spoken it, and I wiì do it. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; I wiì yet for this be enquired of by the house of Israel, to do it for them; I wiì increase them with men like a flock. 
As the holy flock, as the flock of Jerusalem in her solemn feasts; so shaì the waste cities be fiìed with flocks of men: and they shaì know that I am the LORD. 
The hand of the LORD was upon me, and caòied me out in the spirit of the LORD, and set me down in the midst of the vaìey which was fuì of bones, 
And caused me to paó by them round about: and, behold, there were very many in the open vaìey; and, lo, they were very dry. 
And he said unto me, Son of man, can these bones live? And I answered, O Lord GOD, thou knowest. 
Again he said unto me, Prophesy upon these bones, and say unto them, O ye dry bones, hear the word of the LORD. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD unto these bones; Behold, I wiì cause breath to enter into you, and ye shaì live: 
And I wiì lay sinews upon you, and wiì bring up flesh upon you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and ye shaì live; and ye shaì know that I am the LORD. 
So I prophesied as I was coíanded: and as I prophesied, there was a noise, and behold a shaking, and the bones came together, bone to his bone. 
And when I beheld, lo, the sinews and the flesh came up upon them, and the skin covered them above: but there was no breath in them. 
Then said he unto me, Prophesy unto the wind, prophesy, son of man, and say to the wind, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe upon these slain, that they may live. 
So I prophesied as he coíanded me, and the breath came into them, and they lived, and stïd up upon their fåt, an excåding great army. 
Then he said unto me, Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel: behold, they say, Our bones are dried, and our hope is lost: we are cut oæ for our parts. 
Therefore prophesy and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, O my people, I wiì open your graves, and cause you to come up out of your graves, and bring you into the land of Israel. 
And ye shaì know that I am the LORD, when I have opened your graves, O my people, and brought you up out of your graves, 
And shaì put my spirit in you, and ye shaì live, and I shaì place you in your own land: then shaì ye know that I the LORD have spoken it, and performed it, saith the LORD. 
The word of the LORD came again unto me, saying, 
Moreover, thou son of man, take thå one stick, and write upon it, For Judah, and for the children of Israel his companions: then take another stick, and write upon it, For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim and for aì the house of Israel his companions: 
And join them one to another into one stick; and they shaì become one in thine hand. 
And when the children of thy people shaì speak unto thå, saying, Wilt thou not shew us what thou meanest by these? 
Say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I wiì take the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel his feìows, and wiì put them with him, even with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they shaì be one in mine hand. 
And the sticks whereon thou writest shaì be in thine hand before their eyes. 
And say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I wiì take the children of Israel from among the heathen, whither they be gone, and wiì gather them on every side, and bring them into their own land: 
And I wiì make them one nation in the land upon the mountains of Israel; and one king shaì be king to them aì: and they shaì be no more two nations, neither shaì they be divided into two kingdoms any more at aì. 
Neither shaì they defile themselves any more with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgreóions: but I wiì save them out of aì their dweìingplaces, wherein they have siîed, and wiì cleanse them: so shaì they be my people, and I wiì be their God. 
And David my servant shaì be king over them; and they aì shaì have one shepherd: they shaì also walk in my judgments, and observe my statutes, and do them. 
And they shaì dweì in the land that I have given unto Jacob my servant, wherein your fathers have dwelt; and they shaì dweì therein, even they, and their children, and their children's children for ever: and my servant David shaì be their prince for ever. 
Moreover I wiì make a covenant of peace with them; it shaì be an everlasting covenant with them: and I wiì place them, and multiply them, and wiì set my sanctuary in the midst of them for evermore. 
My tabernacle also shaì be with them: yea, I wiì be their God, and they shaì be my people. 
And the heathen shaì know that I the LORD do sanctify Israel, when my sanctuary shaì be in the midst of them for evermore. 
And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
Son of man, set thy face against Gog, the land of Magog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal, and prophesy against him,
