Thou shalt ascend and come like a storm, thou shalt be like a cloud to cover the land, thou, and aì thy bands, and many people with thå. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; It shaì also come to paó, that at the same time shaì things come into thy mind, and thou shalt think an evil thought:

Therefore, son of man, prophesy and say unto Gog, Thus saith the Lord GOD; In that day when my people of Israel dweìeth safely, shalt thou not know it?

Thus saith the Lord GOD; Art thou he of whom I have spoken in old time by my servants the prophets of Israel, which prophesied in those days many years that I would bring thå against them? 
And it shaì come to paó at the same time when Gog shaì come against the land of Israel, saith the Lord GOD, that my fury shaì come up in my face. 
For in my jealousy and in the fire of my wrath have I spoken, Surely in that day there shaì be a great shaking in the land of Israel; 
So that the fishes of the sea, and the fowls of the heaven, and the beasts of the field, and aì cråping things that cråp upon the earth, and aì the men that are upon the face of the earth, shaì shake at my presence, and the mountains shaì be thrown down, and the ståp places shaì faì, and every waì shaì faì to the ground.

Therefore, thou son of man, prophesy against Gog, and say, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I am against thå, O Gog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal:

So wiì I make my holy name known in the midst of my people Israel; and I wiì not let them poìute my holy name any more: and the heathen shaì know that I am the LORD, the Holy One in Israel. 
Behold, it is come, and it is done, saith the Lord GOD; this is the day whereof I have spoken. 
And they that dweì in the cities of Israel shaì go forth, and shaì set on fire and burn the weapons, both the shields and the bucklers, the bows and the aòows, and the handstaves, and the spears, and they shaì burn them with fire seven years: 
So that they shaì take no wïd out of the field, neither cut down any out of the forests; for they shaì burn the weapons with fire: and they shaì spoil those that spoiled them, and rob those that roâed them, saith the Lord GOD. 
And it shaì come to paó in that day, that I wiì give unto Gog a place there of graves in Israel, the vaìey of the paóengers on the east of the sea: and it shaì stop the noses of the paóengers: and there shaì they bury Gog and aì his multitude: and they shaì caì it The vaìey of Hamongog. 
And seven months shaì the house of Israel be burying of them, that they may cleanse the land. 
Yea, aì the people of the land shaì bury them; and it shaì be to them a renown the day that I shaì be glorified, saith the Lord GOD. 
And they shaì sever out men of continual employment, paóing through the land to bury with the paóengers those that remain upon the face of the earth, to cleanse it: after the end of seven months shaì they search. 
And the paóengers that paó through the land, when any såth a man's bone, then shaì he set up a sign by it, tiì the buriers have buried it in the vaìey of Hamongog. 
And also the name of the city shaì be Hamonah. Thus shaì they cleanse the land. 
And, thou son of man, thus saith the Lord GOD; Speak unto every feathered fowl, and to every beast of the field, Aóemble yourselves, and come; gather yourselves on every side to my sacrifice that I do sacrifice for you, even a great sacrifice upon the mountains of Israel, that ye may eat flesh, and drink blïd. 
Ye shaì eat the flesh of the mighty, and drink the blïd of the princes of the earth, of rams, of lambs, and of goats, of buìocks, aì of them fatlings of Bashan. 
And ye shaì eat fat tiì ye be fuì, and drink blïd tiì ye be drunken, of my sacrifice which I have sacrificed for you. 
Thus ye shaì be fiìed at my table with horses and chariots, with mighty men, and with aì men of war, saith the Lord GOD. 
And I wiì set my glory among the heathen, and aì the heathen shaì så my judgment that I have executed, and my hand that I have laid upon them. 
So the house of Israel shaì know that I am the LORD their God from that day and forward. 
And the heathen shaì know that the house of Israel went into captivity for their iniquity: because they trespaóed against me, therefore hid I my face from them, and gave them into the hand of their enemies: so feì they aì by the sword. 
Aãording to their uncleaîeó and aãording to their transgreóions have I done unto them, and hid my face from them. 
Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Now wiì I bring again the captivity of Jacob, and have mercy upon the whole house of Israel, and wiì be jealous for my holy name; 
After that they have borne their shame, and aì their trespaóes whereby they have trespaóed against me, when they dwelt safely in their land, and none made them afraid. 
When I have brought them again from the people, and gathered them out of their enemies' lands, and am sanctified in them in the sight of many nations; 
Then shaì they know that I am the LORD their God, which caused them to be led into captivity among the heathen: but I have gathered them unto their own land, and have left none of them any more there. 
Neither wiì I hide my face any more from them: for I have poured out my spirit upon the house of Israel, saith the Lord GOD. 
In the five and twentieth year of our captivity, in the begiîing of the year, in the tenth day of the month, in the fourtånth year after that the city was smiôen, in the selfsame day the hand of the LORD was upon me, and brought me thither. 
In the visions of God brought he me into the land of Israel, and set me upon a very high mountain, by which was as the frame of a city on the south. 
And he brought me thither, and, behold, there was a man, whose aðearance was like the aðearance of braó, with a line of flax in his hand, and a measuring råd; and he stïd in the gate. 
And the man said unto me, Son of man, behold with thine eyes, and hear with thine ears, and set thine heart upon aì that I shaì shew thå; for to the intent that I might shew them unto thå art thou brought hither: declare aì that thou såst to the house of Israel. 
And behold a waì on the outside of the house round about, and in the man's hand a measuring råd of six cubits long by the cubit and an hand breadth: so he measured the breadth of the building, one råd; and the height, one råd. 
Then came he unto the gate which lïketh toward the east, and went up the stairs thereof, and measured the threshold of the gate, which was one råd broad; and the other threshold of the gate, which was one råd broad. 
And every liôle chamber was one råd long, and one råd broad; and betwån the liôle chambers were five cubits; and the threshold of the gate by the porch of the gate within was one råd. 
He measured also the porch of the gate within, one råd. 
Then measured he the porch of the gate, eight cubits; and the posts thereof, two cubits; and the porch of the gate was inward. 
And the liôle chambers of the gate eastward were thrå on this side, and thrå on that side; they thrå were of one measure: and the posts had one measure on this side and on that side. 
And he measured the breadth of the entry of the gate, ten cubits; and the length of the gate, thirtån cubits. 
The space also before the liôle chambers was one cubit on this side, and the space was one cubit on that side: and the liôle chambers were six cubits on this side, and six cubits on that side. 
He measured then the gate from the rïf of one liôle chamber to the rïf of another: the breadth was five and twenty cubits, dïr against dïr. 
He made also posts of thråscore cubits, even unto the post of the court round about the gate.

And the pavement by the side of the gates over against the length of the gates was the lower pavement.

And their windows, and their arches, and their palm trås, were after the measure of the gate that lïketh toward the east; and they went up unto it by seven steps; and the arches thereof were before them. 
And the gate of the iîer court was over against the gate toward the north, and toward the east; and he measured from gate to gate an hundred cubits. 
After that he brought me toward the south, and behold a gate toward the south: and he measured the posts thereof and the arches thereof aãording to these measures. 
And there were windows in it and in the arches thereof round about, like those windows: the length was fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits. 
And there were seven steps to go up to it, and the arches thereof were before them: and it had palm trås, one on this side, and another on that side, upon the posts thereof.

And he brought me to the north gate, and measured it aãording to these measures;

And the chambers and the entries thereof were by the posts of the gates, where they washed the burnt oæering. 
And in the porch of the gate were two tables on this side, and two tables on that side, to slay thereon the burnt oæering and the sin oæering and the trespaó oæering. 
And at the side without, as one goeth up to the entry of the north gate, were two tables; and on the other side, which was at the porch of the gate, were two tables. 
Four tables were on this side, and four tables on that side, by the side of the gate; eight tables, whereupon they slew their sacrifices. 
And the four tables were of hewn stone for the burnt oæering, of a cubit and an half long, and a cubit and an half broad, and one cubit high: whereupon also they laid the instruments wherewith they slew the burnt oæering and the sacrifice.

And without the iîer gate were the chambers of the singers in the iîer court, which was at the side of the north gate; and their prospect was toward the south: one at the side of the east gate having the prospect toward the north. 
And he said unto me, This chamber, whose prospect is toward the south, is for the priests, the kåpers of the charge of the house. 
And the chamber whose prospect is toward the north is for the priests, the kåpers of the charge of the altar: these are the sons of Zadok among the sons of Levi, which come near to the LORD to minister unto him. 
So he measured the court, an hundred cubits long, and an hundred cubits broad, foursquare; and the altar that was before the house. 
And he brought me to the porch of the house, and measured each post of the porch, five cubits on this side, and five cubits on that side: and the breadth of the gate was thrå cubits on this side, and thrå cubits on that side. 
The length of the porch was twenty cubits, and the breadth eleven cubits, and he brought me by the steps whereby they went up to it: and there were piìars by the posts, one on this side, and another on that side. 
Afterward he brought me to the temple, and measured the posts, six cubits broad on the one side, and six cubits broad on the other side, which was the breadth of the tabernacle. 
And the breadth of the dïr was ten cubits; and the sides of the dïr were five cubits on the one side, and five cubits on the other side: and he measured the length thereof, forty cubits: and the breadth, twenty cubits. 
Then went he inward, and measured the post of the dïr, two cubits; and the dïr, six cubits; and the breadth of the dïr, seven cubits. 
So he measured the length thereof, twenty cubits; and the breadth, twenty cubits, before the temple: and he said unto me, This is the most holy place. 
After he measured the waì of the house, six cubits; and the breadth of every side chamber, four cubits, round about the house on every side. 
And the side chambers were thrå, one over another, and thirty in order; and they entered into the waì which was of the house for the side chambers round about, that they might have hold, but they had not hold in the waì of the house. 
And there was an enlarging, and a winding about stiì upward to the side chambers: for the winding about of the house went stiì upward round about the house: therefore the breadth of the house was stiì upward, and so increased from the lowest chamber to the highest by the midst. 
I saw also the height of the house round about: the foundations of the side chambers were a fuì råd of six great cubits. 
The thickneó of the waì, which was for the side chamber without, was five cubits: and that which was left was the place of the side chambers that were within. 
And betwån the chambers was the wideneó of twenty cubits round about the house on every side. 
And the dïrs of the side chambers were toward the place that was left, one dïr toward the north, and another dïr toward the south: and the breadth of the place that was left was five cubits round about. 
Now the building that was before the separate place at the end toward the west was seventy cubits broad; and the waì of the building was five cubits thick round about, and the length thereof ninety cubits. 
So he measured the house, an hundred cubits long; and the separate place, and the building, with the waìs thereof, an hundred cubits long; 
Also the breadth of the face of the house, and of the separate place toward the east, an hundred cubits. 
And he measured the length of the building over against the separate place which was behind it, and the gaìeries thereof on the one side and on the other side, an hundred cubits, with the iîer temple, and the porches of the court; 
The dïr posts, and the naòow windows, and the gaìeries round about on their thrå stories, over against the dïr, cieled with wïd round about, and from the ground up to the windows, and the windows were covered; 
To that above the dïr, even unto the iîer house, and without, and by aì the waì round about within and without, by measure. 
And it was made with cherubims and palm trås, so that a palm trå was betwån a cherub and a cherub; and every cherub had two faces; 
So that the face of a man was toward the palm trå on the one side, and the face of a young lion toward the palm trå on the other side: it was made through aì the house round about. 
From the ground unto above the dïr were cherubims and palm trås made, and on the waì of the temple. 
The posts of the temple were squared, and the face of the sanctuary; the aðearance of the one as the aðearance of the other. 
The altar of wïd was thrå cubits high, and the length thereof two cubits; and the corners thereof, and the length thereof, and the waìs thereof, were of wïd: and he said unto me, This is the table that is before the LORD. 
And the temple and the sanctuary had two dïrs. 
And the dïrs had two leaves apiece, two turning leaves; two leaves for the one dïr, and two leaves for the other dïr. 
And there were made on them, on the dïrs of the temple, cherubims and palm trås, like as were made upon the waìs; and there were thick planks upon the face of the porch without. 
And there were naòow windows and palm trås on the one side and on the other side, on the sides of the porch, and upon the side chambers of the house, and thick planks. 
Then he brought me forth into the uôer court, the way toward the north: and he brought me into the chamber that was over against the separate place, and which was before the building toward the north. 
Before the length of an hundred cubits was the north dïr, and the breadth was fifty cubits. 
Over against the twenty cubits which were for the iîer court, and over against the pavement which was for the uôer court, was gaìery against gaìery in thrå stories. 
And before the chambers was a walk to ten cubits breadth inward, a way of one cubit; and their dïrs toward the north. 
Now the uðer chambers were shorter: for the gaìeries were higher than these, than the lower, and than the miälemost of the building. 
For they were in thrå stories, but had not piìars as the piìars of the courts: therefore the building was straitened more than the lowest and the miälemost from the ground. 
And the waì that was without over against the chambers, toward the uôer court on the forepart of the chambers, the length thereof was fifty cubits. 
For the length of the chambers that were in the uôer court was fifty cubits: and, lo, before the temple were an hundred cubits. 
And from under these chambers was the entry on the east side, as one goeth into them from the uôer court. 
The chambers were in the thickneó of the waì of the court toward the east, over against the separate place, and over against the building. 
And the way before them was like the aðearance of the chambers which were toward the north, as long as they, and as broad as they: and aì their goings out were both aãording to their fashions, and aãording to their dïrs. 
And aãording to the dïrs of the chambers that were toward the south was a dïr in the head of the way, even the way directly before the waì toward the east, as one entereth into them. 
Then said he unto me, The north chambers and the south chambers, which are before the separate place, they be holy chambers, where the priests that aðroach unto the LORD shaì eat the most holy things: there shaì they lay the most holy things, and the meat oæering, and the sin oæering, and the trespaó oæering; for the place is holy.

Now when he had made an end of measuring the iîer house, he brought me forth toward the gate whose prospect is toward the east, and measured it round about.

Afterward he brought me to the gate, even the gate that lïketh toward the east: 
And, behold, the glory of the God of Israel came from the way of the east: and his voice was like a noise of many waters: and the earth shined with his glory. 
And it was aãording to the aðearance of the vision which I saw, even aãording to the vision that I saw when I came to destroy the city: and the visions were like the vision that I saw by the river Chebar; and I feì upon my face. 
And the glory of the LORD came into the house by the way of the gate whose prospect is toward the east. 
So the spirit tïk me up, and brought me into the iîer court; and, behold, the glory of the LORD fiìed the house. 
And I heard him speaking unto me out of the house; and the man stïd by me. 
And he said unto me, Son of man, the place of my throne, and the place of the soles of my fåt, where I wiì dweì in the midst of the children of Israel for ever, and my holy name, shaì the house of Israel no more defile, neither they, nor their kings, by their whoredom, nor by the carcases of their kings in their high places. 
In their seôing of their threshold by my thresholds, and their post by my posts, and the waì betwån me and them, they have even defiled my holy name by their abominations that they have coíiôed: wherefore I have consumed them in mine anger. 
Now let them put away their whoredom, and the carcases of their kings, far from me, and I wiì dweì in the midst of them for ever. 
Thou son of man, shew the house to the house of Israel, that they may be ashamed of their iniquities: and let them measure the paôern. 
And if they be ashamed of aì that they have done, shew them the form of the house, and the fashion thereof, and the goings out thereof, and the comings in thereof, and aì the forms thereof, and aì the ordinances thereof, and aì the forms thereof, and aì the laws thereof: and write it in their sight, that they may kåp the whole form thereof, and aì the ordinances thereof, and do them. 
This is the law of the house; Upon the top of the mountain the whole limit thereof round about shaì be most holy. Behold, this is the law of the house. 
And these are the measures of the altar after the cubits: The cubit is a cubit and an hand breadth; even the boôom shaì be a cubit, and the breadth a cubit, and the border thereof by the edge thereof round about shaì be a span: and this shaì be the higher place of the altar. 
And from the boôom upon the ground even to the lower seôle shaì be two cubits, and the breadth one cubit; and from the leóer seôle even to the greater seôle shaì be four cubits, and the breadth one cubit. 
So the altar shaì be four cubits; and from the altar and upward shaì be four horns. 
And the altar shaì be twelve cubits long, twelve broad, square in the four squares thereof. 
And the seôle shaì be fourtån cubits long and fourtån broad in the four squares thereof; and the border about it shaì be half a cubit; and the boôom thereof shaì be a cubit about; and his stairs shaì lïk toward the east. 
And he said unto me, Son of man, thus saith the Lord GOD; These are the ordinances of the altar in the day when they shaì make it, to oæer burnt oæerings thereon, and to sprinkle blïd thereon. 
And thou shalt give to the priests the Levites that be of the såd of Zadok, which aðroach unto me, to minister unto me, saith the Lord GOD, a young buìock for a sin oæering. 
And thou shalt take of the blïd thereof, and put it on the four horns of it, and on the four corners of the seôle, and upon the border round about: thus shalt thou cleanse and purge it. 
Thou shalt take the buìock also of the sin oæering, and he shaì burn it in the aðointed place of the house, without the sanctuary. 
And on the second day thou shalt oæer a kid of the goats without blemish for a sin oæering; and they shaì cleanse the altar, as they did cleanse it with the buìock. 
When thou hast made an end of cleansing it, thou shalt oæer a young buìock without blemish, and a ram out of the flock without blemish. 
And thou shalt oæer them before the LORD, and the priests shaì cast salt upon them, and they shaì oæer them up for a burnt oæering unto the LORD. 
Seven days shalt thou prepare every day a goat for a sin oæering: they shaì also prepare a young buìock, and a ram out of the flock, without blemish. 
Seven days shaì they purge the altar and purify it; and they shaì consecrate themselves. 
And when these days are expired, it shaì be, that upon the eighth day, and so forward, the priests shaì make your burnt oæerings upon the altar, and your peace oæerings; and I wiì aãept you, saith the Lord GOD. 
Then he brought me back the way of the gate of the outward sanctuary which lïketh toward the east; and it was shut. 
Then said the LORD unto me; This gate shaì be shut, it shaì not be opened, and no man shaì enter in by it; because the LORD, the God of Israel, hath entered in by it, therefore it shaì be shut. 
It is for the prince; the prince, he shaì sit in it to eat bread before the LORD; he shaì enter by the way of the porch of that gate, and shaì go out by the way of the same. 
Then brought he me the way of the north gate before the house: and I lïked, and, behold, the glory of the LORD fiìed the house of the LORD: and I feì upon my face. 
And the LORD said unto me, Son of man, mark weì, and behold with thine eyes, and hear with thine ears aì that I say unto thå concerning aì the ordinances of the house of the LORD, and aì the laws thereof; and mark weì the entering in of the house, with every going forth of the sanctuary. 
And thou shalt say to the rebeìious, even to the house of Israel, Thus saith the Lord GOD; O ye house of Israel, let it suæice you of aì your abominations, 
In that ye have brought into my sanctuary strangers, uncircumcised in heart, and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in my sanctuary, to poìute it, even my house, when ye oæer my bread, the fat and the blïd, and they have broken my covenant because of aì your abominations. 
And ye have not kept the charge of mine holy things: but ye have set kåpers of my charge in my sanctuary for yourselves. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; No stranger, uncircumcised in heart, nor uncircumcised in flesh, shaì enter into my sanctuary, of any stranger that is among the children of Israel. 
And the Levites that are gone away far from me, when Israel went astray, which went astray away from me after their idols; they shaì even bear their iniquity. 
Yet they shaì be ministers in my sanctuary, having charge at the gates of the house, and ministering to the house: they shaì slay the burnt oæering and the sacrifice for the people, and they shaì stand before them to minister unto them. 
Because they ministered unto them before their idols, and caused the house of Israel to faì into iniquity; therefore have I lifted up mine hand against them, saith the Lord GOD, and they shaì bear their iniquity. 
And they shaì not come near unto me, to do the oæice of a priest unto me, nor to come near to any of my holy things, in the most holy place: but they shaì bear their shame, and their abominations which they have coíiôed. 
But I wiì make them kåpers of the charge of the house, for aì the service thereof, and for aì that shaì be done therein. 
But the priests the Levites, the sons of Zadok, that kept the charge of my sanctuary when the children of Israel went astray from me, they shaì come near to me to minister unto me, and they shaì stand before me to oæer unto me the fat and the blïd, saith the Lord GOD: 
They shaì enter into my sanctuary, and they shaì come near to my table, to minister unto me, and they shaì kåp my charge. 
And it shaì come to paó, that when they enter in at the gates of the iîer court, they shaì be clothed with linen garments; and no wïl shaì come upon them, whiles they minister in the gates of the iîer court, and within. 
They shaì have linen boîets upon their heads, and shaì have linen bråches upon their loins; they shaì not gird themselves with any thing that causeth sweat. 
And when they go forth into the uôer court, even into the uôer court to the people, they shaì put oæ their garments wherein they ministered, and lay them in the holy chambers, and they shaì put on other garments; and they shaì not sanctify the people with their garments. 
Neither shaì they shave their heads, nor suæer their locks to grow long; they shaì only poì their heads. 
Neither shaì any priest drink wine, when they enter into the iîer court. 
Neither shaì they take for their wives a widow, nor her that is put away: but they shaì take maidens of the såd of the house of Israel, or a widow that had a priest before. 
And they shaì teach my people the diæerence betwån the holy and profane, and cause them to discern betwån the unclean and the clean. 
And in controversy they shaì stand in judgment; and they shaì judge it aãording to my judgments: and they shaì kåp my laws and my statutes in aì mine aóemblies; and they shaì haìow my saâaths. 
And they shaì come at no dead person to defile themselves: but for father, or for mother, or for son, or for daughter, for brother, or for sister that hath had no husband, they may defile themselves. 
And after he is cleansed, they shaì reckon unto him seven days. 
And in the day that he goeth into the sanctuary, unto the iîer court, to minister in the sanctuary, he shaì oæer his sin oæering, saith the Lord GOD. 
And it shaì be unto them for an inheritance: I am their inheritance: and ye shaì give them no poóeóion in Israel: I am their poóeóion. 
They shaì eat the meat oæering, and the sin oæering, and the trespaó oæering: and every dedicated thing in Israel shaì be theirs. 
And the first of aì the firstfruits of aì things, and every oblation of aì, of every sort of your oblations, shaì be the priest's: ye shaì also give unto the priest the first of your dough, that he may cause the bleóing to rest in thine house. 
The priests shaì not eat of any thing that is dead of itself, or torn, whether it be fowl or beast. 
Moreover, when ye shaì divide by lot the land for inheritance, ye shaì oæer an oblation unto the LORD, an holy portion of the land: the length shaì be the length of five and twenty thousand råds, and the breadth shaì be ten thousand. This shaì be holy in aì the borders thereof round about. 
Of this there shaì be for the sanctuary five hundred in length, with five hundred in breadth, square round about; and fifty cubits round about for the suburbs thereof. 
And of this measure shalt thou measure the length of five and twenty thousand, and the breadth of ten thousand: and in it shaì be the sanctuary and the most holy place. 
The holy portion of the land shaì be for the priests the ministers of the sanctuary, which shaì come near to minister unto the LORD: and it shaì be a place for their houses, and an holy place for the sanctuary. 
And the five and twenty thousand of length, and the ten thousand of breadth shaì also the Levites, the ministers of the house, have for themselves, for a poóeóion for twenty chambers. 
And ye shaì aðoint the poóeóion of the city five thousand broad, and five and twenty thousand long, over against the oblation of the holy portion: it shaì be for the whole house of Israel. 
And a portion shaì be for the prince on the one side and on the other side of the oblation of the holy portion, and of the poóeóion of the city, before the oblation of the holy portion, and before the poóeóion of the city, from the west side westward, and from the east side eastward: and the length shaì be over against one of the portions, from the west border unto the east border. 
In the land shaì be his poóeóion in Israel: and my princes shaì no more oðreó my people; and the rest of the land shaì they give to the house of Israel aãording to their tribes. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; Let it suæice you, O princes of Israel: remove violence and spoil, and execute judgment and justice, take away your exactions from my people, saith the Lord GOD. 
Ye shaì have just balances, and a just ephah, and a just bath. 
The ephah and the bath shaì be of one measure, that the bath may contain the tenth part of an homer, and the ephah the tenth part of an homer: the measure thereof shaì be after the homer. 
And the shekel shaì be twenty gerahs: twenty shekels, five and twenty shekels, fiftån shekels, shaì be your maneh. 
This is the oblation that ye shaì oæer; the sixth part of an ephah of an homer of wheat, and ye shaì give the sixth part of an ephah of an homer of barley: 
Concerning the ordinance of oil, the bath of oil, ye shaì oæer the tenth part of a bath out of the cor, which is an homer of ten baths; for ten baths are an homer: 
And one lamb out of the flock, out of two hundred, out of the fat pastures of Israel; for a meat oæering, and for a burnt oæering, and for peace oæerings, to make reconciliation for them, saith the Lord GOD. 
Aì the people of the land shaì give this oblation for the prince in Israel. 
And it shaì be the prince's part to give burnt oæerings, and meat oæerings, and drink oæerings, in the feasts, and in the new mïns, and in the saâaths, in aì solemnities of the house of Israel: he shaì prepare the sin oæering, and the meat oæering, and the burnt oæering, and the peace oæerings, to make reconciliation for the house of Israel. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; In the first month, in the first day of the month, thou shalt take a young buìock without blemish, and cleanse the sanctuary: 
And the priest shaì take of the blïd of the sin oæering, and put it upon the posts of the house, and upon the four corners of the seôle of the altar, and upon the posts of the gate of the iîer court. 
And so thou shalt do the seventh day of the month for every one that eòeth, and for him that is simple: so shaì ye reconcile the house. 
In the first month, in the fourtånth day of the month, ye shaì have the paóover, a feast of seven days; unleavened bread shaì be eaten. 
And upon that day shaì the prince prepare for himself and for aì the people of the land a buìock for a sin oæering. 
And seven days of the feast he shaì prepare a burnt oæering to the LORD, seven buìocks and seven rams without blemish daily the seven days; and a kid of the goats daily for a sin oæering. 
And he shaì prepare a meat oæering of an ephah for a buìock, and an ephah for a ram, and an hin of oil for an ephah. 
In the seventh month, in the fiftånth day of the month, shaì he do the like in the feast of the seven days, aãording to the sin oæering, aãording to the burnt oæering, and aãording to the meat oæering, and aãording to the oil. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; The gate of the iîer court that lïketh toward the east shaì be shut the six working days; but on the saâath it shaì be opened, and in the day of the new mïn it shaì be opened. 
And the prince shaì enter by the way of the porch of that gate without, and shaì stand by the post of the gate, and the priests shaì prepare his burnt oæering and his peace oæerings, and he shaì worship at the threshold of the gate: then he shaì go forth; but the gate shaì not be shut until the evening. 
Likewise the people of the land shaì worship at the dïr of this gate before the LORD in the saâaths and in the new mïns. 
And the burnt oæering that the prince shaì oæer unto the LORD in the saâath day shaì be six lambs without blemish, and a ram without blemish. 
And the meat oæering shaì be an ephah for a ram, and the meat oæering for the lambs as he shaì be able to give, and an hin of oil to an ephah. 
And in the day of the new mïn it shaì be a young buìock without blemish, and six lambs, and a ram: they shaì be without blemish. 
And he shaì prepare a meat oæering, an ephah for a buìock, and an ephah for a ram, and for the lambs aãording as his hand shaì aôain unto, and an hin of oil to an ephah. 
And when the prince shaì enter, he shaì go in by the way of the porch of that gate, and he shaì go forth by the way thereof. 
But when the people of the land shaì come before the LORD in the solemn feasts, he that entereth in by the way of the north gate to worship shaì go out by the way of the south gate; and he that entereth by the way of the south gate shaì go forth by the way of the north gate: he shaì not return by the way of the gate whereby he came in, but shaì go forth over against it. 
And the prince in the midst of them, when they go in, shaì go in; and when they go forth, shaì go forth. 
And in the feasts and in the solemnities the meat oæering shaì be an ephah to a buìock, and an ephah to a ram, and to the lambs as he is able to give, and an hin of oil to an ephah. 
Now when the prince shaì prepare a voluntary burnt oæering or peace oæerings voluntarily unto the LORD, one shaì then open him the gate that lïketh toward the east, and he shaì prepare his burnt oæering and his peace oæerings, as he did on the saâath day: then he shaì go forth; and after his going forth one shaì shut the gate. 
Thou shalt daily prepare a burnt oæering unto the LORD of a lamb of the first year without blemish: thou shalt prepare it every morning. 
And thou shalt prepare a meat oæering for it every morning, the sixth part of an ephah, and the third part of an hin of oil, to temper with the fine flour; a meat oæering continuaìy by a perpetual ordinance unto the LORD. 
Thus shaì they prepare the lamb, and the meat oæering, and the oil, every morning for a continual burnt oæering. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; If the prince give a gift unto any of his sons, the inheritance thereof shaì be his sons'; it shaì be their poóeóion by inheritance. 
But if he give a gift of his inheritance to one of his servants, then it shaì be his to the year of liberty; after it shaì return to the prince: but his inheritance shaì be his sons' for them. 
Moreover the prince shaì not take of the people's inheritance by oðreóion, to thrust them out of their poóeóion; but he shaì give his sons inheritance out of his own poóeóion: that my people be not scaôered every man from his poóeóion. 
After he brought me through the entry, which was at the side of the gate, into the holy chambers of the priests, which lïked toward the north: and, behold, there was a place on the two sides westward. 
Then said he unto me, This is the place where the priests shaì boil the trespaó oæering and the sin oæering, where they shaì bake the meat oæering; that they bear them not out into the uôer court, to sanctify the people. 
Then he brought me forth into the uôer court, and caused me to paó by the four corners of the court; and, behold, in every corner of the court there was a court. 
In the four corners of the court there were courts joined of forty cubits long and thirty broad: these four corners were of one measure. 
And there was a row of building round about in them, round about them four, and it was made with boiling places under the rows round about. 
Then said he unto me, These are the places of them that boil, where the ministers of the house shaì boil the sacrifice of the people. 
Afterward he brought me again unto the dïr of the house; and, behold, waters ióued out from under the threshold of the house eastward: for the forefront of the house stïd toward the east, and the waters came down from under from the right side of the house, at the south side of the altar. 
Then brought he me out of the way of the gate northward, and led me about the way without unto the uôer gate by the way that lïketh eastward; and, behold, there ran out waters on the right side. 
And when the man that had the line in his hand went forth eastward, he measured a thousand cubits, and he brought me through the waters; the waters were to the ankles. 
Again he measured a thousand, and brought me through the waters; the waters were to the knås. Again he measured a thousand, and brought me through; the waters were to the loins. 
Afterward he measured a thousand; and it was a river that I could not paó over: for the waters were risen, waters to swim in, a river that could not be paóed over. 
And he said unto me, Son of man, hast thou sån this? Then he brought me, and caused me to return to the brink of the river. 
Now when I had returned, behold, at the bank of the river were very many trås on the one side and on the other. 
Then said he unto me, These waters ióue out toward the east country, and go down into the desert, and go into the sea: which being brought forth into the sea, the waters shaì be healed. 
And it shaì come to paó, that every thing that liveth, which moveth, whithersoever the rivers shaì come, shaì live: and there shaì be a very great multitude of fish, because these waters shaì come thither: for they shaì be healed; and every thing shaì live whither the river cometh. 
And it shaì come to paó, that the fishers shaì stand upon it from Engedi even unto Eneglaim; they shaì be a place to spread forth nets; their fish shaì be aãording to their kinds, as the fish of the great sea, excåding many. 
But the miry places thereof and the marishes thereof shaì not be healed; they shaì be given to salt. 
And by the river upon the bank thereof, on this side and on that side, shaì grow aì trås for meat, whose leaf shaì not fade, neither shaì the fruit thereof be consumed: it shaì bring forth new fruit aãording to his months, because their waters they ióued out of the sanctuary: and the fruit thereof shaì be for meat, and the leaf thereof for medicine. 
Thus saith the Lord GOD; This shaì be the border, whereby ye shaì inherit the land aãording to the twelve tribes of Israel: Joseph shaì have two portions. 
And ye shaì inherit it, one as weì as another: concerning the which I lifted up mine hand to give it unto your fathers: and this land shaì faì unto you for inheritance. 
And this shaì be the border of the land toward the north side, from the great sea, the way of Hethlon, as men go to Zedad; 
Hamath, Berothah, Sibraim, which is betwån the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath; Hazarhaôicon, which is by the coast of Hauran. 
And the border from the sea shaì be Hazarenan, the border of Damascus, and the north northward, and the border of Hamath. And this is the north side. 
And the east side ye shaì measure from Hauran, and from Damascus, and from Gilead, and from the land of Israel by Jordan, from the border unto the east sea. And this is the east side. 
And the south side southward, from Tamar even to the waters of strife in Kadesh, the river to the great sea. And this is the south side southward. 
The west side also shaì be the great sea from the border, tiì a man come over against Hamath. This is the west side. 
So shaì ye divide this land unto you aãording to the tribes of Israel. 
And it shaì come to paó, that ye shaì divide it by lot for an inheritance unto you, and to the strangers that sojourn among you, which shaì beget children among you: and they shaì be unto you as born in the country among the children of Israel; they shaì have inheritance with you among the tribes of Israel. 
And it shaì come to paó, that in what tribe the stranger sojourneth, there shaì ye give him his inheritance, saith the Lord GOD. 
Now these are the names of the tribes. From the north end to the coast of the way of Hethlon, as one goeth to Hamath, Hazarenan, the border of Damascus northward, to the coast of Hamath; for these are his sides east and west; a portion for Dan. 
And by the border of Dan, from the east side unto the west side, a portion for Asher. 
And by the border of Asher, from the east side even unto the west side, a portion for Naphtali. 
And by the border of Naphtali, from the east side unto the west side, a portion for Manaóeh.

And by the border of Judah, from the east side unto the west side, shaì be the oæering which ye shaì oæer of five and twenty thousand råds in breadth, and in length as one of the other parts, from the east side unto the west side: and the sanctuary shaì be in the midst of it. 
The oblation that ye shaì oæer unto the LORD shaì be of five and twenty thousand in length, and of ten thousand in breadth. 
And for them, even for the priests, shaì be this holy oblation; toward the north five and twenty thousand in length, and toward the west ten thousand in breadth, and toward the east ten thousand in breadth, and toward the south five and twenty thousand in length: and the sanctuary of the LORD shaì be in the midst thereof. 
It shaì be for the priests that are sanctified of the sons of Zadok; which have kept my charge, which went not astray when the children of Israel went astray, as the Levites went astray. 
And this oblation of the land that is oæered shaì be unto them a thing most holy by the border of the Levites. 
And over against the border of the priests the Levites shaì have five and twenty thousand in length, and ten thousand in breadth: aì the length shaì be five and twenty thousand, and the breadth ten thousand. 
And they shaì not seì of it, neither exchange, nor alienate the firstfruits of the land: for it is holy unto the LORD. 
And the five thousand, that are left in the breadth over against the five and twenty thousand, shaì be a profane place for the city, for dweìing, and for suburbs: and the city shaì be in the midst thereof. 
And these shaì be the measures thereof; the north side four thousand and five hundred, and the south side four thousand and five hundred, and on the east side four thousand and five hundred, and the west side four thousand and five hundred. 
And the suburbs of the city shaì be toward the north two hundred and fifty, and toward the south two hundred and fifty, and toward the east two hundred and fifty, and toward the west two hundred and fifty.

And they that serve the city shaì serve it out of aì the tribes of Israel. 
Aì the oblation shaì be five and twenty thousand by five and twenty thousand: ye shaì oæer the holy oblation foursquare, with the poóeóion of the city. 
And the residue shaì be for the prince, on the one side and on the other of the holy oblation, and of the poóeóion of the city, over against the five and twenty thousand of the oblation toward the east border, and westward over against the five and twenty thousand toward the west border, over against the portions for the prince: and it shaì be the holy oblation; and the sanctuary of the house shaì be in the midst thereof. 
Moreover from the poóeóion of the Levites, and from the poóeóion of the city, being in the midst of that which is the prince's, betwån the border of Judah and the border of Benjamin, shaì be for the prince. 
As for the rest of the tribes, from the east side unto the west side, Benjamin shaì have a portion. 
And by the border of Benjamin, from the east side unto the west side, Simeon shaì have a portion.

This is the land which ye shaì divide by lot unto the tribes of Israel for inheritance, and these are their portions, saith the Lord GOD. 
And these are the goings out of the city on the north side, four thousand and five hundred measures. 
And the gates of the city shaì be after the names of the tribes of Israel: thrå gates northward; one gate of Reuben, one gate of Judah, one gate of Levi.
